metadata.dc:title: JEEVES ACQUIRES INFOCUBE, ONE OF ITS LARGEST PARTNERS, STRENGTHENING JEEVES’ VALUE PROPOSITION IN THE SWEDISH MARKET
metadata.dc:description: Stockholm, Sweden, 12 June 2013. Jeeves Information Systems AB, a leading developer of ERP systems for small and medium businesses within the manufacturing, distribution and service industries, today announced that it has closed on its acquisition of Infocube AB, one of its largest partners. By acquiring Infocube, Jeeves moves to a dual distribution strategy in Sweden that now includes a direct channel.
metadata.dc:creator: Tskjaergaard
metadata.field:
Jeff Tognoni, CEO of Jeeves, said, “Jeeves has historically been an indirect software business sold primarily through partners. However, over the years, some of our customers and prospects have expressed an interest in having a direct relationship with us. While we will continue to offer a robust partner channel going forward, this acquisition provides Jeeves with a strong direct channel capability that was not available in Sweden in the past and offers a stronger value proposition to both new and existing customers. It significantly changes and accelerates our go-to-market strategy and expands our total addressable market (TAM).

“With the acquisition of Infocube, Jeeves gains a successful, mature service organization with a culture of excellence and experienced resources to serve those customers who prefer to have a direct relationship with us. Infocube’s capabilities include broad implementation experience with a proven methodology, a skilled customer support team, and an effective sales organization,” said Tognoni.

Henrik Engberg, CEO of Infocube, said; “This is a natural stage for Infocube to combine our two companies, offering growth and opportunities for our employees and increasing our capabilities to serve Jeeves customers. By combining the expertise of Jeeves’ product development force with Infocube’s implementation and customer development skills, the customer offerings are strengthened in all ways.”

ABOUT JEEVES

Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and medium businesses within the manufacturing, distribution and service industries. Each day, more than 4,600 companies in over 40 countries use one of Jeeves ERP systems. Jeeves ERP has a base of comprehensive features along with extraordinary capabilities for extending the application to support customer’s strategic business initiatives and requirements. Jeeves is headquartered in Stockholm and is owned by U.S. investment firm Battery Ventures. For more information, see www.jeeves.se/us/.

ABOUT INFOCUBE

Infocube has been a Jeeves Partner since 1999 with over 350 customers in 21 countries. Infocube has more than 100 employees and has offices in Gothenburg, Stockholm, Malmö, Jönköping, Karlstad and Chicago (USA). Infocube has focused on serving companies in manufacturing and logistics, as well as the fashion industry. Infocube is a full-suite ERP consulting company with sales, services and support.

FOR MORE INFORMATION:

Media relations

Tore Skjærgård, Jeeves Information Systems

E-mail: tore.skjaergaard@jeeves.se

Phone: +47 916 83 409

metadata.dc:title: Constructor’s rollout of Jeeves continues
metadata.dc:description: Constructor, which manufactures storage, archiving and logistic solutions, continues its rollout of Jeeves Enterprise Financial with operations and implementation partner Infocube AB.
metadata.dc:creator: Tskjaergaard
metadata.field:
Constructor, which manufactures storage, archiving and logistic solutions, continues its rollout of Jeeves Enterprise Financial with operations and implementation partner Infocube AB.

metadata.dc:title: Lindex owners choose Jeeves for Seppälä
metadata.dc:description: We are pleased to announce that Stockmann has chosen to implement Jeeves at Seppälä, another member of its fashion chain business unit.
metadata.dc:creator: Tskjaergaard
metadata.field:
For the past several years, Lindex, part of the Finnish Stockmann Group’s fashion chain business unit, has been using Jeeves ERP with Infocube AB as its operational and implementation partner. We are pleased to announce that Stockmann has chosen to implement Jeeves at Seppälä, another member of its fashion chain business unit.

For more information and contact:
Marked and sales Manager Sami Aaraj; sami.aaraj@infocube.se

Read more about Lindex here

metadata.dc:title: SodaStream's business is bubbling in the Nordic region
metadata.dc:description: Beverage company SodaStream was facing the challenge to quickly coordinate purchases and sales in a completely new Nordic company.
metadata.dc:creator: Tskjaergaard
metadata.field:
Beverage company SodaStream was facing the challenge to quickly coordinate purchases and sales in a completely new Nordic company. Another challenge was to make the process as transparent as possible so that all four Nordic countries would be able to interact internally (e.g., move goods from one warehouse to another). The solution was to install Jeeves in Sweden and, in the space of four months, launch it in the rest of Scandinavia. Jeeves has worked from the start, lowering SodaStream’s inventory costs, reducing administration, and improving customer service. 

Read more about SodaStream here

For more information and contact: 
Karin Rosenius Gahm; karin.roseniusgahm@evry.com

metadata.dc:title: Smarteq equips for good times with Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Smarteq AB, who develops and sells antennas for wireless communication, prepares for the coming trade boom by investing in a new ERP-solution based on Jeeves Universal from the consulting company Omnilog. The order includes 30 users as well as modules for financials, logistics, manufacturing and marketing.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Smarteq is one of many companies in the manufacturing business that during the current downturn looks ahead and works proactively with their IT-infrastructure.

- We feel it’s time to prepare for better days – we want to be well equipped when the economy turns and the ERP-system is crucial in making the business run smoothly, says Lars Ericson, CEO of Smarteq.
With a business that entails several advanced functions – logistics not being the least advanced – Smarteq must set high standards for their ERP-system.

- The logistics functionality in Jeeves Universal, offering the ability to manage several products at the same time and with the user-friendly menu, is well adapted for the business. At the same time, Omnilog showed great responsiveness and understanding of us and our needs in their comprehensive evaluation, says Lars Ericsson.

Smarteq invests in Omnilog´s packaging of Jeeves Universal that is developed for the automotive industry, among others, and that has had successful sales despite the downturn in the market.

- Even when the automotive industry has a recession many companies invest in cost efficient processes. Despite the crisis – or perhaps because of – we have had a number of installations within the sub-contractor channel with this packaging of Jeeves Universal, says Åsa Gislason, CEO of Omnilog.

For more information, please contact:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves,
Phone: 08-587 099 68
e-mail: lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

Lars Ericson, CEO Smarteq AB,
Phone: 0705-56 80 65
e-mail: lars.ericson@smarteq.se
www.smarteq.com

Åsa Gislason, CEO Omnilog AB,
Phone: 08-737 90 73
e-mail: asa.gislason@omnilog.se
www.omnilog.se

Facts on Smarteq
Smarteq AB develops and delivers antennas for wireless communication to and from vehicles, between machines and equipment, m2m and for wireless transfer of speech and data. The business is focused on development and sales of antenna products for OEM and the aftermarket. Manufacturing is done in eastern Europe and Asia. Smarteq has 32 employees and the marketing is made through sales channels in 30 countries. Smarteqs B-share is traded on First North with HQ Bank as Certified Adviser. For more information, see www.smarteq.com

Facts on Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of ERP-systems, who with the products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp provides companies with efficient solutions to develop and support their business processes. Jeeves ERP-system offers a wide functionality to the lowest total cost of ownership in the market*. The customers are companies with 5 to 1000 employees and are represented by approximately 4000 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and resellers. The business started in 1992 and since 1999 Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ, OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap). For further information, see www.jeeves.se
* Radar Group

Facts on Omnilog
Omnilog is a consulting company in logistics, manufacturing and financial control with 300 customers in the Nordics. 25 of these customers have a turnover of over 1bn SEK. Our customer base is wide and includes both small and big companies. The business is run of 70 experienced consultants from offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö, Linköping, Helsingborg, Nyköping, Jönköping, Skellefteå and Sundsvall. Omnilog focuses on creating measurable improvement by developing the business with an efficient IT-support. Our overview makes sure that every customer commitment results in quick results and a measurable result. In our total commitment we work together with Jeeves Information Systems AB. For more information, see www.omnilog.se.

 

Läs som pdf.

metadata.dc:title: Wigéns takes its hat off to Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Wigéns has been designing and producing different types of hats and caps since 1906. In a major venture to enhance efficiency at the company, it has now selected Jeeves' industry solution for textile and ready-to-wear companies – Jeeves For Fashion. Jeeves’ partner Evodev arranged the transaction.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
"ERP system Jeeves For Fashion, with its integrated PDM system Jeeves Design Management, is the holistic solution that best supports our industry. We will save time during production and can enhance the efficiency of our operations, from pre-orders and throughout production and purchasing, in both Sweden and at our subsidiary in Estonia. The solution supports the entire chain from the design process to accounting, which was one of our fundamental requirements," says Jan Gustafsson, CEO of Oscar Wigén.

Wigéns has 55 employees and a turnover of SEK 44 million. Its head office is in Tranås. The deal with Jeeves comprises a group license covering ERP system Jeeves Selected and PDM system Jeeves Design Management. There will be 17 users initially.

For more information, please contact:
Jan Gustafsson, CEO, Oscar Wigén
+46 708 88 66 21
jan.gustafsson@wigen.se

Håkan Magnusson, Business Partner Sales Manager
+ 46 33 44 41 35
hakan.magnusson@jeeves.se 


Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal or Garp. All products offer broad functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, go to www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Norway's Bandak Group chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Norwegian industrial conglomerate Bandak Group AS is in the middle of a growth phase where they plan to acquire more production and engineering firms. The group’s strategy is to use Jeeves Universal as its platform for further business development. The transaction initially encompasses 130 users, and has been implemented by Jeeves’ partner Logit.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Once again Jeeves has closed an important deal in Norway. The secret to Jeeves success? More and more companies are attracted by a business platform designed for evolution.

“Jeeves Universal will play a central role in our development and growth process. Now we have a future-proof platform on which to build our new corporation,” said Bandak Group CEO Bjarne Moursund.

Bandak Group develops, manufactures and supplies advanced products and technical solutions to world-leading companies in the subsea, offshore, defense and aviation industries. The group, which has 250 employees, had approximately NOK 340 million in revenues in 2009.


For more information, please contact:
Bjarne Moursund, Group CEO, Bandak Group
+47 35 96 66 00
bjarne.moursund@bandakgroup.com

Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, or Garp. All products offer broad functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves receives order from the Dutch wholesaler Triade
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems (“Jeeves”) has through its partner JIS Netherlands received an order from the Pan European wholesaler company Triade for implementation of Jeeves Universal in their entire European organization.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
– After several acquisitions of companies with different ERP-systems we’ve had a need for one uniform system for a long time. After 1.5 years of ERP-system evaluation, Jeeves Universal has fulfilled our demands of flexibility and efficiency for internal transactions, says Wim Pols, CFO Triade Netherlands.

Triade is one of Holland´s biggest wholesale companies of electronics for professionals and for home usage. Triade delivers products from over 120 vendors to retailers with totally more than 5 000 sales outlets. During 2007 Triade´s revenues amounted to approximately 1 billion Euros. Triade has approximately 600 employees in the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxemburg, Denmark, Spain and Portugal. Among Triade´s largest shareholders are ABN AMRO Capital and Friesland Bank Investments.

- Triade is a strategic customer for us. Triade is a fast growing mid-sized logistics company with the need of an integrated system. They are a perfect match for us and we have been competing with all the big names. This is at the same time a breakthrough for our collaboration with our partner JIS Netherlands and a confirmation that JIS Netherlands and Jeeves are as competitive in Holland as Jeeves is in Sweden, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves.

Jeeves Information Systems´ partner JIS Netherlands will initiate the implementation at Triade instantaneously and it will be fully installed by May 1st 2009. The order comprises the first of three roll-out steps, in which sequel orders are expected later 2008 and early 2009.

- We are proud to see that Jeeves´ ERP-solution suits Triade’s growing business. For us it means that we can add a very important company to our growing Jeeves customer base. The fact that Triade has chosen us, strengthens our believes that we can make Jeeves not only the fastest growing system in Europe, but in the Netherlands as well, says Jos Bruins, CEO JIS Netherlands.

For more information, please contact:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves, tel: +468 587 099 00
e-mail: lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

Edwin Bruinenberg, Jeeves Account Manager at JIS Netherlands,
tel: +316 52 34 44 66
e-mail: edwin.bruinenberg@jisnl.com
www.jisnl.com


Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Europe´s fastest growing supplier of ERP-systems (Gartner, August 2006). The Jeeves Information Systems AB group of companies develops ERP- systems for companies within the manufacturing, trade, maintenance and service sectors. Jeeves concentrates on product development, while sales are channeled through partners and resellers. In total Jeeves has around 70 partners globally. In Sweden partners are represented on 20 locations.
The main products are Jeeves Universal and Garp, all in all installed at over 3 900 companies. Present operations started in 1992 and the company has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 1999. www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Q3 Jan-Mar 2008
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves delivers profitable growth
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
January – September 2008
•    Turnover amounted to SEK 110.9 million (94.5) and increased by 17% (11)
•    Software revenues amounted to SEK 91.3 million (82.3) and increased by 11% (10)
•    The operating profit was SEK 13.2 million (12.9) and the operating margin was 12% (14)
•    Net results after tax amounted to SEK 10.9 million (10.7) and the net margin 10% (11)
•    Earnings per share after taxes were SEK 3.9 (3.6)
•    The cash flow was SEK –1.7 million (2.1) including the dividend and cash and current investments amounted to SEK 34.7 million (32.1)
•    The equity/assets ratio amounted to 36% (36)


CEO’s comments on the results
Jeeves has delivered profitable growth for 6.5 years in every individual quarter. We continue to win new customers and our customer base is growing. Sales in the third quarter were solid. The share of consultancy revenues grew, primarily related to the acquisition of the Norwegian company LogIT Gruppen.

During the third quarter, we sold the first licenses for Jeeves Selected, aimed at small, high-growth enterprises. Our recent Norwegian acquisition, together with our other international business activities, developed favorably.

We see a solid underlying demand for ERP systems in that many customers still have outdated solutions. Uncertainty regarding trends in the economy makes estimates of sales somewhat harder to predict. At the same time we see new opportunities in the fact that we provide the system with the lowest cost of ownership on the market when investments in rationalization are prioritized.

Read the entire report

metadata.dc:title: PISA to change name to Jeeves Design Management
metadata.dc:description: Through the acquisition of the PDM system PISA, the ERP system developer Jeeves has strengthened its offering to the textile and apparel industry. As part of the Jeeves for Fashion concept, PISA is now changing its name to Jeeves Design Management.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeeves Design Management is currently used by around twenty design and apparel companies, including Nudie Jeans and Eton Fashion. Ingela Cronholm-Edgren is Sales Manager of Jeeves for Fashion.

“The PDM system is an important piece of the puzzle in terms of succeeding in the industry, as it creates structure in the company. Jeeves Design Management makes it easy to keep track of everything from complete collections to garment sketches, material structure and lists of measurements. It is now also fully integrated with Jeeves’ ERP system, making it even more efficient.”  

In addition to Jeeves Design Management, the Jeeves for Fashion concept includes Jeeves ERP with functionality for variant management and Jeeves Design Box, which consists of design applications and peripheral services.

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Sjökvist, Product Manager, Jeeves
+46 8 587 099 39
magnus.sjokvist@jeeves.se

Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, or Garp. All products offer broad functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, see www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves and SYSteam win IBM distinction
metadata.dc:description: – A strong acknowledgement of Jeeves' success. IBM has named Jeeves Information Systems and SYSteam "Value Net Partners" of the year. The distinction acknowledges Jeeves' strong position as ERP system supplier to the Swedish market for small and midsize companies.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The distinction from IBM shows that Jeeves has a strong position in the Swedish ERP system market. Our business model is set up so that our product is taken to the market via partners. The award is proof of our model's effectiveness and that our close collaboration with SYSteam is a success," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Manager at Jeeves.

According to IBM's award ruling, the wining partner constellation of Jeeves and SYSteam "has very successfully sold a number of solutions based on IBM System X technology over the years. This truly value-creating collaboration has generated over 15 new customers in the past year. In addition, a technological cooperation has been establish to make several IBM platforms possible."

Last week marked IBM Svenska AB's partner conference "IBM Partner Summit", the year's most important meeting place in Sweden for IBM when it comes to meeting its business partners. The sixth-annual conference had the theme "Cooperate for growth" and attracted approximately 400 participants from various partners. Just like last year, IBM management, business units and partner managers met with their business partners in Tylösand, Halmstad for approximately 120 different training sessions offered over the course of three days. On Wednesday evening, awards were given out, acknowledge the efforts of IBM partners over the past year.

Read more at http://www.ibm.com/news/se/sv

 

View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves facilitates internationalization
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves strengthens its position as an international supplier of ERP-systems, by establishing an organization supporting the growing number of international customers. Initially Jeeves is setting up subsidiaries in Germany and United Kingdom in purpose of, together with partners, facilitating the customers’ internationalization and efficiency.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
- Our international client base is growing and we see an increasing need to
simplify the process of coordinating, implementing and localizing Jeeves
Universal in our customers’ subsidiaries worldwide, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik,
CEO Jeeves. This is an important step in strengthening our ability to support
larger international customers.

The subsidiaries will recruit personnel with experience of international project
management as well as knowledge of country specific ERP requirements and
business processes demands.

- Our objective is to provide partners and customers with a competent
organization able to handle the complexity of implementing an ERP system
internationally, says Bernt Olausson, Business Development Director Jeeves.

ITAB Shop Concept, who is implementing Jeeves Universal in several international
subsidiaries, will during 2009 become the first customer to benefit from Jeeves’ new
support organization.

For more information, please contact:
Bernt Olausson, Business Development Director Jeeves
Tel: +46 33 44 4104
E-mail: bernt.olausson@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Business processes in focus in Jeeves 2.0
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves is launching new versions of ERP systems Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected. These include a number of innovations with a focus on improving business processes and increasing efficiency for end users.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeeves Universal targets medium-sized companies (50-1000 employees) and Jeeves Selected smaller growth companies (5-50 employees). New features in version 2.0 of the systems are mainly addressed to companies in the distribution, manufacturing and service industries, which are all key customer groups to Jeeves, and includes;

  • A new embedded process modeling tool to describe business processes and expand possibilities to adapt menus and functionality to the user's role within the company. It also includes a library of so-called "best practice" business processes, which are described in the tool. All in purpose to make the end user more efficient.
  • Solutions explicitly designed for distribution and manufacturing companies. Implementation will be speeded up and simplified in the delivery of:
    - Jeeves Selected - Distribution
    - Jeeves Selected – Manufacturing
    - Jeeves Universal - Distribution
    - Jeeves Universal - Manufacturing
  • The most advanced functions on the market for variant management to handle sizes, colors, grades, etc. for distributors in for example the fashion industry.
  • A new security solution with enhanced ability to monitor and control users' access to different types of information. It also provides enhanced support for different requirements concerning corporate governance.
  • Vigorous efforts to deliver a more internationalized product to support customers with international operations.

- Our aim is always to increase the competitiveness of our customers. We have done so in the new versions of Jeeves Universal and Selected by getting closer to the end users and enhancing their possibilities to work efficiently. Our customers have influenced our work to improve our offer and adapt even better to their needs, says Magnus Sjökvist, Product Director Jeeves.

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Sjökvist, Product Director, Jeeves Information Systems, +46-(0)8-587 099 39,  magnus.sjokvist@jeeves.se

 

Read as pdf.

metadata.dc:title: Frank Dandy will grow seamlessly with Jeeves ERP
metadata.dc:description: Built-in variant management and ability to grow seamlessly were deciding factors when Frank Dandy, a Swedish fashion company, chose ERP-system Jeeves Selected. Also, the confidence in Jeeves’ partner Infocube who sold and will implement the system contributed to the decision.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
For a clothing company like Frank Dandy, variant management, i.e. the handling of particular sizes, colors and qualities, is an important process. In Jeeves, this solution is available in its standard functionality.

- With Jeeves Selected we will get a tailored solution without having to make any customizations ourselves. The variant management solution was one of the deciding factors in the decision process. We get a user friendly system to add on functionality as we grow and needs arise. The possibility to seamlessly grow into a complex system is hard to find – most systems demand a change of both platform and system, says Niclas Winroth,CFO at Frank Dandy.

- We are proud of Frank Dandy’s choice of us as partner and we see a great potential in the industry. More and more companies shows an interest in our fashion industry packaging of Jeeves Selected, where the variant management is one example of many possibilities in making industry specific business processes more efficient, says Jonas Hammarberg, vice president at Infocube.


For more information:

metadata.dc:title: The most popular ERP-System in Sweden is developed by Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Swedish Jeeves is "Sweden's most popular ERP-system, 2009" ahead of competitors such as SAP, Microsoft and IFS. This is shown by Exido’s annual independent study, the IT-barometer, conducted among over 1,000 Swedish companies.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The cost of ownership and the ability to support business processes are two main factors that made Jeeves climb from third to first place in the category "Sweden's most popular ERP-system" this year. The result is based on the conjunction of more than 1,000 respondents' view of an ideal ERP-supplier together with their opinion on performance, competence and price of various ERP-systems.

- This confirms that our investments in low cost of ownership, flexibility and scalability are in line with companies´ demands. Customers are realizing the importance of the ERP-system's impact on their business processes and ultimately their business success, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

- I am also very glad to see that a Swedish company wins this competition. We are happy and proud.
Visma finished second, and last year’s winner Microsoft finished third.

About Exido | The IT-barometer
Twice a year, Exido conducts a survey of over 1,000 IT managers in Sweden. A part of the survey is the IT managers grading of the various suppliers. Since 2002, Exido has followed the IT market as a whole, and in its various segments. The IT barometer is considered the best source of knowledge about how the market thinks and acts in Sweden.

For more information:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves Information Systems +46 8587 099 00, bengt-ake.algevik@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of ERP-systems, who with the products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp provides companies with efficient solutions to develop and support their business processes. Jeeves ERP-system offers a wide functionality to the lowest total cost of ownership in the market*. The customers are companies with 5 to 1000 employees and are represented by approximately 4000 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and resellers. metadata.dc:title: Jeeves applies for delisting
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
BV Acquisitions AB (“BV Acquisitions”), a company controlled by Battery Ventures IX (AIV II), L.P., announced on 10 May 2012 that the public tender offer for Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ) (“Jeeves”) was declared wholly unconditional and that it will be completed. BV Acquisitions controlled after the initial acceptance period shares representing approximately 97 per cent of the shares and votes in Jeeves and warrants representing approximately 99 per cent of the outstanding warrants in Jeeves. After the extended acceptance period, which expired on 29 May 2012, BV Acquisitions holds approximately 98 per cent of the shares and votes in Jeeves and 100 per cent of the outstanding warrants in Jeeves. BV Acquisitions has also initiated a compulsory acquisition procedure regarding the remaining shares in Jeeves.

Based on the above, the board of directors of Jeeves considers that it is no longer justified for Jeeves to remain listed and has therefore, on 1 June 2012, resolved to request that the shares of Jeeves are delisted from NASDAQ OMX Stockholm, Small Cap.

Last day for trading in the Jeeves’ shares on NASDAQ OMX Stockholm will be announced as soon as Jeeves has received notice thereof from NASDAQ OMX Stockholm.

The board of directors of Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ)


For questions, please contact:
CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik, +46 8 587 099 00 or
CFO Anna Salomon-Sörensen, +46 8 587 099 45

Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ) discloses the information provided herein pursuant to the Swedish Securities Market Act, the Swedish Financial Instruments Trading Act and/or NASDAQ OMX Stockholm’s Rule Book for Issuers. This information was submitted for publication on 4 June 2012 at 08.30 (CET).

This press release has been published in Swedish and English. In the event of any discrepancy in content between the language versions, the Swedish version shall prevail.

metadata.dc:title: RIMA switches to Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Swedish manufacturer RIMA has chosen the ERP system Jeeves Universal to support its operations. The transaction covers about 10 user licenses, and Jeeves’ partner Ninetech is responsible for implementation.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
RIMA, whose official name is Richard Magnusson AB, is a third-generation family business that manufactures and supplies gaskets, packings, and maintenance products to various industrial segments. When the company’s existing ERP system was put out to pasture, a new, modern solution was needed.

“After evaluating numerous alternatives, we chose Jeeves Universal. We realize that now we’ll be able to streamline and improve our accounting functions and even our routines for orders, inventory, and invoicing. The final choice was easy, because we already had a relationship with Jeeves’ partner Ninetech, who has our complete confidence,” says Lars-Göran Magnusson, CEO of RIMA.

Jeeves’ partner Ninetech will implement the system during spring 2011.


For more information:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director, Jeeves Information Systems
+46-8-5870-9968, lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Lars-Göran Magnusson, CEO, RIMA
+46-31-779-9892, lars-goran.magnusson@rima.se, www.rima.se


Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, or Garp. All products offer broad functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves bolsters its position in Finland
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves has signed a partnership agreement with Merit Consulting Oy in Finland. The agreement covers the sale and implementation of Jeeves’ ERP systems. This move bolsters the company’s position in the Finnish market.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
For some time, Merit Consulting has partnered with Lawson, a U.S. supplier of ERP systems, and has extensive business in Finland. Now they are adding Jeeves’ products to their offering with the aim of expanding sales to the SME segment.

In 2009, Jeeves signed a similar agreement with Merit Consulting for the Swedish market. Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves, considers this new agreement an extension of their collaboration, giving ample opportunity to win market shares in the Nordic region.

Merit Consulting currently has 40 consultants around Finland who specialize in ERP-systems. In addition, the company has consultants in Sweden, Norway, Denmark, the UK, and the Benelux countries. The company has many years’ experience in business development for food and beverage, manufacturing and distribution companies.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO, Jeeves Information Systems, phone: +46-8-5870-9965

The products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, and Garp offer broad functionality at a cost of ownership among the lowest in the market. Customers currently include more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries. metadata.dc:title: Jeeves buys back shares
metadata.dc:description: The Jeeves Information Systems management has executed the board's decision to buy back shares in the company.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
From September 3 to September 13, 2007, Jeeves Information Systems AB bought back 148,249 shares, which the company intends to invalidate. This corresponds to approximately 5% of the total capital and number of votes in the company. The buyback was at an average rate of SEK 69.94 and totals SEK 10,369,080.

The buyback was in line with the board's decision from August 28, 2007 to within the framework of the authorization from the annual general meeting of May 15, 2007 provide execution management for the buyback of no more than 5% of the total number of shares. Prior to September 3 (the start of the buyback), Jeeves held no own shares.

The total number of shares in Jeeves Information Systems (prior to invalidation of the shares that were bought back) is 2,987,864.

For additional information, please contact:
Magnus Björnum, CFO, tel: +46 (0)8-587 099 45

metadata.dc:title: Shipping Company Greenship Chooses Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves together with its partner InfoCube has closed a deal with shipping company Greenship to implement Jeeves Universal throughout its international operations. Jeeves Universal will replace several of Greenship's current ERP system solutions.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
-The ERP system is the most vital component for controlling our marine cargo
processes, says Mikael Borgman, IT Manager at Greenship. Jeeves Universal
provides us with a competitive ERP system that can manage all of our international
operations. With Jeeves, we’re able to continue our expansion and develop
Greenship's business into the future.

Greenship, a subsidiary of the Björk.Eklund Group, offers global transportation
services to customers in Scandinavia and the Baltic countries. The company was
founded in 2000 and has since experienced dramatic growth. It currently has 120
employees in 7 subsidiaries. Jeeves Universal will be implemented throughout its
operations. In addition, the parent company, the Björk.Eklund Group, will use Jeeves
Universal for financial management. The initial order consists of 40 user licenses.

The deal was signed by Jeeves Information Systems' partner InfoCube.

-This deal is an important milestone for Jeeves in the transportation sector. It
highlights Jeeves' strong offering for expansive international businesses with
complex workflows, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves. We look forward
to becoming a solid partner for Greenship together with our partner, InfoCube.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves strengthens functionality for master planning and inventory management through product acquisitioning
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves has acquired the two products Amase and Stockwizard from 2*PRO for the purpose of further strengthening the ERP system support for manufacturing and distributing companies. The new products are targeting small to midsize companies to gain inventory control through management by objectives and at the same time increase efficiency.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The product acquisition is part of Jeeves' strategy to strengthen its position for
manufacturing and distributing companies with software that offers high quality as
well as the leading edge.

- Amase and Stockwizard are well-tried and recognized products. With 2*PRO's
products, we can offer our customers an improved logistics solution that includes
functionality for master planning and inventory management that can be easily used
along with Jeeves, says Magnus Sjökvist, Product Director at Jeeves.

The products have functionality for master planning and advanced inventory
management. The functionality means that companies can maintain a high level of
customer service as well as a low stock inventory cost. The new tools offer support
for all the needs during a product's entire life cycle.

2*PRO has 20 years experience in the logistics business and has a customer base
with a high level of customer satisfaction. One of the reasons is the user friendliness
of their products.

-The acquisition of 2*PRO's products will favour our current and future customers
within all of our segments – distribution, manufacturing and service, says Magnus
Sjökvist.

metadata.dc:title: Norwegian Noca to reach new heights with Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: Satellites, naval vessels, and submarines—Noca’s electronics are found in outer space as well as deep under the ocean. As part of the company’s efforts to continuously enhance its operations, Noca has chosen to invest in a new ERP system: Jeeves Universal. Logitgruppen of Norway are behind the transaction.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
“One of the criteria we had for choosing a new ERP system was that it should support our goal of continuous improvement of the company’s procedures and processes. Of the 10 suppliers of ERP systems that we evaluated, Jeeves offered the best alternative,” says Pål Rune Johansen, CEO of Noca.

Noca develops and produces electronics for customers around the world. The company’s products are installed in the world’s largest submarine as well as in one of the world’s most advanced naval vessels. The company was founded in 1986 and currently has 60 employees. Their head office is in Trondheim, Norway.

“One thing our customers have in common is that they make stringent demands on the flexibility of their ERP system and its ability to grow with their company. They can do that with Jeeves Universal. Naturally we’re proud to have Noca as a new customer,” says Torulf Nilsson, CEO of Logitgruppen.

For more information:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director, Jeeves Information Systems

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves sells ERP operations of subsidiary Reveny
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves has signed a sales agreement regarding ERP operations of subsidiary Reveny System AB, with Jeeves partner Ninetech AB. The sale includes operations of sales, implementation and support of Reveny, Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected ERP-systems.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Transfer date is December 1, 2009. The transaction is expected to have a limited positive effect on Jeeves' operating profit for 2009. Short-term, Jeeves annual turnover will be reduced by approximately 7 percent and the transaction will have a slightly positive impact on profitability.

Beside operations of Jeeves’ ERP and maintenance of the customer base for the ERP-system Reveny, Reveny also manages sales and implementation of the HR-system HRM Software. Since the company was acquired by Jeeves 2002, a number of customers have replaced their Reveny ERP system with Jeeves ERP. The sale includes operations and customer bases for Reveny and Jeeves systems. Buyer Ninetech is a Jeeves partner that delivers complete IT solutions.

- Jeeves acquired Reveny in order to provide customers a transfer to Jeeves ERP-systems and build expertise, which now successfully has been achieved. With a broader offering, the operations can be further developed by Ninetech, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves.

- The acquisition strengthens our market position and further establishes ourselves in Gothenburg. We will get access to an attractive customer base and additional skilled employees, says Ulf Sandlund, CEO Ninetech AB.

For more information:

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves ERP system makes HAGS playgrounds even more fun
metadata.dc:description: The Swedish company HAGS Aneby AB, one of the largest suppliers of playground equipment and park furniture in the world, is switching to a Jeeves ERP system. Jeeves partner SYSteam conducted the transaction and will perform the implementation. The system will be rolled out to around 100 users in the initial phase of the project.
metadata.dc:creator: sofiaemanuelsson
metadata.field:
An ERP system really can make playgrounds more fun. The objective is for salespeople and customers alike to be able to customise their orders for fun, creative playgrounds that sell well.

”For us, development and innovation are the keys to successful sales. Playgrounds and products should inspire children to play, while being safe and secure at the same time,” said Jan Johansson, Managing Director of HAGS Aneby AB. “The Jeeves ERP system will allow us to develop our business management in several areas, especially the configuration of sales and products, allowing both salespeople and customers to be more innovative. The other areas we will improve in are logistics and business intelligence.”

Jeeves will initially be rolled out in Sweden, and then in several international sales companies.

HAGS Aneby AB has sales of approximately SEK 600 million, in around 70 countries.


For more information:

Most recently, Anna Salomon-Sörensen held the position of CFO at SIX AB (publ). During the 10 years that Anna worked for SIX, the company grew considerably both organically and through acquisitions.

-Jeeves is an exciting player in the ERP market, and I look forward to contributing to the development and growth of the company, says Anna Salomon-Sörensen, newly appointed CFO of Jeeves Information Systems.

metadata.dc:title: Nyberg’s Deli chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Nyberg’s Deli has chosen Jeeves Universal to replace its existing proprietary system following a thorough evaluation. Sharply increased demand and sales, paired with new requirements from customers, such as for EDI, called for a standardized system.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Nyberg’s Deli, a family business with its own brand, has become one of Sweden’s largest suppliers of refined pork and beef products. Quality and safe food characterize the whole operation, and Nyberg’s Deli was the first meat processing company in Sweden to receive the higher level quality accreditation in BRC Global Standard Food.

- With Jeeves Universal, we can replace all of the separate systems with a single one. At the same time, Jeeves Universal makes it much easier to plan purchasing, production, and forecasts. For implementation, we chose Jeeves partner Infocube because we found their method for conducting projects to ensure standardized implementation, increasing the security for us in a project as major as the change of our ERP system,” says Katarina Hellsén Jarvin, Partner in Nyberg’s Deli.

- We are pleased and proud that Nyberg’s Deli chose Jeeves Universal and Infocube as the supplier from among tough competition. This demonstrates that our bundled food solution, together with our knowledge of operations and methodology, is attractive to companies in the food industry,” says Carl Johan Ahlsell, Account Manager at Infocube.

The Jeeves solution for Nyberg’s Deli will be commissioned on May 3 and will initially comprise 16 users and 65 reporters.

For more information:

metadata.dc:title: Swegon chooses Jeeves’ ERP system for its international operations
metadata.dc:description: Swegon, an international supplier of ventilation systems, has purchased Jeeves Universal to deploy in its Norwegian operations. Jeeves’ partner SYSteam is behind the deal and responsible for implementation.
metadata.dc:creator: sofiaemanuelsson
metadata.field:
Swegon has purchased a groupwide license for Jeeves Universal. The intention is to eventually establish a common ERP system in all 17 of the group’s subsidiaries. First up are the Norwegian operations, for which Swegon and Jeeves’ Swedish partner SYSteam are creating a prototype, a “common model” to serve as the basis for a potential roll-out to other subsidiaries in the group in the future.

“Our goal is ‘one ERP system for all subsidiaries,’ which will lay a foundation for uniform procedures. To do that, we wanted to find a flexible ERP system with a robust user interface,” says Per Joelsson, IT Director at Swegon. “Jeeves is simple to adapt to our needs and upgrade to new versions. Our salespeople will gain access to an intuitive ERP system in which they can easily find the information they need.”

“A growing number of international groups are choosing Jeeves. With its immense flexibility and low cost of ownership, customers see major benefits in designating Jeeves as a standard application for expanding and streamlining operational management in their subsidiaries,” says Bo Oskarsson, SYSteam’s Product/Marketing Director for Jeeves.

Swegon has a presence in 18 countries and sales of SEK 2,000 million.

This transaction was completed in June and included in the earnings reported for the second quarter of 2010.

For more information:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director, Jeeves Information Systems
+46-8-5870-9968, lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Per Joelsson, IT Director, Swegon
+46-512-782-404, per.joelsson@swegon.se, www.swegon.se

metadata.dc:title: German breakthrough for Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems is proud to announce an important breakthrough in the German market. Thomas Beton, German subsidiary of concrete manufacturer Thomas Concrete Group, has chosen to replace its existing ERP system with Jeeves Enterprise.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
The deal was made through the collaboration of two Jeeves Information Systems partners - Omnilog in Sweden and eQstend in Germany. The total order value is initially estimated at SEK 3.5 million.

- "Thomas Beton will be an important reference customer for us in the German market," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director of Jeeves Information Systems.

Thomas Concrete Group operates in Sweden, Germany and Poland. The company manufactures over 4 million cubic meters of concrete each year. Swedish operations are run through the wholly owned subsidiary Färdig Betong AB, which is Sweden's largest concrete supplier. Jeeves Enterprise has supported the business-critical processes of Färdig Betong since 1999 - a solution that became the foundation of the concrete and construction industry solution that exists for Jeeves Enterprise. Thomas Concrete Group has now chosen to also implement Jeeves Enterprise in its German company, Thomas Beton.

"The combination of standard solutions and inherent flexibility in Jeeves Enterprise gives us a total solution for our industry-specific needs. It also enables us to establish a cooperation between the German and Swedish operations through the ERP system. This is in line with our ambitions to form form stronger bonds between our geographically separated operations, giving us control and utilization of resources," says Lars Wiking, CIO of Thomas Concrete Group.

The deal is a cooperation between two Jeeves partners - Swedish Omnilog and Germany eQstend. Omnilog, which already had a working relationship with Färdig Betong and the concrete and construction industry, passed on its experiences to eQstend, which will be the partner that implements Jeeves Enterprise at Thomas Beton. The total order value amounts to SEK 2.5 million and includes functions for Accounting, Production, Stock Management and Distribution.

"It is important to have cooperation between different parties. This makes it possible to spread information quickly and raises the quality of what we provide our customers. Omnilog's experience will help us at eQstend get on the right track more quickly, which not only ensures that Thomas Beton gets a quality-assured implementation but also well equips us for future projects," says Oliver Schlüter, Business Developer at eQstend.

Jeeves Information Systems considers the deal with Thomas Beton a breakthrough in the German market, even though the company has operated in Germany since 1998 and has a number of German customers.

"In Sweden, we have proven that Jeeves Enterprise is the system for midsize manufacturing companies. Thomas Beton's choice of Jeeves Enterprise is proof that with a strong product and skilled partner network, we are in serious competition for midsize companies on a global level," says Lars Dahlberg of Jeeves Information Systems.

metadata.dc:title: Year-end Report Jan–Dec 2010
metadata.dc:description: Strong new sales in the Nordic region
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
• Revenue from continuing operations totaled SEK 177.0 million (180.4), down 2% (+13)
  • Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) rose 7% (6)
  • Operating profit before depreciations and amortizations was SEK 27.7 million (28.4)
  • Operating profit was SEK 1.9 million (14.3), the operating margin 1% (8). Focusing the product strategy caused an impairment loss of SEK 11.1 million in R&D
  • Net profit totaled SEK 0.1 million (10.1), the profit margin 0% (6)
  • Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 0.02 (3.54)
  • Cash flow was SEK -16.0 million (3.8), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 25.3 million (42.2). Redemption of Jeeves’ convertible debentures has been made, SEK 12.6 million.
  • The equity/assets ratio was 34% (33)
  • The Board of Directors proposes a dividend of 1.50 per share (1.50)

 

The market has returned to normal levels, and Jeeves is expanding sales to new customers. Software revenues increased 7% during the period. EBITDA was SEK 27.7 million, in line with last year. However, the operating profit of SEK 1.9 million fell short of our expectations. We must note that fourth-quarter operating profit was charged impairment of SEK 11.1 million on capitalized research and development expenditure.

Sales for the full year ended at SEK 177.1 million, compared to SEK 181.4 million the preceding year. Sales growth faltered as a result of the divestment of the business in Reveny. During the period, revenue for comparable units increased year on year.

Our Nordic operations are doing well, as sales of licenses to new customers expanded 32% during the year. New sales were robust primarily in Sweden and Norway, which means we are winning market share. Capacity utilization in our Norwegian consulting business improved but has yet to return to the desired level. At the same time, this year’s earnings were reduced by restructuring costs.

International sales grew, and about 40% of revenues come from customers outside Sweden. However, new sales by our international partners outside the Nordic region remained weak. Our international consultants had satisfactory capacity utilization in several international roll-out projects initiated during the year.

During this quarter we made the decision to focus our product strategy on the Microsoft-based platform that serves as the foundation for our current ERP systems. To date, we have enjoyed great success, and this expands our possibilities for leveraging the potential inherent in the platform.

I have great faith in Jeeves. We have won ground as an ERP system attractive to small and medium-sized enterprises. During the year, our partners developed several cutting-edge concepts and industry solutions. New sales are increasing, we are winning more major orders in the upper portion of the SME segment, and a growing number of customers are choosing to roll out Jeeves internationally.

 

For more information:
CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik, +46 8 587 099 00 or CFO Anna Salomon-Sörensen +46 8 587 099 45.

 

About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Every day, Jeeves' ERP solutions; Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, are used by more than 4 000 companies in over 40 countries. All products offer wide functionality at one of the lowest total cost of ownership in the market. Head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden and Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves establishes partner network in North America
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves is pleased to announce the formation of a Master Partner, Jeeves North America, for the distribution of our industry leading ERP solution in North America. Through partners Jeeves North America will market Jeeves´s ERP systems in this strategically important market. At the same time, Jeeves closes its first client deals through the new Master Partner.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
– The cooperation with the co-owners at our American Master Partner gives us a
foundation for developing a partner network in North America, says Bengt-Åke
Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves. We get quick access to a sales organization with broad local
experience and professional business relations. In addition, our international
customers with operations in the USA will get improved local support. North America
is an attractive market with large long-term sales potential, offering great
opportunities for new partner recruitments.

Jeeves North America is lead by Allan Lessing, an executive with experience in
leading positions in both North America and Europe. Together with the new
management team, he has been successful in establishing a market for outside ERP
solutions in North America. Jeeves Information Systems in Stockholm owns a 15
percent share in the company.

Jeeves North America is also pleased to announce that one new Jeeves Partner has
already been established, giving Jeeves access to several important North American
areas: Los Angeles, Atlanta and Toronto.

In connection to the Master Partner agreement, two new additional customer
contracts have been signed with companies in the manufacturing sector. The orders
include a total of 100 users.

– We have since long been searching for an ERP system with extensive functionality
that meets the customer´s needs regarding flexibility, user friendliness and that easily
can be adapted to specific needs’, Allan Lessing points out. ‘We found this in Jeeves
and also found the lowest cost-of-ownership through easy upgrades.

–The establishment of a Master Partner in the North American market is in line with
our vision of becoming a leading supplier of ERP systems, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik.
To have a representation in North America is important for our growth strategy.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, tel: 08 587 099 00
E-mail: bengt.algevik@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se
Allan Lessing, CEO – Operations Jeeves North America, tel +1-905-488-0428
E-mail: alessing@jeeves-na.com
www.jeeves-na.com

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Europe´s fastest growing supplier of ERP-systems*, Jeeves Information Systems AB develops
ERP systems for companies within the manufacturing, trade, maintenance and service sectors.
Jeeves concentrates on product development, while sales are channeled through partners and
resellers. In total Jeeves has around 70 partners globally. In Sweden partners are represented at
20 locations. The main products are Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, all in all
installed at over 3 900 companies. Present operations started in 1992 and the company has been
listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 1999. www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Alignment Systems chooses Jeeves ERP system
metadata.dc:description:
– Jeeves partner SYSteam replaces ASW in big deal.
With the help of its partner SYSteam, Jeeves received an order from Alignment Systems for most modules of the Jeeves ERP system. Alignment Systems is a world-leading manufacturer of equipment for the repair and inspection of damaged vehicles. The deal is one of Jeeves' biggest deals so far this autumn.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"Alignment Systems is in an exciting phase of growth. We are replacing ASW with Jeeves to obtain a system that is flexible and upgradeable while being cost effective," says Johan Mattsson, CFO of Alignment Systems.

Alignment Systems will use most modules of the Jeeves ERP system, such as Production, Order, Inventory, Invoicing, Service and Projects. Alignment Systems will also use the newer functions for Shop Floor Control and Intra Company Transactions. Approximately 85 people will work in Jeeves and another large number of people will use Shop Floor Control functionality and the attendance system.

"The deal with Alignment is one of our bigger deals to date this autumn and shows Jeeves' strength in being able to attract big deals and customers. Naturally, we are happy that more and more companies are discovering the advantages of Jeeves and are replacing their old ERP system," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves.

The deal was struck by Jeeves' partner SYSteam.

"Introduction of Jeeves at Alignment Systems has the potential to generate many business gains. The largest individual improvements will most likely be found in areas associated with production and flows within the Group, that is to say inter-company trade (ICT)," says Mikael Brodin, Unit Manager at SYSteam.

For more information, please contact:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves, Tel: +46 (0)8-587 099 00
E-mail: lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

 

Mikael Brodin, SYSteam, Tel: +46 (0)70 342 24 32

metadata.dc:title: Peab creates efficient growth with Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems has received an order from Peab PGS to deliver the ERP system Jeeves Universal as an important part of the company’s industrial manufacturing process of apartment blocks. Initially, the order includes approximately 60 users and was won in cooperation with Jeeves’ partner SYSteam.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Peab PGS AB is a subsidiary within the construction group Peab. The company
started in 2007. Peab develops and delivers a complete building system for
apartment blocks which includes product development, manufacturing, delivery and
assembly. Residences will be built in a completely new way, which will result in
higher quality and lower costs.

Industrial construction is a strategically important venture for Peab. Jeeves Universal
fulfills Peab’s high demands of a flexible standard system able to secure precision in
logistics and manufacturing of residences.

- I am glad to say that Peab, in spite of the financial crises and its effect on the
construction businesses, is prioritizing a long term investment for their
operations. This proves that Jeeves creates possibilities to grow even in a
recession – mainly because we offer the market a competitive alternative at a
low total cost of ownership, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves.

Jeeves Universal will be implemented in several of Peab PGS´ key processes:
planning, purchasing, manufacturing and assembly. Together with product
development and configuration systems, Jeeves will form the base for the company’s
industrial construction system. A pilot version of the system was delivered in the
autumn of 2008. The implementation is planned to be completed in September 2009.

For further information, please contact:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves, +46 8 587 099 68
e-mail: lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

Bengt Jansson, CEO Peab PGS, +46 431 894 52
e-mail: bengt.jansson@peab.se
www.peab.se

Carl-Magnus Wibring, SYSteam, +46 36 14 91 17
e-mail: calle.wibring@systeam.se
www.systeam.se

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading ERP supplier with the products Jeeves Selected,
Jeeves Universal and Garp. Jeeves ERP systems provide companies with efficient solutions for
the development and support of their business processes. The Jeeves ERP systems offer a wide
functionality to the lowest total cost of ownership on the market*. It is used by around 4.000
companies in more than 40 countries. The customers are companies with 5 to 1.000 employees.
Jeeves focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and retailers. The
company started in 1992 and since 1999 Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange
(Small Cap). For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se.
* Radar Group

Facts about SYSteam
SYSteam works as a strategic and complete IT supplier and offers services within management,
engineering, ERP systems, system development/integration and technical infrastructure and
operation. SYSteam is a complete supplier to small and midsize companies as well as a
specialist to larger companies and selected trades. This specialist knowledge is also offered to
the SME-segment. Thorough knowledge of the customer’s business and processes together with
comprehensive IT knowledge makes it possible for SYSteam to provide business benefit.
SYSteam has offices and subsidiaries at around 40 places throughout northern Europe, employs
around 1,250 people and is owned by the Norwegian ErgoGroup. For more information:
www.systeam.se

metadata.dc:title: Bengt-Åke Älgevik named new CEO of Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: The Jeeves board has named Bengt-Åke Älgevik the new President and CEO of Jeeves Information Systems AB. Bengt-Åke has solid experience as a leader and entrepreneur in the IT industry - both in Sweden and USA.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"For a number of years, including 2006, Jeeves has grown with good profitability under the leadership of Nicolas Ehrling. We have successfully grown from being a small player to becoming Europe's fastest-growing ERP system. Now that we are entering the next development phase, with increased globalization and market focus, we need a new leader. With Bengt-Åke Älgevik as CEO, Jeeves gains a force with the perfect profile to lead the company," says Olle Ödman, Chairman of the Board for Jeeves Information Systems.

Bengt-Åke Älgevik is well versed in Jeeves operations and its resellers. He has been active in Jeeves as Board Member since 1995 and is also a large shareholder in the company. As Chairman of the Board for Jeeves France he successfully ran an important key project for the Group.

"Jeeves is an innovative product development company in the ERP system sector and is a market leader in Sweden with a strong partner network. We now have a stable platform with a well-proven concept to grow abroad in coming years. For many years, I have been active internationally in many different companies. I now look forward to leading Jeeves to new successes," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik.

Jeeves' current CEO, Nicolas Ehrling, will leave his position when Bengt-Åke Älgevik takes power on January 15. At the same time, Bengt-Åke Älgevik will vacate his seat on the board of Jeeves Information Systems.

According to the agreement between Jeeves and Nicolas Ehrling, he will receive twelve months of salary, of which three are for termination and nine are severance pay.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Q2 Jan-Jun 2008
metadata.dc:description: Continued growth for Jeeves ERP
metadata.dc:creator: sofiaemanuelsson
metadata.field:
January – June 2008

  • Turnover amounted to SEK 73.3 million (63.5) and increased by 16% (12)
  • Software revenues (license and maintenance) increased by 11% (10)
  • The operating profit was SEK 8.6 million (5.6) and the operating margin was 12% (9)
  • Net results after tax amounted to SEK 6.0 million (5.2) and the net margin was 8% (8)
  • Earnings per share after taxes was SEK 2.1 (1.7)
  • The cash flow was SEK 4.7 million (6.1) and cash and current investments amounted to SEK 41.0 million (36.1)
  • The debt-equity ratio was 30% (40)
  • Norwegian LogIT Gruppen has been acquired during the period. The acquisition is expected to have a positive effect on the result for 2008


CEO’s comments on the results

Jeeves’ success continues! Again we’ve achieved the best half-year result ever, and in combination with an improved increase in turnover. It is becoming increasingly evident that the market understands and appreciates those strengths that single out Jeeves’ ERP system – adaptability, user-friendliness as well as the very low cost of ownership.

We have continued to work on increased growth during the second quarter:

  • The acquisition of Norwegian LogIT Gruppen has been received well both by the organization in Norway and by the market. We see a positive influx of ”prospects”.
  • We have made more business in the whole SME segment (5-1000 users) than we have done before. With our new ERP solutions, Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected, for large and smaller companies respectively, we strengthen our position in the entire segment
  • Our international operations are developing positively. The prospect situation continues to be good both for our Swedish and our international partners.


I continue to feel confident for the future development of Jeeves!


For more information please contact:
Group CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik, +46 8 587 099 00 or CFO Magnus Björnum, +46 8 587 099 45

metadata.dc:title: EAB prepares for growth with Jeeves ERP
metadata.dc:description: EAB, a company producing storage equipment, doors and steel buildings, plans to grow. It is facilitated with a comprehensive ERP solution based on Jeeves Universal. Jeeves´ partner SYSteam accounts for the implementation and maintenance.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Based on the process mapping done by EAB and SYSteam, the choice fell on Jeeves Universal to support EAB's three different business areas.

-    We are striving to achieve as similar processes as possible in our three business areas, where activities are otherwise distinct. With the flexibility offered by Jeeves Universal, we are in a good position to achieve this. At the same time, we are planning to grow and therefore it is important with a system that is easily adjusted as we increase in size, says Stefan Höög, IT Manager at EAB.

Jeeves' partner SYSteam, who has worked with EAB for more than 20 years, also stresses the importance of flexibility in the system.

-    Jeeves Universal offers both the flexibility and the integration capabilities necessary to focus on the business impact to be achieved in the project and in the future, says Claes Andersson, responsible salesman at SYSteam.

For more information:

metadata.dc:title: Ahlmark Group chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Ahlmarks has signed a group-wide agreement for Jeeves’ ERP system. The change is aimed at streamlining and improving Ahlmark’s accounting function as well as order, inventory, and invoice handling. Jeeves’ partner Ninetech closed the deal and is responsible for delivery.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
“Jeeves satisfies our high demands for functionality and flexibility,” says Håkan Thorell, CEO, Ahlmark Group. “This ERP system integrates well with the majority of our business operations, making it the first choice when operations change or an ERP system is replaced.”

Initially the agreement covers 25 user licenses but has the potential to include more users within the Group. The licenses provide all the functionality offered by Jeeves. Ahlmark is one of the oldest family businesses in Värmland, a county in central Sweden. The Group´s sales exceed SEK 2 billion, and the number of employees is approximately 1,100.

Ahlmark Group includes firms active in shipping, prepress services and graphic supplies, extrusion and injection moulding, as well as construction hardware and fittings.
