metadata.dc:title: Statement by the Bid Committee of Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Statement by the Bid Committee of Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ) in relation to BV Acquisitions AB’s public takeover offer to all shareholders and warrant holders of Jeeves Information Systems and publication of certain information regarding the development of Jeeves Information Systems during the first quarter of 2012
metadata.dc:creator: camillaparneving
metadata.field:
The independent Bid Committee of the Board of Directors of Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ) unanimously recommends the shareholders and warrant holders to accept the public takeover offer made by BV Acquisitions AB

 

Background

This statement is made by the independent Bid Committee[1] of the Board of Directors (the "Committee") of Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ) (“Jeeves” or the “Company”) pursuant to section II.19 of the rules concerning takeover bids on the stock market adopted by NASDAQ OMX Stockholm (the “Takeover Rules”).

 

BV Acquisitions AB[2], a company controlled by Battery Ventures IX (AIV II), L.P. (“Battery”) has today, through a press release, announced a public offer to the shareholders and warrant holders of Jeeves to transfer all of their shares and warrants in Jeeves to BV Acquisitions AB for a consideration of SEK 83 in cash per share and SEK 13 in cash per warrant[3] in Jeeves (the “Offer”). 

The total value of the Offer amounts to approximately SEK 237 million. Compared to the last closing price of SEK 55 per share on NASDAQ OMX Stockholm on 23 March 2012, being the last trading day prior to announcement of the Offer, the Offer represents a premium of approximately 51 percent. Compared to Jeeves’ volume weighted average share price on NASDAQ OMX Stockholm during last 30 trading days up to and including 23 March 2012 the Offer represents a premium of approximately 51 percent and Compared to Jeeves’ volume weighted average share price on NASDAQ OMX Stockholm during last 90 trading days up to and including 23 March 2012 the Offer represents a premium of approximately 65 percent.[4] 

 

The acceptance period for the Offer is expected to run from and including 16 April 2012 to and including 7 May 2012. The Offer is conditional upon e.g. that the Offer being accepted to such extent that BV Acquisitions AB becomes the owner of shares representing more than 90 percent of the total number of shares in Jeeves on a fully diluted basis.  

 

The Committee has, upon request by Battery, allowed Battery to conduct a limited confirmatory due diligence investigation in connection with the preparations for the Offer and Battery has in connection therewith also met with Jeeves’ management. Battery has in connection with the due diligence been provided with internal preliminary high level balance sheet as per 29 February 2012 and profit and loss statement covering January and February 2012, see attachment to this press release for summary. Battery has also been informed that forecasted license revenue Q1 2012 is in line with Q1 2011. Neither Battery nor BV Acquisitions AB have received any non-public price-sensitive information in connection with the due diligence investigation in addition to the above.  

 

Thomas Wernhoff, Stig-Olof Simonsson and Bengt-Åke Älgevik, together representing approximately 40 percent of the total number of outstanding shares and votes in the Company, have irrevocably undertaken to accept the Offer.[5] These undertakings are conditional upon that no other party announces a competing offer at a price which is at least 10 percent higher per share than the price under the Offer, which BV Acquisitions decides not to match (i.e. offer a price that at least corresponds to the price in the competing offer) within ten business days.

 

For further information regarding the Offer, please refer to BV Acquisitions AB’s press release which was made public today.

 

As part of the Committee’s evaluation of the Offer, and in accordance with sections II.19 and III.3 of the Takeover Rules, the Committee has engaged IDC Nordic to issue a fairness opinion regarding the Offer. In the fairness opinion, IDC Nordic states that the Offer is deemed fair from a financial point of view for the shareholders and warrant holders of the Company. IDC Nordic’s fairness opinion is attached to this press release.

 

Effects of the Offer on the Company’s employees etc.

Under the Takeover Rules, the Committee shall, based on what BV Acquisitions AB has expressed in its announcement of the Offer, present its views on the impact the completion of the Offer may have on Jeeves, especially employment, and its views on BV Acquisitions AB’s strategic plans for Jeeves and the impact these could be expected to have on employment and on Jeeves’ business locations. Based on what BV Acquisitions AB has expressed in its Offer announcement, the Committee does not foresee any material changes to the employment and operations on sites where Jeeves currently conducts business, due to the completion of the Offer.

 

The Committee’s Recommendation

The Committee’s opinion of the Offer is based on a joint assessment of a number of factors that the Committee has considered relevant in relation to the evaluation of the Offer. These factors include, but are not limited to, the Company’s present position, the traded share volume, the expected future development of the Company and thereto related possibilities and risks.

 

The Committee has noted that the price in the Offer represents a premium of approximately 51 percent compared to the closing price of Jeeves’ shares on NASDAQ OMX Stockholm of SEK 55 on 23 March 2012, being the last trading day prior to announcement of the Offer. Compared to Jeeves’ volume weighted average share price on NASDAQ OMX Stockholm during last 30 trading days up to and including 23 March 2012 the Offer represents a premium of approximately 51 percent and Compared to Jeeves’ volume weighted average share price on NASDAQ OMX Stockholm during last 90 trading days up to and including 23 March 2012 the Offer represents a premium of approximately 65 percent.

 

Based on the above, the Committee unanimously recommends Jeeves’ shareholders and warrant holders to accept BV Acquisitions AB’s Offer of SEK 83 in cash per share and SEK 13 in cash per warrant in the Company.

 

This statement shall in all aspects be governed by and interpreted in accordance with Swedish law. Any disputes relating to or arising in connection with this statement shall be settled exclusively by Swedish courts.

 

Stockholm, 26 March 2012

Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ)

The Bid Committee

 

 

Advisers

Hannes Snellman Attorneys is legal adviser to Jeeves.

 

For additional information, please contact:

Anders Ingeström, Non-executive Director of the Board and Chairman of the independent Bid Committee in Jeeves, +46 70 180 08 00

 

About Jeeves

Jeeves develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Every day, Jeeves’ ERP solutions; Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, are used by more than 4 000 companies in over 40 countries. The ERP systems are user friendly, easily customizable, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of business support. Jeeves’ head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden and the company is listed on NASDAQ OMX Stockholm (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se.

 

The information in this press release shall be published by Jeeves in accordance with the Swedish Stock Market (Takeover Bids) Act (2006:451) and the Swedish Securities Market Act (2007:528). The information was handed in for publication on 26 March 2012 at 8:35. 

 


[1] At a Board meeting on 1 December, 2011, the Board of Directors decided to establish an independent bid committee, consisting of Anders Ingeström, Assar Bolin and Ann Jönsson-Lindström to evaluate the offer presented by Battery and handle all matters related to the offer.

[2] A newly formed company under name change from Goldcup 7573 AB to BV Acquisitions AB.

[3] The offer price for each warrant represents the difference between the offer price for each share and the strike price of the warrants being SEK 70.

[4] According to information in BV Acquisitions AB’s Offer announcement.

[5] As a consequence of these undertakings, Thomas Wernhoff, Stig-Olof Simonsson and Bengt-Åke Älgevik have not participated in Jeeves’ Board of Directors handling of any matters relating to the Offer.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves signs OEM agreement with StreamServe
metadata.dc:description: – Strategically important deal opens the ERP system to improved document and information management. Jeeves and StreamServe today (Oct. 16, 2007) present a cooperation that means that Jeeves will incorporate StreamServe's Enterprise Document Presentment application into its ERP system. The agreement is deemed strategically important to Jeeves, but will not generate any immediate income effect. The cooperation enables existing and potential Jeeves customers to use StreamServe solutions for their business communication.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The agreement with StreamServe enables existing and potential Jeeves customers to easily introduce StreamServe and Jeeves for their business communication. The agreement is part of Jeeves' strategy to always strive for effective upgrades," says Magnus Grönvik, Product Director at Jeeves.

StreamServe is a popular application for managing business documents an information flows for business communication, such as invoices in different distribution formats. Jeeves customers will now be able to enjoy these functions. The agreement with StreamServe means that existing Jeeves customers can be offered more efficient document and information management. Many of Jeeves' potential customers can also use StreamServe with their existing ERP systems.

"Business documents is a vital channel when communicating with customers and business partners. We feel that making good use of what you already know about your customers in order to individually adapt both the content and distribution channel of documents is something that should be done regardless of the size of the company. This agreement is a result of us sharing this vision with Jeeves," says Christian Hadenius, President of StreamServe in Scandinavia.

Jeeves will deliver a StreamServe basic package and max package under one OEM agreement. This enables all of the company's customers and resellers to get access to the solution.

"Jeeves' agreement with StreamServe is an important building block in our strategy for attracting bigger customers to Jeeves," says Magnus Grönvik, Product Director at Jeeves.

Jeeves intends to build a migration tool that can transfer the template of existing Jeeves customers to StreamServe. Jeeves has its own print and report management application.

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Grönvik, Product Director at Jeeves, Tel: +46 (0)8-587 099 00
E-mail: magnus.grönvik@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

Maria Wasing
Nordic Marketing Manager, StreamServe, Tel: +46 (0)70 686 85 34
E-mail: maria.wasing@streamserve.com
www.streamserve.com


View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: IMS Specialstål hones operational edge with Jeeves ERP system
metadata.dc:description: IMS Specialstål, one of Sweden’s largest wholesalers of stainless steel, is implementing Jeeves Universal throughout its operations. Jeeves’ partner SYSteam is behind the deal and responsible for implementation.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
IMS Specialstål in Älmhult is part of IMS, a large European distributor of stainless steel. The company is in an expansionary phase and is replacing its ERP system to enable continued growth.

“We are part of a large international group that makes tough demands on the ERP systems deployed, and Jeeves amply satisfies those requirements. My past experience with Jeeves was excellent, so I know we are choosing an ERP system that is highly flexible and user-friendly,” says Frederick Persson, President of IMS Specialstål.

“IMS Specialstål’s choice of Jeeves Universal shows that the system is a viable alternative for subsidiaries in international groups. We are building a Jeeves solution for their entire Swedish operations that will also serve as a pilot model with potential for roll-outs in other international IMS companies,” says Bo Oskarsson, SYSteam’s Product/Marketing Director for Jeeves.

For more information:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director, Jeeves Information Systems
+46-8-5870-9968, lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Frederick Persson, President, IMS Specialstål

metadata.dc:title: Liber Distribution opts for Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: Liber Distribution has chosen Jeeves Universal and Infocube to supply their new ERP system. The company is already finding possible efficiency gains and, through the new process support, will also tap into new revenue sources – both factors decisive for the choice.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Liber Distribution handles the logistics for the Liber publishing house and for external customers via their two units in Stockholm and Malmö, where numerous textbooks as well as famous titles like Stieg Larsson’s Millennium trilogy and the Swedish law reference Svea Rikes Lag are just a sample of the huge variety carried. Modern and flexible ERP system support was high on Liber Distribution’s wish list. The deal covers Jeeves Universal with applications for CRM, Sales, Purchasing, Inventory, Accounting, and Business Intelligence. In the long run, it is likely that the system will be integrated with ASTRO WMS, from Consafe Logistics, which is already installed.

“With the support of Jeeves, we can be much more efficient in our processes than previously. We place tough demands on our operations and our ERP system, and in that respect we are fully confident in Jeeves,” says Sven Sjölin, President of Liber Distribution.

Jeeves’ partner Infocube sold and will implement the solution.

“We are proud to welcome Liber Distribution and look forward to being able to work with them to develop the company’s future,” says Jonas Hammarberg, Vice President of Infocube AB. “This deal also consolidates our position in the logistics sector.”


For more information:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director, Jeeves Information Systems

metadata.dc:title: Brake experts Rydahls pick up speed with Jeeves ERP systems
metadata.dc:description: Rydahls of Karlstad, the brake experts, have chosen Jeeves Universal. Jeeves Universal will replace the company’s entire previous ERP system and be implemented in all companies in the Rydahls group. The transaction comprises about 30 user licenses, and Jeeves partner Ninetech is responsible for deployment.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Rydahls Bromsbandfabrik supplies brake systems for industrial applications and
vehicles and also distributes spare parts. To prepare for the coming economic
recovery, the company is now replacing its old ERP system with Jeeves Universal.

- “We want to be ready when the economy takes off, so it’s important to have a
robust ERP system to support our operations. Jeeves is an open system that
is easy to work with, which benefits us as a distributor, because we must be
able to interface easily with our customers. In addition, Jeeves had the most
advantageous investment forecast – we got the best system at the lowest cost
of ownership,” says Erik Rydahl, President of Rydahls Bromsbandfabrik.

Jeeves partner Ninetech will install the ERP system during the autumn of 2010
together with a new e-commerce solution.


For more information:

metadata.dc:title: Wholesale company Magnusson & Freij chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Sales at Gothenburg firm Magnusson & Freij have been growing so strongly that the company has outgrown its old ERP system. They are the second firm in the Nyblomgruppen group of companies to go with Jeeves’ Jeeves Universal, which will enable them to manage the greater flow of orders and continue their growth. Jeeves’ partner Infocube arranged the transaction.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
“As wholesalers we generate a high volume of transactions, which demands a high level of speed and security from an ERP system. Right now we are doing many tasks manually, so Jeeves will save us a lot of time while offering us new ways to receive complete and detailed customer information including purchasing statistics, order status and inventory levels,” said Magnusson & Freij CEO Krister Pettersson.

Magnusson & Freij’s product range includes over 7,000 consumable items in categories such as office supplies, toilet paper and paper towels, cleaning and protection paper and dining and catering. The company has been in a partnership for several years with Nyblomgruppen, a group of 14 established family firms from all over Sweden.

“At Nyblomgruppen we have a joint product catalog, and one of Jeeves’ many advantages is that now we can transfer product and pricing information from Jeeves directly to our company. The ERP system allows us to rationalize and automate numerous tasks, which makes us more efficient and paves the way for further growth,” said Pettersson.

The initial stage of the project is a feasibility study, which will then move to an implementation phase. Everything should be complete by the end of the year. The transaction comprises accounting, purchasing and e-commerce.

Magnusson & Freij was founded in Gothenburg in 1958, and today it has about SEK 160 million in turnover. Its customers include the City of Gothenburg, SKF, Stena Line, Volvo, Göteborgs Kex and Astra.

For more information, please contact:
Krister Pettersson, CEO, Magnusson & Freij

Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal or Garp. These ERP systems are easy to use and customize to each company's specific needs, while enabling continuous development of business support. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, go to www.jeeves.se.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves - new solution for the French wine industry
metadata.dc:description: Stock exchange listed Jeeves has entered into a strategic agreement with a software company – ID Systémes – in France. The company is a leading application supplier to the French wine industry and has approximately 450 customers. ID Systémes will develop its next generation solution based on Jeeves.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
ID Systémes chose the Jeeves solution after thorough scrutiny of the ERP system market. The first version of the solution will be available during the first quarter of 2008. Three of ID Systémes' current customers have already decided to change over to Jeeves.

"When developing an industry-specific solution where needs are continually changing, the choice of technical platform is a deciding factor. Jeeves is the only ERP system that is really suited for an ambitious, independent program developer. The platform has no equal and is technologically cutting edge, making it possible to continually develop industry-specific functions in an easy manner with no need for major development investments," says François Delage, Project Manager at ID Systémes.
"Jeeves' architecture also makes it easy to upgrade to new versions," he continues.

ID Systémes is a leader in IT products and services for the wine and alcohol industry in the French market. The company was established in 1987 and currently has a 50-percent stake of the French market.

"This is one of the first deals that Jeeves has made with an independent owner of ERP applications. ID Systémes represents a new type of partner that generates good earning and growth opportunities for Jeeves," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

The contract means that Jeeves will receive revenue as ID Systémes customers begin using the Jeeves-based solution.

metadata.dc:title: MedTech company Bactiguard AB chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Bactiguard, which has experienced rapid expansion in recent years, needed an ERP system that could grow seamlessly with the company. They chose Jeeves Universal. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ partner SYSteam.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The transaction is a bundled solution that includes accounting, orders, production, inventory and shipping. A total of 30 users are involved.

“As our growth has taken off both in Sweden and abroad, we’ve realized that we need an ERP system that can grow seamlessly with our group on both the central and local levels. We can accomplish this with Jeeves Universal, which will also be easy to adapt to future development in our business,” said Bactiguard Executive Vice President Ewa Ställdal.

Bactiguard offers solutions, products and systems that prevent health care related infections. Its product portfolio includes medical products such as catheters with a coating that prevents bacterial growth, considerably reducing the risk of infection. The company currently has a presence in 20 geographic markets, and it had approximately SEK 127 million in revenues in 2009.

metadata.dc:title: Elopak chooses Jeeves ERP-system
metadata.dc:description: The global Norwegian supplier of packaging systems Elopak (subsidiary in the Ferd Group), well-known for their Pure-Pak® -Packages, chooses a new ERP solution based on Jeeves Universal for the division that manufactures equipment and distributes components. The solution is sold by InfoCube who will also implement the system. The total order value is 16 MSEK.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Elopak has taken a strategic decision to implement the ERP-system Jeeves
Universal in their EQS (Equipment Supply) division. The company establishes a
solution based on the new ERP-system to support all manufacturing and sales for
packaging and filling machines and for the global spare part management.

- The choice of a new ERP-system is important for the future growth and
development of EQS . With Jeeves Universal’s unique structure and low TCO
we will get a flexible but in the same time cost efficient standard system that
easily can be adapted to our needs both now and in the future, says Björn
Henrik Moshuus, CIO Elopak.

The order contains a complete installation of Jeeves Universal and an integration to
Elopak´s system for product management of filling machines.

- In today´s tough competition, I am very proud that Jeeves together with our
Swedish partner InfoCube has gained such an important Norwegian company
as Elopak as our customer. It is important for our continuous growth on the
Norwegian market. I am also happy that our new Norwegian subsidiary, Logit
gruppen, has taken their first Jeeves Universal-customers, says Bengt-Åke
Älgevik, CEO Jeeves.

The order is included in the result for Q1 (the first quarter), 2009.

Facts on Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of ERP-systems, who with the products
Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp provides companies with efficient solutions to
develop and support their business processes. Jeeves ERP-system offers a wide functionality to
the lowest total cost of ownership in the market*. The customers are companies with 5 to 1000
employees and are represented by approximately 4000 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves
focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and resellers. The
business started in 1992 and since 1999 Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ, OMX Nordic Exchange
(Small Cap). For further information, see www.jeeves.se

* Radar Group

Facts on Elopak
Elopak is one of the world’s leading suppliers of packaging systems for non carbonated, liquid
food. The company was established in 1957 in Norway focusing on license production of Pure-
Pak cartons. In 1987 Elopak bought Ex-Cell-O’s packaging division and hence got exclusive
global rights to the Pure-Pak-system. In 2008, The Elopak group had a turnover of 715 million
euro, more than 2500 employees (incl. joint ventures) and customers in more than 100 countries
through the company’s more than 40 offices. Elopak is fully owned by the privately owned Ferd
group. For more information, see www.elopak.com.

Facts on Ferd
Elopak is a company in the Ferd Group, a Norwegian industrial and finance group that
focuses their business to an active and long-term ownership in strong companies with
international potential and on financial investments based on the own core competence
within finance, business development and networking. Ferd is also a large investor in real
estate that develops and maintains commercial estates as well as estates for sale. For more
information, see www.ferd.no.

InfoCube is a leading Jeeves Partner with customers in 20 countries. In total, more than 70

Roplan, Daros Piston Rings, Scanlube, Constructor, Dooria, Scan Coin, Lahega Kemi and
Greenship. For more information, see www.infocube.se

metadata.dc:title: Quick start for new partner
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems AB is proud to announce that collaborative partner DTS Solutions has gotten its first customer up and running with Jeeves Enterprise. The customer - Wernersson Ost - got a completely new ERP system in less than three months.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
On December 27, 2005 consulting company DTS Solutions entered into a cooperation agreement with Jeeves Information Systems regarding the sale and implementation of the Jeeves Enterprise ERP system. As soon as June 9, the company signed an agreement with its first customer - Wernersson Ost - for the implementation of Jeeves Enterprise. DTS Solutions conducted the project's feasibility study before the summer and started implementation the moment the summer break was over. The total project time was a mere two and a half months. Wernersson Ost is now up and running.

"We need to remember that this is DTS Solutions' very first implementation of Jeeves Enterprise out at a customer. To go from signing the cooperation agreement on December 27, learning the system and then entering into an agreement with a customer to implementing the system practically problem-free in less than three months is nothing short of amazing," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

Although Wernersson Ost is its first customer, this is not the first time that DTS Solutions has implemented Jeeves Enterprise.

"We 'cheated' a little. We started by replacing our existing ERP system with Jeeves Enterprise. This taught us that the system was very easy to work in. We then knew that we could handle implementation of Jeeves Enterprise at Wernersson Ost the way we had agreed with them," says Torbjörn Snygg, Business Developer at DTS Solutions with responsibility for Jeeves Enterprise.

Before Wernersson Ost decided in favor of DTS Solutions and Jeeves Enterprise, they looked at several solutions. But, when they got information from on Jeeves Enterprise from DTS Solutions, the decision-making process went quickly. Something that to this day they do not regret in the slightest.

"It's a huge change to replace your old ERP system with a new one. In a small organization like ours, this must be done while keeping daily operations running. But, I think things went incredibly painlessly and Jeeves Enterprise is working exactly as promised," says Kjell Claesson, Branch Manager and CFO at Wernersson Ost.

Jeeves Information Systems is continuing its work to simplify things for new partners, enabling them to reach even more potential customers. For instance, Jeeves Enterprise has been adapted for a broader target group and Jeeves Implementation Accelerator was recently introduced.

"The combination of an ERP system tailored to midsize companies and a simplified and structured implementation method was the basis of us being able to take larger market shares. One example is the successful result of DTS Solutions and Wernersson Ost. We will soon be able to highlight similar successes," says Lars Dahlberg of Jeeves Information Systems.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Q3 Jan-Sep 2007
metadata.dc:description: - Jeeves' best quarter yet
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
January – September 2007

  • Revenue totalled 94.5 (85.0), an increase of 11% (30)
  • Program revenue (licensing and maintenance) increased by 10% (35)
  • Net operating income was MSEK 12.9 (8.9) and the operating margin totalled 14% (11)
  • Earnings after tax amounted to MSEK 10.7 (6.8) and the income margin was 11% (8)
  • Per-share earnings after tax were SEK 3.6 (2.3)
  • Cash flow was MSEK 2.1 (1.5), including dividend and buyback of own shares totalling MSEK 13.3 and liquid assets and short-term investments totalling MSEK 32.1 (29.7)


CEO comments on the results
Third quarter earnings made it the absolute best quarter yet for Jeeves. Fourth quarter prospects are promising.
All Group companies have shown a positive earnings trend during the third quarter. Earnings must be considered from a perspective where good license sales combined with three months of maintenance revenue (Jeeves' largest form of revenue) and lower operating costs during
vacation months had a positive effect on margins.

I consider Jeeves' good result satisfying, but emphasize the importance of continuing to drive Jeeves toward further improved growth, particularly with a focus on larger customers, larger partners in more countries and acquisitions.

metadata.dc:title: Martin Tegnér new member of Jeeves management team
metadata.dc:description: - Jeeves has created the new position of Services Director in order to develop services that can more effectively support partners and resellers. Martin Tegnér, who most recently served at Ericsson, was recruited to the Services Director position. Martin Tegnér will take on his new role beginning November 5, 2007.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"Jeeves is in an expansive phase, where a lot of focus is on growth in the international channel. In order to achieve a high degree of effectiveness there, it is important that Jeeves can offer its partners a large number of well packaged support services, says
Martin Tegnér new Services Director at Jeeves.

Martin Tegnér most recently worked at Ericsson, where he served as IT Process Manager for the Service Level Management process in Group IT. Tegnér previously served as IT Service Manager North-West Europe at The Boston Consulting Group. Tegnér is 34 years old and lives in Stockholm.

"With our new Services Director function, Jeeves can support different types of partners in a more focused manner, which is necessary to enable international expansion.

Martin Tegnér has a solid background from companies such as Ericsson and The Boston Consulting Group. This background will prove to be valuable to Jeeves," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves sees demand in North America
metadata.dc:description: Four American firms have chosen Jeeves Universal as their new ERP system since October. In addition, Jeeves has signed agreements with three new partners. Jeeves’ new subsidiary Jeeves Information Systems Inc is accelerating the company’s growth in North America.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
“Our North American initiative has been very well received by our customers and partners, leading to four new customer agreements and three new partnership agreements so far. Meanwhile a growing number of new customer and partnership prospects bodes well for our continued growth,” says Bernt Olausson, the subsidiary’s new CEO as of January 1.

The new company is based in Chicago, and in 2012 Swedish Jeeves’ personnel will be relocating there. The subsidiary is responsible for developing a market for Jeeves’ products. Its top priority areas for 2012 are sales support, increased recruitment of partners, training and technical support. Jeeves’ experience in the North American market demonstrates that there is a demand for customizable and flexible ERP systems such as Jeeves. And its new partners confirm that there is a need for new players willing to establish long-term partner relationships.

“We’ve found partners for an aggressive sales strategy, and our goal is to increase sales in 2012,” says Jeeves CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik.

For more information, please contact:

metadata.dc:title: Statement from annual general meeting
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
At the May 15, 2007 annual general meeting for Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ), the board's proposal to provide a cash divided to shareholders for the previous fiscal year was approved at the amount of SEK 1.00 per share.

The decision was make to adopt the income statement and balance sheet and the profit brought forward will be carried forward in a new account after distribution. The annual general meeting decided to release the board and CEO from liability for the fiscal year 2006.

The annual general meeting also decided to reelect the following as regular board members Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ): Olle Ödman (Chairman), Assar Bolin, Stig-Olof Simonsson, Ann Jönsson-Lindström and Thord Johansson. One new board member was appointed: Anders Ingeström. The annual general meeting made the following determination regarding nomination committee members: Stig-Olof Simonsson and Assar Bolin were reelected and Peter Lindvall was selected as a new member.

The annual general meeting decided on guidelines for remuneration to executive management. These primarily laid out that those holding executive management positions will be paid standard salaries and other employment terms for the market.

The annual general meeting decided to implement an employee convertible program by issuing maximum 149,393 convertible option rights, generating a dilution of maximum 5%. The employee convertible program will only be offered to employees of Jeeves Information Systems AB or its subsidiaries. Eligible parties must subscribe for convertibles by no later than June 20, 2007 and payment must be made no later than June 30, 2007. The convertibles run from July 1, 2007 to December 31, 2010. The convertible price is set to 130 percent of the volume-weighted average price paid for the company's common share as per the Stockholm Stock Exchange's official price list from April 21 to May 31, 2007. Conversion occurs during the period September 15 to November 30, 2010.

The annual general meeting decided to authorize the board to make a decision on new issue of share capital at no more than SEK 600,000 through on or more issues of a total of maximum 300,000 shares with or without preferential right for shareholders as per the following main conditions. The authorization may only be used in conjunction with the company's strategic acquisition.

The annual general meeting authorized the board to up until the time of the next annual general meeting, on one or more occasions, to decide on the buyback of own shares. A buyback must be structured so that the company does not at any time hold more than 5 percent of the total number of shares in the company. Shares may only be bought back at a price that lies within the Stockholm Stock Exchange's valid price interval for shares in the company. The purpose of this authorization is to enable an adaptation of the company's capital structure to meet the company's capital needs and thereby contribute to an increased shareholder value. Any shares that are bought back will be invalidated through a reduction of share capital.



View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Jan-June 2010
metadata.dc:description: Improved new sales
metadata.dc:creator: sofiaemanuelsson
metadata.field:
•    Revenue from continuing operations totaled SEK 90.3 million (90.5), down 0.2% (24)
•    Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) rose 7% (9)
•    Operating profit equaled SEK 4.6 million (8.1), the operating margin 5% (9)
•    Net profit totaled SEK 2.7 million (7.4), the profit margin 3% (8)
•    Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 0.9 (2.6)
•    Cash flow ended at SEK -11.2 million (2.7), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments at SEK 30.6 million (41.0)
•    The equity/assets ratio was 34% (33)


CEO’s comment on performance

“The turnaround we saw in the market in the first quarter continued, and we are again seeing heightened interest in procurement of ERP systems among large companies in the SME segment. During the second quarter, Jeeves also enjoyed healthy sales to new customers. For example, several large companies in the SME segment chose to implement Jeeves ERP systems in their international business operations.

I am very satisfied with Jeeves’ solid sales to new customers and that we have won many orders in competition with other strong players, but the effects of the recession continue to impact our international business. Thus we are working hard to boost capacity utilization for our consultants and fine-tune our operations.

I still have a positive outlook on the future based on our improved list of prospects and that many customers plan international roll-outs of Jeeves ERP systems in several countries. These factors, combined with our appealing market offering that is highly flexible and offers outstanding customer benefits at a low cost of ownership, bode well for the future.”

In the first six months Jeeves continued to focus on the core-business (software license sales and maintenance). Jeeves has divested of the business operations in the Swedish subsidiary Reveny and cutbacks are made in Logit with regards to services that are not related to Jeeves products. This leads to a decline in sales with 0.2% (24). Comparable units reported growth. Jeeves’ Swedish business operations posted healthy results through organic growth. In several of our international operations, license sales remained sluggish, with low capacity utilization for the consultants who support international roll-out projects. Operating profit fell, to SEK 4.6 million (8.1).”

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves strengthened in Örebro/Karlstad by new partner Ninetechgruppen
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ) has entered into a partnership agreement with Ninetechgruppen. This gives Jeeves a locally anchored partner that strengthens Jeeves' offering in Örebro and Karlstad.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
Ninetechgruppen, with its 40 employees and headquarter in Karlstad, has customers in the midsize-company segment.

"Ninetechgruppen strengthens our offering in the Örebro/Karlstad region. Ninetechgruppen's local presence is a strength that we feel midsize companies in the region appreciate," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Manager at Jeeves.

Ninetechgruppen will offer a total undertaking, with analysis, optimization, implementation, operation, administration and ERP system support.

"Our partnership with Jeeves is the basis of a whole new business area. We chose Jeeves because of the ERP system's flexibility and the good opportunities for integration with other applications. All in all, we found that the Jeeves ERP system provides the most business benefit per invested Krona. We see great potential for Jeeves in our local market and therefore have great faith in our partnership," says Mats Bengtsson, President of NinetechGruppen.

metadata.dc:title: Year-end Report Jan-Dec 2008
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves boosts sales despite tough times
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
January–December 2008

•    Revenue reached SEK 158.3 million (130.1), up 22% (9)
•    Software revenues (license and maintenance) increased by 11% (10)
•    Operating profit was SEK 16.6 million (18.4), giving an operating margin of 10% (14)
•    Profit after tax totaled SEK 13.1 million (14.8), giving a profit margin of 8% (11)
•    Earnings per share after tax were SEK 4.6 (5.0)
•    Cash flow was SEK 2.1 million (6.3), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 38.2 million (36.3)
•    The equity/assets ratio was 32% (34)
•    The Board of Directors proposes a dividend of SEK 1.50 per share (1.50)

CEO’s comment on earnings
Jeeves is reporting a healthy profit for full-year 2008, with revenues from software rising 13% in the fourth quarter. Operating profit weakened, however, chiefly owing to costs of establishing business abroad.

I am satisfied with Jeeves’ 2008 sales growth of 22% (9). Our Norwegian acquisition contributed to healthy growth during the year. Jeeves continues to sell and sign up new customers despite the economic slowdown. The number of new customers was 20% more in 2008 than in 2007.

Jeeves’ international initiatives continue. We are pleased that our foreign partners are contributing a growing proportion of revenues as a whole, even though some markets have been slower than last year.

In my judgment, the underlying demand for ERP systems remains strong. Today, companies are prioritizing investments to boost efficiency, and a modern ERP system plays a vital role there. However, nowadays new sales are being made by only a few actors. Jeeves is one of these, and we are well-positioned offering top-class ERP systems at the lowest cost of ownership in the market. We see keen interest in the market and enter 2009 with a large pipeline. Despite this, uncertainty concerning the economic outlook makes sales forecasts more difficult than previously. 

Read the entire report

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Jan-Mar 2011
metadata.dc:description: International Growth
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
January - March 2011

  • Net sales totaled SEK 46.0 million (42.6), up 8% (-7)
  • Software revenue (licenses and maintenance) rose 13% (2)
  • Operating profit (EBITDA) was SEK 7.5 million (5.5), and the operating margin (EBITDA) 16% (13)
  • Net profit per share was SEK 0.80 (0.60)
  • Cash flow from operating activities equaled SEK 12.2 million (2.1)

 

CEO’s comment on performance

Jeeves posted a solid first quarter with healthy organic growth and improved profitability. Jeeves’ sales for the first quarter reached SEK 46 million, up 8%. At the same time, software revenue advanced 13%, to SEK 37 million. We see clear signs that the Nordic market has recovered, resulting in healthy sales as well as heightened interest in Jeeves’ ERP systems. Software revenue doubled in the rest of the Nordic region compared to the first quarter the preceding year.

Profit before depreciation, amortization, and impairment losses (EBITDA) ended at SEK 7.5 million, up 36%. Stronger sales, combined with the cutbacks made during the economic slowdown, helped improve margins. With a more active market in 2011, I see a need for us to augment our delivery organization in the near future.

The first quarter results were heartening mainly because the first three months of the year are usually weaker. Above all, I am pleased that our success in Norway is continuing. In nine months, our Norwegian subsidiary took part in 11 procurement processes and won nine of them. We see ample potential for future growth in the Norwegian market. Outside the Nordic region, we can also report landing several key contracts in the United States.

metadata.dc:title: Year-end Report Jan–Dec 2011
metadata.dc:description: Satisfied customers give growth
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
October - December

  • Net sales totaled SEK 52.0 million (46.9)
  • Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) totaled SEK 40.1 million (38.0).
  • Operating profit (EBITDA) was SEK 7.1 million (8.4), the operating margin (EBITDA) 14% (18)
  • Net profit per share was SEK 0.76 (-1.84)
  • Cash flow from continuing operations was SEK 12.4 million (12.6)


January - December

  • Net sales totaled SEK 187.5 million (177), and increased by 6 % (-2)
  • Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) totaled SEK 148.9 million (142.0).
  • Operating profit (EBITDA) was SEK 30.8 million (27.7), the operating margin (EBITDA) 16%  (16)
  • Net profit per share was SEK 3.64 (0.02)
  • Cash flow from continuing operations was SEK 32.2 million (14.3)
  • The Board of Directors proposes a dividend of SEK 2 per share (1.50)


CEO’s comment on performance
In 2011 Jeeves’ turnover increased by 6 percent, maintaining an EBITDA margin of 16 percent. Growth in the fourth quarter was 11 percent with an EBITDA margin of 14 percent.

Interest in ERP systems and the number of tenders are at healthy levels. We are satisfied with new sales that are on par with last year, when they rose sharply in the Nordic region. Our new sales strengthened toward the end of the year with a higher number of deals.The deals being closed are primarily going to smaller firms in the SME segment, while the larger firms tend to take more time. Profitability is up, which we achieved through effective cost controls and utilization of consultants. Maintenance income continued to be good.

I am gratified by the interested that Jeeves has received in North America. During the year we signed contracts with a couple of major experienced partners that specialize in marketing and sales, which gives us the opportunity to expand cost-effectively. We also closed several deals in the fourth quarter. European sales have been weak, with the exception of Sweden.

We are also pleased to report that our customers are very satisfied. Our annual customer survey shows that nearly 90 percent of our customers would recommend Jeeves to others. Satisfied customers who want to grow with Jeeves and advise others to choose us are the basis for our stability.

Read the entire report.


For more information:
CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik, +46 8 587 099 00 or CFO Anna Salomon-Sörensen +46 8 587 099 45.


Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. metadata.dc:title: Simplicity comes first with Jeeves 3.0
metadata.dc:description: The new version of Jeeves’ ERP system, Jeeves 3.0, treats users to a new user-friendly interface and built-in decision support that make using an ERP system simpler than ever. Jeeves 3.0 also gives customers the opportunity to share industry functionality with others in the Jeeves Community through the Jeeves Apps Market.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeeves 3.0 comprises the ERP systems Jeeves Selected, which is for small companies, and Universal, the choice for medium-sized companies in the distribution, manufacturing and service industries. These systems are used by about 4,400 companies worldwide. Jeeves’ basic philosophy is that customers should be able to continuously develop their business processes on their own.

 “As we were developing Jeeves 3.0, we focused on making our ERP systems as user-friendly as possible. The customers were involved throughout the entire development process, and there was a focus on designing an ergonomic interface that is optimally designed for the user. With the debut of the Jeeves Apps Market Jeeves 3.0 is setting a new standard in the market, where customers can contribute and share functionality and solutions. Moreover, developing the system as companies evolve is even easier than before. Taken together, these new features make it simpler than ever to use an ERP system,” said Jeeves Product Manager Magnus Sjökvist.

The new version of Jeeves was tested and evaluated by several customers during the winter, and it is being released to all markets on March 8. 

 Here are the most important new features in Jeeves 3.0:

  • An innovative new user interface
  • Built-in decision support
  • Business management with new built-in graphic tools
  • Simpler for customers to create their own cutting-edge solutions
  • Easier to share solutions in Jeeves Apps Market
  • Expanded industry solutions for manufacturing, distribution and service
  • Simplified system administration
  • Expanded localization support in several countries

 

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Sjökvist, Product Manager, Jeeves Information Systems
+46 (0)8 587 099 39, magnus.sjokvist@jeeves.se

Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. metadata.dc:title: Jeeves signs big order with Swedish industrial company
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems' partner InfoCube has signed a significant order with a large Swedish industrial company with international operations. The total order value amounts to approximately MSEK 6. Jeeves' share nets it MSEK 1.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
The deal was made between Jeeves' strategic partner InfoCube and the Swedish industrial company. The customer is replacing its previous ERP system with Jeeves.

"It feels particularly good since Jeeves won this deal while competing with several of the large ERP system manufacturers. The customer put great significance on the fact that the Jeeves solution is cost effective and can be easily upgrading, which means it can be adapted when the customer's business conditions change," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Manager at Jeeves.
"InfoCube has once again shown that it can win assignments from really large customers, which shows that our partner model works even when competing for large customers," he continues.

"The flexible structure of Jeeves' solution means that as a partner we can credibly and successfully market the system to both large and small customers," says Jonas Hammarberg, Marketing and Sales Director at InfoCube.

The system is expected to be fully implemented in 2008. The deal will be taken up as income during quarter four of this year.


 

View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: Musikservice is first customer for Jeeves WMS
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems is proud to announce that Musikservice Sweden AB has become the first customer to implement the new module Jeeves WMS (Warehouse Management Systems). The deal was closed by Reveny, giving Musikservice one of the market's most powerful logistics solutions.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"Our ambition is for Jeeves Enterprise to become a market leader in complex logistics solutions for midsize Swedish companies," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

On February 28, 2006, Jeeves Information Systems announced a cooperation with Consafe Logistics aimed at developing a new logistics module, Jeeves WMS, that is fully integrated with the Jeeves Enterprise ERP system. The first customer to implement Jeeves WMS is Musikservice Sweden AB.

The business concept of Musikservice, which has its seat in Mölndal, is the distribution of film and music in a selling product mix to stores such as grocery stores, superstores, and filling stations. This sets high demands for logistics and logistics planning as there are often limited-time campaign products and large quantities. Until now, planning has been handled manually to a great extent. But since demand for Musikservice products has grown and the company wants to serve its customers better, they decided to invest in a fully automated solution to make stock management more efficient.

After evaluating a number of solutions, Musikservice chose Jeeves WMS. The logistics solution will be implemented in parallel with Musikservice's upgrade of its existing ERP system, Reveny G5, to Jeeves Enterprise. Jeeves gives them a total solution where all business flows, from CRM via order and accounting to the vital logistics processes are integrated and can be developed - all in the same system.

"With this solution, we get the functionality and resources necessary to continue our expansion. With Jeeves WMS, we get a tool to further improve and develop our already efficient logistics management," says Torbjörn Ungvall, IT Director at Musikservice Sweden AB.

The deal was closed by Jeeves Information Systems partner Reveny, which specializes in logistics and distribution. To them, Jeeves WMS means access to another tool for creating customer-tailored, complex logistics solutions.

"With Jeeves WMS, we can give Musikservice an extremely modern solution for logistics planning, which handles things such as floating stock and large flows. To this, we integrate new functionality, such as pallet identification management. There are few standard systems on the market that could handle a similar solution. We can now offer our customers an advanced yet cost-effective logistics solution," says Thomas Ljung, President of Reveny.

Musikservice Sweden AB is the first to implement Jeeves WMS since Jeeves Information Systems and Consafe Logistics entered into the cooperation agreement. This strengthens Jeeves Information Systems' position in the market.

"We are strong in the manufacturing industry. The deal with Musikservice shows that we are in serious competition for the midsize distribution companies. We have dedicated partners, like Reveny, that are experts in logistics and distribution; we have modern applications in Jeeves Enterprise and Jeeves WMS and we now also have strong customer references in companies like Musikservice. Our goal is to become a market leader in this segment," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

The deal was taken up into the accounts by Jeeves Information Systems in 2006.

metadata.dc:title: High-growth firm Orderinvest chooses Jeeves ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Orderinvest AB, one of Sweden’s leading mail order companies, is experiencing rapid growth. Now the company is switching its ERP system to Jeeves Selected in order to support its continued expansion. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ partner Tanico.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The transaction initially encompasses 18 users, all of the flows for trading companies and Jeeves’ Amase inventory forecast tool. A top priority for Orderinvest is efficient management of the tremendous number of items in their product selection. Orderinvest also plans to connect Jeeves e-commerce to its solution in the longer term.

“We want to be able to use our ERP system as a competitive advantage, and not get locked into a standard system. Jeeves Selected will enable us to continue our automation of internal procedures and inventory management at the pace we need to be efficient and continue growing,” said Orderinvest owner and CEO Patrik Salomonsson.

Orderinvest markets and sells furniture to companies, schools and the public sector via catalogs, the Internet and personal selling. The company’s product lineup includes over 35,000 items, and it ships worldwide. Since being founded in 1985 Orderinvest has grown into one of the leading mail order companies in Sweden.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Celebrates Ongoing and Successful Internationalization
metadata.dc:description: Upbeat partner conference features speed-dating
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The Swedish town of Ystad (well-known from the Kurt Wallander mystery novels by Henning Mankell) recently hosted Jeeves’s annual partner conference. Jeeves Circle of Friends met May 6–8, and more than 300 people from around the world participated – networking, exchanging the latest news about and developments in Jeeves, and celebrating new customers in various countries.

This year’s meeting of the international Jeeves network had the motto “Circle of Friends of Jeeves – Jeeves Live.” Some 300 participants came together at the Ystad Saltsjöbad conference hotel and spa on the southern coast of Sweden. About one-third came from outside Scandinavia. The agenda included numerous lectures on the ERP products Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected, opportunities to share knowledge, and networking with new partners from different countries. In daily sessions, IT consultants, software specialists, sales managers, and newcomers discussed technical innovations, new features, and localization strategies for their successful business with Jeeves. Jeeves partners all over the world sell and implement Jeeves, with the support of Jeeves’s experienced international consulting team. For international roll-outs, in particular, it makes sense to work closely together.

The focus of the presentations was on Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected versions 2.0, with the new Jeeves Apps Builder. This tool allows users to extract vertical solutions or small extensions – similar to commercial application services for mobile phones – which are then implemented worldwide in installations for customers in other countries. In other words, Jeeves Apps Builder enables partners and customers to exchange applications and modifications. In the near future, Jeeves will offer its own internal library of applications for partners and customers from which the desired applications can be downloaded.

The conference featured an activity like “speed dating.” Participants got the opportunity to have one-on-one detailed discussions with Jeeves specialists. In addition, the partners took the opportunity to get together for informal meetings, to get to know one another better and explore possibilities for project cooperation.

In his opening speech, Jeeves CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik complimented the partners and thanked them for the successful collaboration. Jeeves has expanded its network steadily in recent years. In 2006, the company had 10 international subsidiaries and partners, mostly in France, Poland, and Scandinavia. Since then, five new subsidiaries and 25 new distribution partners have been established – in Germany, Britain, Norway, and North America in 2009 alone. In Asia, Jeeves has also succeeded in penetrating the market with localized ERP solutions and plans to continue expanding.

 

For more information:

Camilla Parneving, Marketing & Information Director,
Jeeves Information Systems
+46 33 444 122

metadata.dc:title: Expand grows internationally with Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: Roll-ups, flags, and backdrops – in recent years, Expand’s products have gained in popularity worldwide. Now the company aims to grow more. The Jeeves Universal ERP system is one element that will make that possible.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The transaction covers 46 users and support for production, inventory, sales,  purchasing, and accounting. Jeeves Universal will replace the solution Expand currently uses in Europe and, in the future, perhaps those systems used in the United States and China, too. Jeeves’ partner Infocube arranged the transaction and will be
responsible for implementation.

“It has been important for us to find a solution that supports our international operations and is also very user-friendly. Jeeves Universal does just that,” says Per-Anders Ekström, President of Expand International.

Expand manufactures and markets portable media displays. The Group has companies in seven countries, 3,300 resellers in 61 countries, and global sales of SEK 189 million.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves enters into an agreement with Zolvia as new partner in Finland and the Baltic States
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems is proud to announce the signing of a partnership agreement with IT consulting company Oy Zolvia Ab for sales and implementation of the Jeeves Enterprise ERP system in Finland and the Baltic States. Zolvia was previously a reseller for Intentia/Lawson, but now chooses to instead cooperate with Jeeves Information Systems.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The potential for Jeeves Enterprise in Finland and the Baltic States is so great that we are now recruiting new consultants," says Bo Stenström, Chairman of the Board at Zolvia.

Zolvia has vast experience in the sale and implementation of ERP systems. Zolvia was incorporated as late as the spring of 2006, but over the past 15 years, the employees have worked to implement the Movex ERP system (Intentia/Lawson) at Finnish and Baltic companies. Zolvia has now chosen to end its cooperation with Intentia/Lawson and instead enter into a partnership with Jeeves Information Systems. The goal is for Zolvia to maintain their fast growth.

"The Jeeves Enterprise ERP system has just the qualification that are in demand at midsize Finnish and Baltic manufacturing companies. We also appreciate Jeeves Information Systems' channel strategy, which makes our role in the cooperation clear – Jeeves develops one of the world's most flexible and modern standardized ERP system, which we will sell and implement out at the end customers. This enables us to focus on what we do best - offering maximum customer benefit," says Bo Stenström.

While Jeeves Information Systems already had two resellers in Finland and collaborative partners operating in the Baltic States, Zolvia serves to further strengthen the company's presence in these markets. Zolvia's vast experience in ERP system implementation was an important factor for Jeeves Information Systems when the deciding to enter into the cooperation agreement.

"Zolvia has a highly qualified and knowledgeable team of employees, who I am certain will make us even more competitive in the Finnish and Baltic markets. Our cooperation will in all likelihood help us take significant market shares there," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

The agreement between Jeeves Information Systems and Zolvia requires that Zolvia immediately cease being a reseller for Intentia/Lawson. Zolvia will market and sell Jeeves Enterprise starting January 1, 2007.

metadata.dc:title: Keges Grosshandel switches to Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Keges Grosshandel has seen strong growth in the number of its items. In the course of a few years, its range has increased by a couple of thousand items to its current figure of approximately 8 000. Growth, combined with busy summer months when the workforce is in principle doubled, and the expansion of the product range, has meant the need for Keges to have a new ERP system. As part of our continuing business development and making Keges' administrative procedures and customer service more efficient, the company has decided to choose Jeeves as its new ERP system. Jeeves’ partner Infocube arranged the transaction.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Keges Grosshandel is Gotland's sole full range wholesaler, whose range includes items such as fish and seafood, meat and cold cuts, wine and spirits, cheese and delicatessen items, as well as local produce from Gotland. The company's stock range comprises approximately 8 000 items, and its customers include all the restaurants and cafés on the island. Keges is also the chief supplier for all services coming under the Municipality of Gotland, such as schools, healthcare and eldercare. The company was founded in 1985, and today it has approximately 40 full time employees and an annual turnover of approximately SEK 180 million.

Investing in e-commerce and improved search options for customers
Magnus Palmgren, project and HR manager at Keges Grosshandel, points to factors that led to the decision to switch to Jeeves.

“The current system has been in use many years, and, although it's fine in terms of basic functions, it doesn't serve as a platform for our future investment. Some examples of the features we're introducing are e-commerce, e-billing, computerized stock management, more efficient search functions for customers and an improved reporting system. In addition, the current system means that we use vast volumes of paper in connection with print-outs, so there's the environmental aspect of switching systems,” says Magnus Palmgren.

Magnus Palmgren also points to the user-friendly aspect of Jeeves as being very important, since the workforce is doubled in summertime and the younger recruits must quickly become familiar with the administrative routines.

“All our employees come in contact with the system to some extent, and the training period needed for Jeeves will be much shorter for our extra personnel. Having an interface based on point and click functions means our younger employees will learn the system in no time. This will, of course, also mean that those of us responsible for introduction and training are relieved of a heavy burden. We will thus free up time which can be devoted instead to issues such as developing new reporting routines, whereby Jeeves will provide us with brand new opportunities for simplifying, speeding up and automating our procedures. In addition, once the system is in operation, we will be given a totally different central overview of current sales and stock balance. At present the sorting work is done manually with pick lists that then have to be fed into the system. To coincide with Jeeves coming into operation, we will switch over to handheld computers with an auto-load facility.”

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Palmgren, project and HR manager, Keges Grosshandel

metadata.dc:title: NORD-LOCK reduces their number of ERP-systems from 18 to 1 with Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: NORD-LOCK, a global supplier of a superior securing system designed for bolted joints forms an integrated group and invests in Jeeves Universal, which will replace the company´s previous 18 ERP-systems. The initial order comprises the Swedish operations, but in due times the system – implemented by the Jeeves’ partner Infocube – will be introduced globally.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Flexibility, cost efficiency and wide competence were the most important factors that made NORD-LOCK choose Jeeves Universal and Infocube.

- We were initially looking at some bigger systems, however they proved to be too heavy and too expensive to deploy. With Jeeves we will get a flexible system that we can implement cost efficiently and quickly and that is well adapted for an international business like ours. With Infocube we will get a competent and precise consultant that does not only know the system, but also is capable of helping us take full advantage of it, says Anders Clemensson, Global Operations Director at NORD-LOCK International AB.

NORD-LOCK purchases a fully integrated ERP-solution from Jeeves and Infocube, which will replace their current ERP-portfolio. The deal contains systemized support for manufacturing, shop floor/attendance reporting, sales, purchasing, financials, ICT, CRM and document management.

- Implementing a common ERP-system is an important action as we create an integrated group of businesses. We must quickly be able to consolidate and follow up all business of our subsidiaries with the corporate group. On the operative level we want to reach an integrated sales order management with global control of inventory and distribution. Jeeves proved to be a competent system that well meets our demands, says Anders Clemensson.

For more information, please contact:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves
Phone: +46 (0)8-587 099 68
e-mail: lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

Fakta om NORD-LOCK
NORD-LOCK AB manufactures and sells a superior securing system designed for bolted joint that is not affected by any kind of vibration or dynamic loads. The NORD-LOCK bolt securing system is comprised of special cam faced washers that are assembled as washer pairs. The spacers have been produced by NORD-LOCK AB since 1982.
The business headquarters is seated in Gothenburg and the manufacturing is made near Östersund. Besides this there are sales subsidiaries in Sweden, Germany, Great Britain, France, The Netherlands, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic, Japan, USA and a global network of resellers. The export is 90% of our turnover. Nord-Lock is a part of AB Latours division for the manufacturing industry. For more information, please see: www.nord-lock.com.

Facts on Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of ERP-systems, who with the products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp provides companies with efficient solutions to develop and support their business processes. Jeeves ERP-system offers a wide functionality to the lowest total cost of ownership in the market*. The customers are companies with 5 to 1000 employees and are represented by approximately 4000 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and resellers. The business started in 1992 and since 1999 Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ, OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap). For further information, see www.jeeves.se.

* Radar Group

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves wins breakthrough order in France
metadata.dc:description: SES Sécurité & Signalisation chooses Jeeves Enterprise via IBM. After a thorough procurement procedure comprising 22 potential ERP systems, SES chose Jeeves Enterprise. SES is one of France's leading traffic sign manufacturers with 530 employees and a 2006 turnover of 72.8 million Euros. One of the most important criteria in SES' choice of Jeeves Enterprise was the system's breadth of functions and flexibility.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"We took a strategic step when reviewing and reorganizing our information system after being part of a larger group for 15 years. Consequentially, we sought an ERP system that was versatile, well tested and easy to upgrade," explains Pierre Passet, Vice President of SES.

Anelia, a subsidiary of IBM, is responsible for the project.

The Jeeves ERP system will be completely implemented by the end of March 2008.

"Right from the start of the project, SES showed a markedly focused attitude toward their change of ERP system. This is Jeeves' largest project to date in France and marks an important milestone for us in France. We are also extremely proud over making the deal of this project via IBM's Anelia. This confirms the strength of Jeeves ERP system's functionality and applicability," says Raphaël d’Halluin, Jeeves manager in France.

metadata.dc:title: Ejendals chooses Jeeves’ ERP system for its drive into Europe
metadata.dc:description: Ejendals, the Nordic region’s largest supplier of shoes, gloves, and skincare products for industrial and professional use, has selected Jeeves’ ERP system in preparation for its upcoming national and international expansion. The transaction covers the entire group, with 250 users in Sweden, Finland, and Germany, and is being carried out with Jeeves’ partner Infocube.
metadata.dc:creator: sofiaemanuelsson
metadata.field:
A weighty factor that tipped the scales in favor of Jeeves was its “fashion solution” for managing product information in the apparel industry. Ejendals, with well-known brands such as Graningekängan, Tegera, and Jalas, has customers chiefly in industry. The company is now expanding in Sweden and abroad and investing in a comprehensive ERP system that meets stringent demands, not least in terms of managing the many variants of a company’s products.

“Jeeves Universal provides us with order and control in our processes as well as the flexibility we need to meet our customers’ needs when we expand,” says Johan Sundström, Administrative Manager at Ejendals. “One of our explicit requirements was that the system should be able to keep track of our product portfolio and be able to manage our product information, including a multiplicity of different models and sizes. Based on our thorough specification, Jeeves as a system and Infocube as a partner have fulfilled our expectations very well.”

Ejendals has 350 employees and sales of SEK 815 million.

For more information:
Johan Krantz, Sales Director, Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Information Systems
+46-70-480-1867, johan.krantz@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Johan Sundström, Administrative Manager, Ejendals

Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB develops Sweden’s most popular ERP system*. The products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, and Garp offer broad functionality at a cost of ownership among the lowest in the market. Customers currently include more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries. Since 1999, Jeeves has been listed on the small companies list of NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap). www.jeeves.se
* Exido IT Barometer 2009

Ejendals in brief
Ejendals is a family business based in Leksand, Sweden. The company develops, manufactures, and markets high-quality products that protect hands and feet, primarily for the European market. Today Ejendals has sales of almost SEK 1 billion and employs about 350 people in Europe, including 80 at the head office in Leksand.

metadata.dc:title: Specialplast chooses Jeeves' ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Specialplast of the Småland region of Sweden has opted to implement Jeeves Universal in its operations. The aim is to use the system to enhance efficiency and implement continual change. Jeeves’ partner Infocube arranged the transaction.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The transaction is a bundled product offering with 35 users and comprises accounting, purchasing, inventory, sales, production and more. 

"In recent years, Specialplast has undergone major changes, and we now need a flexible ERP system that can be adapted to the company. Jeeves Universal enables us to enhance the efficiency of the production, order and logistics flow, while we can implement continual change at the same time," says Helena Häger, CFO at Specialplast.

Specialplast offers products in areas including medtech and office supplies trade. The company was founded in 1956, its head office is located in Gislaved in the Småland region of Sweden, and it has a turnover of around SEK 120 million.

For more information, please contact:

metadata.dc:title: Väderstad-Verken AB changes ERP system to Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: The family business Väderstad-Verken has more than doubled its turnover during the last two years to 1.4 billion SEK. The company is in need of a flexible ERP system to enable a continuous growth and therefore changes to the ERP system Jeeves Universal through the Jeeves partner Infocube. The order includes 250 users and is one of Jeeves' larger orders in 2008.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
– With such a substantial growth, we foresee Jeeves Universal to facilitate our continuous expansion. We chose Jeeves mainly because of its high level of flexibility and user-friendliness compared to many other systems, says Anders Karlsson, CIO at Väderstad-Verken.

Väderstad-Verken has been selling agricultural machines since 1962 and is one of Europe's leading companies within soil processing and sowing. The company, which is a Gazelle company and was nominated for the Swedish Trade Council's Big Export Price 2008, has a total of 750 employees and subsidiaries in twelve countries.

– Väderstad-Verken is a great example of a customer where the strengths of Jeeves Universal, especially the flexibility, come to its full potential. It is very gratifying that Väderstad-Verken values the full capacity of our powerful ERP system,
says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves.

The order has been signed by Jeeves Information Systems’ partner InfoCube.

– We are proud of the shown confidence by the customer and can confirm that our long-term focus at Jeeves really matters. Väderstad-Verken has pursued its procurement in an exceptionally professional way with a strong internal support for the project, which is a guarantee for a successful project. We see this as the first step on a journey where we expect to grow at the same pace as Väderstad-Verken, says Jonas Hammarberg, Marketing and Sales Director at InfoCube.

For more information, please contact:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves, tel: 08-587 099 00
lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

Jonas Hammarberg, Marketing and Sales Director at InfoCube, tel: 031-7756604

Europe´s fastest growing supplier of ERP-systems*, Jeeves Information Systems AB develops ERP systems for companies within the manufacturing, trade, maintenance and service sectors. Jeeves concentrates on product development, while sales are channeled through partners and resellers. In total Jeeves has around 70 partners globally. In Sweden partners are represented at 20 locations. The main products are Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, all in all installed at over 3 900 companies.
