metadata.dc:title: New orders for Jeeves in the Netherlands - Jeeves continues its globalization strategy
metadata.dc:description: Europe's fastest-growing ERP system* supplier - Jeeves Information Systems - has signed two orders in the Netherlands. These further confirm the company's breakthrough on the market. Through its partner JIS Nederland, Jeeves sold its Jeeves Enterprise ERP system to Bartels Engineering, a technology consultant, and Lundiform, an interiors manufacturer.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
- Bartels' and Lindiform's choice of Jeeves is one more indication that the flexibility of Jeeves' system can hold its own against international competition. With all of our reference customers in the Dutch market, we are well equipped for continued expansion," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves Information Systems.

Bartels Group is an engineering consulting company with 250 employees and nine offices in the Netherlands and offices in Belgium, Poland, Ireland and Germany. In the first stage, the Jeeves order covers accounting and project administration in Bartels' Dutch operations. Later in 2007, this will be expanded to cover the foreign offices and additional functions.

Lundiform manufactures interiors and furniture, specializing in interior concepts for retail and furniture for healthcare and laboratories. The Jeeves order covers systems for production management and CRM.

JIS Nederland is Jeeves' partner in the Netherlands. The company has 10 consultants who specialize in Jeeves' ERP systems.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves and InfoCube in biggest deal of the year
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems and its partner InfoCube have made the biggest joint deal of the year. Nordic door manufacturer Dooria has chosen Jeeves Enterprise for its business-critical processes. The deal covers all of Dooria's units and has a total order value of SEK 12.3 million.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The deal clearly shows that Jeeves Enterprise is the right ERP system for midsize companies seeking a solution to meet complex needs," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

 Dooria is a leading Nordic door producer. With their seat in Stryn Municipality in Norway, their production and distribution units are spread through Scandinavia and Great Britain. After a thorough procurement process, Dooria chose to replace its existing ERP system, XAL and Axapta, with Jeeves Enterprise. This will be implemented at the parent company and the eight subsidiaries. Dooria's choice to convert completely to Jeeves Enterprise for its operations is due in part to the functionality in multi-company management provided by Jeeves Enterprise.

"We looked at practically all ERP systems on the market. With Jeeves Enterprise's functionality for multi-company management, we will be able to greatly reduce our administration. Our ROI calculation shows that the entire investment will pay for itself as early as 2009. No other ERP system was able to show such positive statistics," says Knut Lövdal, CEO of Dooria.

During the final stage of the procurement process, four ERP systems were still on the table – IFS, IBS, Axapta (Microsoft) and Jeeves Enterprise. In addition to the quick ROI, Dooria's evaluation showed that the functionality of Jeeves Enterprise when it came to production was in a class by itself and met their needs. The choice then went to Jeeves Enterprise when implementation by Swedish partner InfoCube was factored into the equation.

"InfoCube has a really good reputation on the market and my own experiences have been nothing but good. We got to visit a number of their reference customers and knew that their way of working with their customers was just what we were looking for in a collaborative partner in a project as important as this one," says Jonas Nordblom, Director of Logistics & Operations Development for Dooria.

The total order value amounts to SEK 12.3 million and includes the modern and flexible Jeeves Enterprise ERP system with functionality such as Accounting, Production, Purchasing, Inventory/Distribution, Sales and Electronic Invoice Management. In addition, the system will be fully integrated with applications for business intelligence and product configuration. Although InfoCube has had customers in Norway previously, the deal is a breakthrough in the Norwegian market.

"It is our ambition to become Norther Europe's leading exclusive supplier of Jeeves Enterprise. Dooria once again shows that we can handle geographically spread operations. In the near future, we will recruit approximately 15 new employees to meet the demand for Jeeves Enterprise in Sweden and to be able to take on several large international deals," says Jonas Hammarberg, Sales & Marketing Director for InfoCube.

Midsize company Dooria's choice of Jeeves Enterprise over other ERP systems is a sign of a conscious strategy from Jeeves Information Systems. Over time, the functionality of Jeeves Enterprise was developed and adapted for this company's desires and needs. One example of this is multi-company management. Another is a more advanced and deepened stock management solution.

"This is the biggest deal of the year for the cooperation between Jeeves Information Systems and InfoCube. It shows that Jeeves Enterprise is ready to take on the operations of complex groups. Our solutions are better and more flexible than any other system on the market. This is why customers like Dooria get better ROI with Jeeves Enterprise than with any other supplier's system. This is our biggest deal this year, but I am confident that we will see similar deals in the future. Jeeves Enterprise is our best selling point for this," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

metadata.dc:title: Lindahls Mejeriprodukter chooses Jeeves’ ERP system as it grows
metadata.dc:description: In recent years Swedish dairy firm Lindahls Mejeriprodukter has seen strong growth in its international sales of Turkish, Greek and Russian yogurt, gourmet yogurt and tzatziki. Therefore the company needed a new ERP system to streamline its six companies and improve logistics management. Their choice was Jeeves Universal. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ partner EDB ErgoGroup SYSteam.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The ERP system solution encompasses Lindahls Mejeriprodukter’s parent company and main warehouse, as well as four sales firms in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Latvia. Lindahls Mejeriprodukter is part of the Lindahls group, which is owned in turn by Skånemejerier.

“We have had a rapid growth during the last 2-3 years and we see a continued growth especially in an international environment. This is why we need to replace our existing ERP system with a new solution that will make our organization more efficient. Jeeves Universal was the best choice, since it also offers a completely integrated logistics system, and can be developed further as our organization evolves,” said Lindahls Mejeriprodukter’s marketing director Jonas Hammar.

The transaction includes a group license for Jeeves Universal with 25 users. The implementation began in January and will be complete in April 2012. Lindahls Mejeriprodukter has SEK 350 million in sales. The company, whose headquarters are in Jönköping Sweden, has 30 employees in Sweden, Finland, Norway and the Baltic countries.

For more information, please contact:
Jonas Hammar, Director of Marketing, Lindahls Mejeriprodukter

metadata.dc:title: Focusing product strategy results in impairment loss
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves, a Swedish supplier of ERP systems, has decided to focus its product development on a single platform, resulting in an impairment loss of SEK 11.1 million on capitalized development expenditure. The development project aimed at making it possible to run Jeeves on additional platforms has now been concluded.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Today Jeeves uses a Microsoft-based platform for its ERP systems. If Jeeves ERP systems could be run on additional platforms, the number of potential partners and users would be greater. In anticipation of a future launch, the Company reevaluated the platform project’s commercial potential and drew the conclusion that circumstances in the market had changed. At the same time, Jeeves sees ample potential in its current platform. Thus, the Company has chosen to concentrate its development resources there.

“We are now choosing to focus future development on our current Microsoft-based platform, with which we have been very successful,” says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves Information Systems.

The impairment loss is expected to have a positive tax effect of SEK 2.9 million.

For more information:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO, Jeeves Information Systems

metadata.dc:title: Aimpoint targets efficiency gains with Jeeves ERP systems
metadata.dc:description: During this year’s hunting season, Aimpoint will boost accuracy for thousands of hunters worldwide. Aimpoint develops, produces, and sells electronic red dot sights, and in pursuit of greater corporate efficiency, the company has chosen to invest in a new ERP system by Jeeves Universal.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The transaction covers a group license for Jeeves Universal with an initial 55 users in Sweden and the United States. The system will support sales, inventory, production, purchasing, and accounting. The deal was arranged by Jeeves partner Infocube, which is also responsible for implementation through its consultants in Malmö,
Sweden, and Chicago, Illinois.

“Everything from product configuration, purchasing agreements for materials, and customer inquiries will be affected when we change the system. That is why it was vital to find a flexible ERP system that supports our processes and our way of working. Jeeves does that and at the same time helps us toward our goal of becoming a more efficient enterprise” says Lennart Ljungfelt, President of Aimpoint.

Implementation will begin in January and is planned to be completed by mid-2011.

metadata.dc:title: BUFAB selects Jeeves for international roll-out
metadata.dc:description: BUFAB AB has selected Jeeves Universal for the management of the financial control in their large-scale international trade operations. Together with its partner SYSteam, Jeeves has received an order to implement the ERP-system Jeeves Universal in Sweden and in 14 international subsidiaries. The order includes approximately 70 users.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
- We are in need of a modern and international system that can handle the
various legal requirements that our subsidiaries in different countries are
facing, says Joakim Karlsson, financial manager at BUFAB. We have good
experience with Jeeves Universal from our production companies. Jeeves is a
natural choice as we are standardizing our IT-platform internationally. We get
an attractive combination of a competitive ERP system and a low total cost of
ownership.

BUFAB is market leading on the European market within fasteners and small parts
for the general industry. The operation is built on powerful logistic solutions with cost
effective purchases and own production. The company has 780 employees in 20
countries. BUFAB has had a strong growth during the latest years by e.g. a number
of larger acquisitions and are now establishing a common structure for the entire
business. Jeeves Universal is an important tool in this process.

- We are happy that BUFAB has chosen to expand their co-operation with
Jeeves and SYSteam as they are growing and developing their trade
operations, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales director at Jeeves. To start by creating
a group wide platform for the financial control, as in BUFAB´s case, is an
important step in our strategy to support our customers´ business operations
and internationalization.

The revenue has been booked in 2008.

metadata.dc:title: Published by Jeeves North America: Gray tools up for the future with Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: Gray Tools, a Canadian based manufacturer and distributor of quality hand tool products is well known across Canada and indeed North America. As a well established company with well worked business processes Gray Tools needed a ‘next generation’ ERP solution to take their business to the next level of performance and extend their drive for continuous improvement. This solution was sold by Jassco, who will also be the solutions implementer.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Gray Tools Canada Inc, is a proud Canadian company, privately held, third generation, family owned business headquartered in Brampton just north west of Toronto Ontario, Canada. Gray has been manufacturing, marketing, distributing and selling Industrial quality hand tools to North American customers for over 98 years.

“We are proud of our Canadian heritage and have built our business on product quality, innovative new products, technical expertise, marketing support and world-class service levels. We make the commitment to our valued customer to continue to improve all aspects of our business beyond the high standards we have established in our company today.” - Alex Gray, Chairman of Gray Tools

“At Gray, customer service is always at the forefront of our efforts. By picking Jeeves, we will be able to keep improving our high levels of customer service with better access to information from one source. Jeeves’ strong cross- functionality; forecasting, order entry, inventory control, distribution, capacity planning with shop floor planning and automation means that all of our systems will be consolidated into one integrated package. This will also result in reduced cost as we will only have to maintain one system instead of several. It looks like a ‘win-win’ for our customers, for us and Jeeves.”

Gray Tools will be implementing Jeeves with a strong functionality footprint of the core Jeeves Universal system including such features as; CRM, Workflow and document management. Gray has developed some sophisticated processes in forecasting, packing/shipping and these functions will be addressed within Jeeves. 

“Under the economic situation of the day, I am thrilled that Jeeves together with our North America partner Jassco has gained such an important Canadian company as Gray Tools as our customer. It is further proof that Jeeves is indeed a strong solution in this important Canadian and North American market.” says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves.

This order is included in the result for Q2 (the second quarter), 2010.


For more information, please contact:

metadata.dc:title: Empire chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: As part of its strategy to make its business more efficient, Empire, which markets and distributes the popular SodaStream home carbonation system, has chosen Jeeves Universal as its new ERP system. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ partner SYSteam.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The transaction consists of a bundled solution that includes orders, inventory, purchasing, billing and expanded sales support. A total of 30 users in Sweden and Norway are involved.

    ”One important aspect of our choice of Jeeves Universal is its underlying technology. The technology facilitates upgrades, so we will always have easy access to an up-to-date ERP system with the latest functionality. This will reduce our dependency on consultants as we evolve and streamline our business,” said Empire CFO Johanna Alm.

Empire is a marketing and distribution group in the home and household products industry. Its market is consumers in the Nordic and Baltic countries. Empire’s product line includes products by SodaStream, BaByliss and C3. The group had SEK 387 million in sales in 2010, and was listed on the Nasdaq OMQ First North Exchange in 2011.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Jan-Mar 2012
metadata.dc:description: Another stable quarter
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
January – March 2012

  • Net sales totaled SEK 49.7 million (46,0), up 8% (8)
  • Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) totaled SEK 38.7million (37.1)
  • Operating profit (EBITDA) was SEK 6.8 million (7.5), and the operating margin (EBITDA) 13% (16)
  • Net profit per share was SEK 0.78 (0.80)
  • Cash flow from continuing operations was SEK 5.1 million (12.2)
  • Battery Ventures has made a public offer for 100 % of Jeeves’ shares and warrants


CEO’s comment on performance
Jeeves’ turnover increased by 8 percent in Q1, maintaining an EBITDA margin of 13 percent.

The market situation has not changed, and we are seeing a strong interest in ERP systems with several procurements in progress. The deals that are closed continue to be with smaller companies in the SME segment. New sales and maintenance revenue remain stable, but the few larger deals are limiting growth. We have seen a healthy demand for our consultants.

Jeeves and its partners are gradually strengthening Jeeves’ offering and position in selected industry segments. During the quarter Jeeves launched a new concept for the Fashion sector (textile and design companies), which integrates companies’ design processes with an ERP system that is tailored to the sector’s particular needs. Several new fashion customers have also chosen Jeeves, both in Sweden and abroad. Building supply retailers are another important target group where we have signed new customers.

Jeeves, which supplies attractive products adapted to rapidly growing companies’ need for change and efficiency, is one of the few suppliers that continue to make new sales and increase its customer base. We are well positioned for growth, both in Sweden and abroad.

For more information
CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik +46 8 587 099 00 or CFO Anna Salomon-Sörensen +46 8 587 099 45.

Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. metadata.dc:title: HL Display opts for Jeeves’ ERP system worldwide
metadata.dc:description: HL Display was looking for an ERP system that could support its global business model more efficiently and discovered that it already had the solution. HL Display is going to redeploy Jeeves Universal to support its operations in 34 countries. The number of users will increase, from 400, to 500. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ partner SYSteam.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
This transaction entails a bundled product offering for HL Display’s global organization and includes orders, inventory, purchasing, invoicing, production, and more. The global business model also means that the internal logistics chain between production, distribution, and sales companies will be overhauled from the ground up, which will demand a redeployment.

“The purpose is to boost efficiency in every activity in the company. The choice of ERP system was crucial to us, because it is what enables us to execute our global business model. Jeeves Universal fulfills all the demands we’ve made and is an ERP system we’ve had great confidence in for some time,” says Fredrik Birkhammar, CIO, HL Display.

“As far back as in 1997, HL Display began to use Jeeves ERP systems, making them one of our oldest customers. Naturally, we’re extremely proud they’ve shown this renewed trust in us,” says Johan Krantz, Sales Director, Jeeves Universal.

HL Display is expert in merchandising and in-store communication and supplies products and solutions to customers in the food and non-food retail sectors as well as to brand manufacturers. The company has sales of approximately SEK 1.4 billion (2009) and has operations in 34 countries with 1,100 employees.

The transaction was recognized in the accounts for the fourth quarter of 2010.

 

For more information, please contact:

metadata.dc:title: Building materials industry chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: In March two building materials merchants, Ekesiöö and Handelsgruppen Bygg och Järn, selected a Jeeves ERP system solution for their industry. Both companies require an ERP system that is customized to the building materials industry and allows them to further develop their businesses. Jeeves’ partners Systemstöd and Tanico arranged the transactions.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
“Jeeves Universal gives us a modern and flexible standard system that meets all of our requirements in conjunction with Systemstöd’s industry vertical for building materials. It’s also an advantage that we can customize the solution to our requirements and continue refining it over time, which is important to us since we’re growing rapidly,” said Ekesiöö CFO Anders Ekesiöö.

Ekesiöö is a Stockholm-based building materials merchant with a head office in Bromma, Sweden. The company has around 40 employees and a turnover of around SEK 160 million. Ekesiöö has chosen a bundled product offering which includes a group license for Jeeves Universal and Systemstöd’s industry vertical for building products. The solution comprises accounting, purchasing, inventory, a point-of-sale system, decision support and document management, with 40 users. 

“When we were setting out to look for a new ERP system solution, one of our basic requirements was that it had to facilitate business development, function as a bundled product offering which would open up new opportunities for us, and be customized to the special requirements of the building products industry. Jeeves’ and Tanico’s industry-specific solution meets all of our requirements, and gives us a tool to increase the efficiency and quality of our work,” said Peter Backlund, IT Director of Handelsgruppen Bygg och Järn.

Handelsgruppen Bygg och Järn’s home market is the Swedish province of Dalarna, where they have expanded through acquisitions in recent years. The company has 40 employees and about SEK 140 million in turnover. It has chosen a bundled product offering that comprises a group license for Jeeves Selected and Tanico’s industry vertical for building products. The solution comprises orders, inventory, accounting and a point-of-sale system, with 40 users.

“Jeeves’ building materials solution is a popular choice because it addresses specific challenges in the industry and helps remove obstacles to companies’ growth. This is possible thanks to Jeeves’ flexibility, which also enables companies to develop their systems further as their businesses evolve,” said Jeeves Sales Director Lars Dahlberg.

The transactions have been recorded under Q1 2012.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves makes big drive in Russia
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems is proud to announce that as of today it is making a big drive in the Russian market. A Master Partner - Jeeves Business Solutions Ltd - has been established in order to create a network of Russian resellers and collaborative partners. The goal is to have at least 10 Russian partners within 18 months.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"Russia is an extremely exciting region that has the potential to become one of our large markets within 3 to 4 years," says Nicolas Ehrling, CEO of Jeeves Information Systems.

Jeeves Information Systems' business strategy is to develop the Jeeves Enterprise and Garp ERP systems. All sales and implementation is handled via a global partner network, which currently comprises over 60 partners. Until now, Jeeves Information Systems has not had any dedicated representative with Master Partner responsibility in Russia.

Jeeves Information Systems is now making a big drive in the Russian market. An agreement has been entered into with Jeeves Business Solutions Ltd (JBS). In its capacity as Master Partner, JBS will build up a partner network of Russian resellers and collaborative partners, who will sell and implement Jeeves Enterprise with a focus on midsize Russian manufacturing companies.

JBS is a hive-off from a pilot project conducted together with the Swedish/Russian company Advakom, which is run by Swedish entrepreneur Per Strandqvist and has operated in Russia since 1998. As its first project in Russia, Advakom implemented Jeeves Enterprise in its entire operation one year ago. Advakom has successfully made the transition from an outdated Russian system to Jeeves Enterprise.

"There is no modern and flexible ERP system tailored to midsize Russian manufacturing companies. Most international players are represented in Russia, but focus primarily on big companies. The domestic Russian systems are incredibly out-of-date when it comes to both functionality and technical platform. It is these local systems that Jeeves Enterprise will compete against. I am completely convinced that it will be a hit with Russian companies. There are no ERP systems of Jeeves Enterprise's caliber in Russia," says Per Strandqvist, President of Advakom.

The President of JBS will be Vadim Kharlamov, former Advakom IT manager. The Russian company's strategy is to act as a skills center for Jeeves Enterprise.

In order to give JBS the best possible conditions, Jeeves Enterprise has been adapted for the Russian market - all text in the interface has been translated into Russian and specific Russian conditions in business-critical processes have been included in the functionality. The Russian version of Jeeves Enterprise has already been implemented at a number of pilot customers, but will not be generally available on the Russian market until the the first quarter of 2007.

"Russia has the potential to become of our are largest markets. We are stepping on the scene at just the right time, as Russian industry is undergoing significant expansion and is in great need of a modern ERP system that they can grow with. The domestic suppliers can't keep pace while the large international ERP systems have their dance cards full with big customers. Jeeves Enterprise fills the gap by being able to offer an ERP system in demand at midsize Russian manufacturing companies," says Nicolas Ehrling.

The goal is for JBS to have a partner network of at least 10 resellers and collaborative partners within 18 months.

View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves' customers most satisfied
metadata.dc:description: Swedish customers are hampered by their ERP systems. A Swedish study shows that expensive upgrades reduce productivity. The solutions are aged and cannot handle the customers' requirement of continual improvements. The company that upgrades its ERP system can make great gains in productivity. But, few Swedish companies upgrade their ERP systems regularly. The reason is high costs says a new report from Radar Group International.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The generally low frequency of upgrades means that many Swedish companies miss out on significant opportunities for improved productivity," says Hans Werner, CEO of Radar Group International.

The conclusion was reached in a study conducted by Radar Group International during February and March of 2007 via in-depth interviews with 253 Swedish companies and organizations that have had their ERP systems since the start of the new millennium. The study compared the ERP systems IBS ASW, IFS, Jeeves, Movex (Lawson, formerly Intentia) and SAP. The focus of the study was number of upgrades, nature of the upgrades, scope and cost.

High costs of up to EUR 5,000 per workplace are the primary reason that companies do not upgrade their ERP system. The exception is Jeeves, with upgrade costs at about EUR 200 per workplace. According to the study, because of this Jeeves' customers update their ERP system more often than the customers of other suppliers.

"The ERP system is the heart of the customers' business. In order to make continual improvements, you must have an ERP system that is flexible, easy to upgrade and cost effective," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

According to the study, Jeeves' customers have made the most upgrades at a low cost per upgrade. For Jeeves' customers, the average upgrade cost during the life of the ERP system is SEK 5,300 while the equivalent figure for the competitors is between SEK 22,680 and 95,850. The lower cost has contributed to the statistic of Jeeves' customers upgrading their system an average of 2.65 times since 1999. At a far second was SAP with an average of 2.13 upgrades. In last place when it comes to frequency of upgrades is Movex customers, who only upgraded 0.84 times.

Jeeves' customers most satisfied
The system's age, number of upgrades, business changes as well as daily operation and administration of the system have also proven to affect customer satisfaction. One a scale of 1 to 3, customer satisfaction was at 2.9 for Jeeves customers, followed by SAP at 2.7 and IFS at 1.9. The most dissatisfaction came from Movex and IBS customers with an NKI index of 1.6 and 1.5, respectively.

All together, the Swedish ERP market had a turnover of SEK 2.3 billion in licensing and support revenue in 2007 and an additional SEK 7 billion in consulting revenue. Today, 8 system suppliers share 92 percent of the license value of the market. Jeeves share is assessed at 6 percent. The remaining 8 percent is split among hundreds of suppliers, with IBS responsible for the majority. 1,730 businesses with more than 50 employees will be investing in a new ERP system in the upcoming twelve months.

More information on the study: http://www.radargroup.se/attachments/whitepaper.ppt

metadata.dc:title: Report Annual General Meeting 2012
metadata.dc:description: Report from Jeeves Information Systems AB’s Annual General Meeting on May 15, 2012
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
BV Acquisitions AB (“BV Acquisitions”), a company controlled by Battery Ventures IX (AIV II), L.P., (“Battery”), announced on 26 March 2012 a recommended cash offer to the shareholders and warrant holders in Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ) (“Jeeves”) to acquire all outstanding shares and warrants in Jeeves. During the initial acceptance period the offer has been accepted to the extent that BV Acquisitions will hold shares, representing approximately 97 per cent of the total number of shares and votes and warrants representing approximately 99 per cent of the total number of outstanding warrants in Jeeves. All conditions for the offer have therefore been fulfilled and BV Acquisitions has declared the Offer wholly unconditional on May 10, 2012.

With this in mind, the most essential resolutions of the Annual General Meeting on May 15, 2012 were the following:

Dividend
The Annual General Meeting resolved that no dividend should be paid for the fiscal year 2011.

Election of the board
The Annual General Meeting resolved to elect R David Tabors, Richard Paul Smith, Morad Elhafed and Jesper Gustafsson as board members and to elect R David Tabors as chairman of the board.

Other resolutions
The Annual General Meeting resolved not to approve the suggestions to authorize the Board to decide regarding the Company’s repurchasing of its own shares or to decide about the issue of new shares.

The information in this report is information that Jeeves is required to publish under the Swedish Securities Markets Act. The information was submitted for publication at 8.30 am on May 16, 2012.

Jeeves Information Systems AB (publ)

metadata.dc:title: Net Insight choose Jeeves ERP system
metadata.dc:description: – Jeeves partner InfoCube enters into agreement with stock exchange listed Net Insight on delivery of Jeeves Enterprise. The company has shown strong growth, which places special demands for system support that handles all business processes in the company.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"Net Insight has grown quickly during the past two years. It is therefore critical that the company get system support for all Net Insight business processes. Jeeves Enterprise meets these requirements while also giving Net Insight a flexible and upgradeable ERP system," says Lars Kevsjö, CFO of Net Insight.

Net Insight offers cost-effective and scalable optical transport solutions for media networks, digital terrestrial television, mobile TV networks and IPTV/cable TV networks.

"Jeeves Enterprise meets Net Insight's system solution requirements with a solution that is cost effective and easy to upgrade," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves.

The deal was struck by Jeeves' partner InfoCube.

"The solution that InfoCube will deliver to Net Insight covers all business process of the company. I am happy to welcome another listed company into the InfoCube family," says Jonas Hammarberg, Marketing and Sales Director at InfoCube.

"InfoCube has solid experience in the implementation of Jeeves. We are confident in our choice of partner," says Lars Kevsjö, CFO of Net Insight.

metadata.dc:title: ERP vendor Jeeves appoints new CEO
metadata.dc:description: The Board of directors of Jeeves has appointed a new CEO. Software Industry veteran Jeff Tognoni assumed his new position on August 27, 2012.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeff Tognoni is an American software entrepreneur and executive with long experience in the international enterprise software industry. He has developed many successful software enterprises, in the role of CEO. Most recently, Jeff comes from a position as CEO of Consona, an American based software company owned by Battery Ventures. Before its recent sale and merger with Aptean, Consona was an international vendor of SME ERP and Global 2000 CRM software and services. Under Jeff’s leadership over the last nine years, the company was one of the fastest growing and most profitable software businesses in its industry.

"Bengt-Åke Älgevik has been critical to the growth and development of Jeeves as both a board member and CEO of Jeeves. He has successfully laid the foundations for Jeeves’ international platform as well as for the development of its multiple extremely competitive ERP products.  As Jeeves is entering a new phase, with a renewed focus on growth and expansion, the leadership role will also change. Jeff is a skilled entrepreneur with extensive experience developing software companies in several markets. He is an important part of our strategy to take Jeeves into the top ranks of the international SME ERP market," says Dave Tabors, Chairman of Jeeves and General Partner of Battery.

metadata.dc:title: Swedish fashion firm Rodebjer chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Rodebjer is growing, and wanted an ERP system tailored to growing firms in the fashion industry. Their objective was to streamline their information flow from the sketching table all the way out to stores. They found the solution they wanted in the industry solution Jeeves for Fashion. Jeeves’ partner Infocube arranged the transaction.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
“With Jeeves for Fashion we will be a more efficient organization and we can spend our time on the right things. We’ll optimize our information flow and work processes, and this system will save us a lot of time. The time savings come above all in production, accounting, sales and logistics, where we did a lot of tasks manually in the past,” said Rodebjer CEO Nina Lindvall.

Today Rodebjer has a presence in twelve markets worldwide through resellers, its own stores and its online store.

“An ERP system is a big investment for a small company like Rodebjer, and I believe that’s why many companies in the industry wait to make this type of decision until they’ve grown. For us it was important to make this investment because we have an aggressive expansion plan which requires us to optimize all of our resources. Jeeves will be one of the tools that makes this optimization possible. Jeeves was the supplier that offered the most professional product best suited to a company like ours, with a well-developed production module,” said Lindvall.

Rodebjer, with its head office in Stockholm, has turnover of about SEK 23 million.  The brand was established in 2001 by designer Carin Rodebjer, who has won numerous awards including “Fresh Faces in Fashion” from GenArt, “Designer of the Year” from Swedish Elle and “Guldknappen” (the Gold Button) from Swedish magazine Damernas Värld. Rodebjer has twelve employees, and offices in Stockholm and New York.

The transaction with Jeeves entails total support for Rodebjer’s entire operation, encompassing production, logistics, accounting and sales. The transaction consists of a license for the ERP system Jeeves ERP Fashion and the PDM system Jeeves Design Management. The ERP system solution will be implemented beginning in June, so that it will be operational by August in time for sales of Rodebjer’s 2013 spring and summer collection.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves strengthens its fashion portfolio
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves is acquiring the company IMDA and its PISA product, a product Data Management (PDM) System for fashion and textile firms that create their own designs.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The acquisition brings Jeeves the three employee firm and its PISA product, which is a modern PDM system used by over twenty fashion and design firms with well-known brands such as Nudie Jeans and Eton Fashion. PISA integrates with several ERP systems.

“Fashion is a growth area for Jeeves where we already have around 130 customers. Our acquisition of IMDA is part of our strategy to augment our offering to customers in the fashion, sports, shoe and textile industries,” said Jeeves CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik.

Pisa will continue to be sold as a standalone product, but it will be integrated into Jeeves' technical architecture as well.

“For IMDA this transaction means that we are becoming part of a larger organization with the additional capabilities and resources to support our customers throughout the entire flow from design/sketch to finished product,” said IMDA CEO Ingela Cronholm-Edgren.

The acquisition will be completed on July 1 2011. It is expected to have a marginal positive effect on Jeeves’ 2011 earnings per share.

metadata.dc:title: Tenson reduces costs with Garp from Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: "New IT support reduces costs by 45 percent. The Swedish sportswear company Tenson chooses the Garp ERP system from Jeeves' wholly owned subsidiary Microcraft, getting an integrated e-commerce solution and decision-making support from QlikView in the bargain.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"With DTS as supplier and the Garp ERP system from Jeeves, we expect greatly reduce our costs for IT system, operation and maintenance. The new environment also creates new and better opportunities to let IT support the expansion on our horizon," says Hans-Olof Ljungqvist, President of Tenson.

Tenson chose Garp for a more cost-effective and scalable environment that at the same time is based on a modern standard system. Tenson's previous system environment was based on a self-developed solution.

"The contract between DTS and Tenson solidifies Garp as a leading ERP system supplier within the sports industry," says Bernt Olausson, President of Microcraft.

Tenson is headquartered in Gothenburg. In addition to operations in most European countries, there is a great deal of activity in the Netherlands, which is also the home of the distribution center and sales office. More information is available at: www.tenson.se

The IT services company DTS Solutions, with its 35 employees, has its seat in Borås. The company estimates a 2007 turnover of MSEK 50. The customer base includes Cross Sportswear, Five Seasons, 8848 Altitude, Galvin Green, Markslöjd, Eton Fashion, Blåkläder, Eco-Boråstapeter and Prêt à Porter. More information is available at: www.dts.se

Jeeves is Europe's fastest-growing ERP system supplier. Jeeves develops ERP systems for companies in the manufacturing, retail, maintenance and service sectors. The company focuses on product development while sales are handled by subsidiaries, partners and resellers. The company's main products are Jeeves Enterprise and Garp.

  • Cash flow from operating activities was SEK 22.1 million (2.0)

 

CEO’s comment on performance

In the Nordic region and internationally, we see promising and significant growth in our pipeline, not least thanks to several major projects. However, it’s harder to judge when major orders can be completed, and during the quarter fewer transactions were concluded than expected. The second quarter lacked growth, which consequently did not meet our expectations. It was satisfying to note an improved EBITDA margin: 15% compared to 12% for the same quarter the preceding year.

During the period, Jeeves enhanced its growth and profitability. Sales for the period ended at SEK 94 million, for a growth rate of 4%. During the period, growth resulted above all from market recovery and improved software sales in the Nordic region. We have also gradually boosted capacity utilization for our consultants. Profitability has stabilized and improved, for an EBITDA margin of 16%.

During the period, we saw increased demand in our markets outside the Nordic region, too, resulting in significant growth in our international pipeline. We are pleased that several of our new partners in the United States, Germany, and France landed their first key clients.

While we were building orders in our pipeline, we strengthened our market offering with several product innovations. With Jeeves 3.0, to be launched this autumn, we will raise user-friendliness to an entirely new level.

metadata.dc:title: Meat specialist Ingemar Johansson chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: One of Sweden’s largest privately owned producers of processed meat, Ingemar Johansson AB, chooses Jeeves Universal to support its operations. Jeeves Universal will completely replace the company’s previous ERP system, covering about 10 user licenses. Jeeves’ partner Ninetech is responsible for the transaction and deployment.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Ingemar Johansson is one of Sweden’s major privately owned producers of processed meat. Their production plant has received the highest level quality accreditation—for safe packaging, distribution, and storage—possible under the BRC Global Standard from EFSIS, one of the world’s foremost inspection bodies for food processing. When their existing ERP system was no longer under development, the company faced a change.

“We looked at a range of alternative systems. The reason we went for Jeeves was that we get a flexible solution that can be adapted to our specific operations. We saw that we could improve and boost the efficiency of our accounting functions at the same time as we streamline our order, invoicing, and inventory management,” says Lena Sundberg, Coordinator/HR Manager at Ingemar Johansson AB.
Jeeves’ partner Ninetech will implement the system during spring 2011.

The transaction was recognized in the accounts for fourth quarter 2010.


For more information:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director, Jeeves Information Systems
+46-8-5870-9968, lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Lena Sunderg, Coordinator/HR Manager, Ingemar Johansson AB
+46-31-578-201, Lena@ijab.se, www.ingemarjohansson.se


Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, or Garp. All products offer broad functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Selected makes it easier for companies to grow
metadata.dc:description: Now growth companies can continue their success and grow without having to change ERP system. Jeeves launches the ERP system Jeeves Selected – a solution targeting small growth companies (5-50 employees). Jeeves Selected handles both the simple needs of small businesses as well as the complex needs of large companies.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The choice of ERP system is critical for a company´s ability to establish growth and competitive advantage. As the operation expands, many small growth companies face new obstacles. Their existing ERP system lacks the potential for expanded functionality, operational support, and improved reporting. At the same time new suppliers and customers demand integration with external systems. An upgrade of their existing ERP system is often inevitable.

- ”Changing ERP system demands a large investment and a great effort from a small company in growth, whilst facing the risk to lose business focus”, says Daniel Göhlin, responsible for Jeeves Selected sales. “When a company invests in Jeeves Selected it’s the last time they change ERP system”.

Jeeves Selected offers a modern and flexible ERP system, adapted to fit the small company´s central needs. As the operation expands, new functionality can gradually be added to the initial solution in order to fit new requirements from the company´s users, suppliers and customers. Finally, the company is ready to grow into Jeeves Universal, a full-fledged ERP system for mid-sized companies (50-1000 employees).

Jeeves Selected is built on the same platform as Jeeves Universal. The common platform makes it possible to avoid the traditional system change and instead allows for seamless growth into the larger system.

- ”With Jeeves Selected/Universal, we are the first to offer seamless growth between two ERP systems for different target groups”, accentuates Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves. “That is something no one else can offer”.

With Jeeves Selected, Jeeves strengthens its position in the entire SME-segment. The system´s adaptation to fit needs of small growth companies is an important complement to Jeeves Universal aimed toward mid-sized companies. Small-sized companies with 5-49 employees constitute about 75 percent of all companies in the SME-segment (5-1000 employees) and have proven strong growth during the last five years. During last year, more than 50 percent of all small-sized companies grew more than 25 percent measured in net sales. Many companies also showed good profit.*

Jeeves Selected is available on the market starting May, 2008.

* according to UC, Sweden

For more information, please contact:
Daniel Göhlin, responsible for Jeeves Selected sales
Phone: +46 (0)8 587 099 00
e-mail: daniel.gohlin@jeeves.se

Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves
phone: 46 (0)8 587 099 00
e-mail: lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems has the fastest growth rate in Europe among ER system suppliers.* Jeeves designs ERP systems for companies in sectors such as manufacturing, trade, service and administration. The Jeeves group focuses on product development, while sales are handled by partners and distributors. Jeeves collaborates with approximately 70 partners across the globe as well as 20 partners in Sweden. Jeeves’ main products are Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, all in all installed at over 3.900 companies. Present operations started in 1992, and the company has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 1999. www.jeeves.se

*Source: Gartner, August 2006

metadata.dc:title: Published by Jeeves Deutschland: XMART and Jeeves seal distribution deal for Jeeves Universal ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems AB, headquartered in Stockholm and with over 4,000 installations one of the leading providers of business software for medium-sized companies, forges a long-term strategic partnership with XMART IT Consulting GmbH, based in Oftersheim in the German state of Baden-Württemberg. The agreement, which was sealed during this year’s international Jeeves Partner Conference in the Swedish town of Ystad, provides the basis for marketing Jeeves Universal and for customer support services with regard to the company’s ERP product line in southwest Germany. With XMART, Jeeves has secured another strong distribution partner for the German market – a partner that is also successful on the international stage as a provider of complete IT services.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Rugendorf, Germany, 15 June 2010:
“We create solutions” reads the mission statement of XMART IT Consulting GmbH – the consultancy and IT service provider based in Oftersheim, Germany, which was founded in 1998. The range of services provided by XMART includes project management, customised programming and IT outsourcing, through to the design and implementation of heterogeneous networks and overall process optimisation. Building on its long-standing experience in projects involving medium-sized companies, XMART will soon be extending its service portfolio with Jeeves Universal to include the business-critical areas of ERP and Business Intelligence.

Systems and processes that are efficient and flexible, a strong development and support infrastructure as well as powerful and future-proof solutions, coupled with expertise and individual service for demanding customers – these are the cornerstones of XMART’s business and the basis for its success. To be able to provide its customers with an ongoing, comprehensive service, XMART has consistently invested in the development of its own employees ever since it was founded. XMART staff become part of the customer’s operations and a key supplier of effective processes in the customer’s business.

Why Jeeves?
“In recent years we have been focusing our attention on particular IT processes and components in businesses and in doing so it has become increasingly apparent how important a flexible, comprehensive and, at the same time, end-to-end ERP system is. The scope of functions and ease with which Jeeves can be adapted to the particular needs of a company are compelling,” remarks Thomas Martin, Managing Director of XMART IT Consulting GmbH on the reasoning behind the Jeeves partnership. “With Jeeves, we want to enable our customers to adapt more quickly to market factors, to address the needs of their customers more flexibly and to simply grow more quickly. Jeeves offers us and our customers the ability to do this.”

“With XMART IT Consulting GmbH we have been able to secure a key partner in the Rhine-Neckar triangle. Given XMART’s long-standing expertise in the IT sector, the calibre of its personnel and its clear intention to grow in the ERP sector, this partnership provides a stable basis for existing and new customers in the region,” says Eckhard Wernich, Director International Business Development, Jeeves Sweden. “The partnership with XMART IT Consulting GmbH is an important building block in our strategy in the German market. We have secured a partner that has demonstrated through its expertise in the IT market how important stability and trust is for continuous growth.”

About XMART IT Consulting GmbH
XMART IT Consulting GmbH has been growing as a company for over ten years, providing professional, high-quality services for all sectors of the IT market. XMART supports customers in Germany and internationally from Dubai to Europe and the US. To ensure its demanding customers receive the best possible support, the company employs the latest technologies and develops tailor-made solutions for individual customers. XMART offers a complete IT service for all operational processes.

About Jeeves Deutschland GmbH
Jeeves Deutschland GmbH is a wholly owned subsidiary of Jeeves Information Systems AB, which was founded in Stockholm in 1992. Jeeves Information Systems AB is one of the leading manufacturers of business software in Europe for medium-sized companies and develops innovative package solutions for businesses in the industrial, wholesale and service sectors. According to Exido’s IT barometer, Jeeves ERP is Sweden’s most popular ERP system. The solution is distributed and implemented via subsidiaries, certified resellers and a global network of selected partners in over 70 locations and 19 countries. The main product lines are Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp. Over 4,000 customers use the Jeeves systems. Jeeves has been listed on the NASDAQ OMX (Small Cap) since 1999. For further information please visit www.jeeves.de

 

For more information:

Barbara Furthmueller, Managing Director
Jeeves Deutschland GmbH
+49 9223 945 90 18

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Board decides to buy back shares
metadata.dc:description: Supported by authorization from the 2007 annual general meeting, the Board of Jeeves Information System AB has decided in favor of a buyback of own shares in the company.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
On August 28, 2007, the Board of Jeeves Information Systems AB decided to within the framework of the authorization from the annual general meeting of May 15, 2007 provide provide execution management for the buyback of own shares in the company. The buyback of own shares will total no more than 5 percent of the total number of shares in the company. The purpose is to enable an adaptation of the company's capital structure based on the company's capital needs, thereby helping to increase shareholder value.

The acquisition will be at the Stockholm Stock Exchange at a price within registered interval between the highest buy price and the lowest sell price at that time. Acquisition will be from August 31, 2007 up to the annual general meeting of 2008. There will, however, be no acquisition for 30 days prior to publication of the quarterly report, including the day of publication.

Jeeves Information System currently does not hold any own shares. The total number of issued shares is currently 2,987,864 and the highest number of shares for the buyback is 149,393. Shares that are bought back will be invalidated.


 

View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: HL Display upgrades to Polish version of Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Display has decided to upgrade to the Polish version of Jeeves Enterprise for their Polish operations.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"Never before have I seen such a well-developed local version," says Andrzej Lesniewski, Project Manager for HL Display Poland.

HL Display, a leader in retail trade communication, operates in 32 countries. A previous Group decision required that all Group operations use the same ERP system version. The intention is to keep maintenance costs down. Now, all operations use Jeeves Enterprise 9.0, international version for their business-critical processes.

HL Display, however, has now decided to deviate from the Group decision and implement Jeeves Enterprise 9.2, Polish version, for its operations in Poland. This gives users benefits such as a user-friendly interface where everything is written in Polish. Jeeves Enterprise 9.2 also has deepened functionality that is tailored to Polish business.

"One of our employees showed us the advantages she would gain by being able to use the Polish version of Jeeves Enterprise 9.2. Her selling points combined with the clearly visible business advantages made us decide to deviate from our Group decision. We realized that the gain in profitability would be greater than the increase in maintenance caused when our Polish operations upgrade to Jeeves Enterprise 9.2. This made the decision an easy one," says Andrzej Lesniewski.

HL Display's decision gives Jeeves Information Systems in Poland a renowned reference customer and a clear indication that the work invested in developing Polish version of Jeeves Enterprise was a giant step in the right direction.

"Our main focus is on selling the Polish version of Jeeves Enterprise 9.2 to new customers in Poland. The fact that existing customers, such as HL Display, also choose to upgrade to the Polish version is a sign that our product development truly succeeds in its work to make our customers' businesses more efficient," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales and Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

metadata.dc:title: Published by Jeeves North America: Jenexus Business Solutions Announces Global Bar Code Solution Provider Chooses Jeeves Universal for their North American Office
metadata.dc:description: Opticon USA advances from Macola to Jeeves Universal and Jeeves CRM to Operate on a Fully Integrated Solution and Improve Operations
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Portland, Oregon – April 30, 2010
Jenexus Business Solutions, the national leading provider of business management solutions announced that Opticon USA (Renton, WA) has procured Jeeves Universal and Jeeves CRM from them to deploy a fully integrated accounting, manufacturing and CRM solution. Opticon USA is the North American operation of Opticon, a worldwide family of companies consisting of OPTO Electronics (Japan), Opticon Inc. (North America) and Opticon Sensors (Europe BV).

Founded in 1976, Opticon has been the global pioneer in the manufacture of automatic identification technologies. In 1984 Opticon Inc. opened its offices in the United States, servicing a wide range of clients in the US, Canada and Mexico. They are the industry leader in laser bar code scanning, two dimensional imaging, RFID, CCD and data collection technologies. With sixteen offices worldwide, Opticon is poised to aggressively meet the technology needs of customers and partners around the globe.

Mike Waters, Operations Manager at Opticon USA said, “We are long overdue for an ERP system. The program we are using now is limited and offers no reporting capabilities. Our focus is to improve processes and simplify day to day operations. The Jeeves offering from Jenexus has everything we need to integrate our business and provide excellent visibility to our management team.”

Waters also said, “Our sister companies have been using Jeeves and are more than satisfied with their results. We look forward to finding similar success with Jeeves and Jenexus Business Solutions.”

Henry Denoudsten, President at Jenexus Business Solutions said, “Jeeves Universal is designed to support the business management demands of Opticon. The integration capabilities of Jeeves Universal are designed to meet the visibility needs of this organization. For example, the new solution will offer up to the minute visibility for their orders allowing Opticon to have complete visibility throughout the order fulfillment process including integrating orders back to the other Opticon business
units.”

Opticon USA is focused exclusively on developing and manufacturing world-class laser, imaging, CCD and RFID engines. These engines in turn are used to power Opticon's scanners and data collectors. Opticon USA maintains its industry leadership by constantly developing innovative technology and deploying it across its rich product line, featuring fixed mount, cabled and wireless products as well as a wide range of communication options and accessories. Opticon designs and manufactures its products in ISO 9002 certified facilities, and observes international standards of quality, safety and environmental protection.

 

For more information
Henry Denoudsten, Jenexus Business Solutions
+1 503.764.4184
h.denoudsten@jenexus.com


About Jenexus Business Solutions
Jenexus delivers comprehensive integrated business management solutions for fast-growing and middle-market businesses throughout United States and Canada. We help solve our clients’ needs in process and discrete manufacturing, distribution, oil and gas field service, and sales force automation by delivering solutions that streamline vital data flow between business systems and back-office accounting applications. For more information visit www.jenexus.com or call 866.578.7219.

Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of ERP-systems, who provides companies with efficient solutions to develop and support their business processes with the products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp. Jeeves ERP system offers a wide functionality to the lowest total cost of ownership in the market*. metadata.dc:title: World-leading airport solutions to be supported by Swedish Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Safegate, offering world leading solutions for improved safety, efficiency and environmental standards at airports, is replacing all of its ERP solutions to Swedish Jeeves Universal. Jeeves´ Partner Infocube accounts for implementation and maintenance.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
In the deal, Safegate will switch a variety of systems towards a comprehensive solution, based on Jeeves Universal, with functions for financials, orders, inventory, invoicing, purchasing, production and inter-company transactions.

- With the world's leading docking and airport lighting systems we are experiencing a steady growth and have since long resisted the troubled times in the aviation market. Our ERP system must facilitate further growth while increasing our efficiency internally. Another reason for choosing Jeeves Universal was the system's usability and flexibility in presenting data. Infocube, who will implement the system, suits us well both when it comes to attitude and approach, "says Steve Rutland, CEO of Safegate.

The initial order covers about 40 users, and within three years Safegate expects to have introduced Jeeves Universal in about ten subsidiaries.

metadata.dc:title: Norwegian fashion sensation Riccovero chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: The Riccovero clothing brand has been a success in its native Norway, with strong growth in recent years. This puts new demands on its ERP system. In order to support its growth Riccovero has chosen the “Jeeves for Fashion” industry solution, which has been developed for the textile and ready-to-wear sector. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ partner Merit Consulting AS.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
“When we began searching for a new ERP solution, it was important for it to be flexible and user-friendly, while also allowing for continuous change management since Riccovero is still growing. Jeeves for Fashion gives us the most cutting-edge industry solution on the market, with support that makes life easier both for us and our customers,” said Ricoverro COO Sverre-Magne Haugen.

“Merit Consulting is one of the leading companies in Northern Europe when it comes to implementing ERP systems, and they have solid knowledge of the industry,” Haugen continued. ”As a result we can work with their consultants to grow our business together.”

Riccovero has over NOK 90 million in turnover, with 27 employees and eight concept stores around Norway. The company was founded in 1936 by tailor Einar Kvamme and received its present name when Finn Einar Kvamme took over the company in 1986. Today Riccovero is an award-winning lifestyle brand. The Jeeves deal means that Riccovero receives comprehensive support for its entire business, including production, logistics, accounting and POS systems. There are 25 users.

metadata.dc:title: Market-leading Lahega Kemi chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems (“Jeeves”) has through its partner InfoCube received a large order from Lahega Kemi. Lahega replaces its former ERP system with the Jeeves ERP system for the entire group.
metadata.dc:creator: admin
metadata.field:
- We were looking for a flexible and upgradeable ERP system that could be put to strategic use in our strive for growth. The choice was Jeeves since it is very important to us that the system can be used by all parts of the business and that it is also capable of growing along with the business, says Mikael Lundborg, deputy CEO at Lahega Kemi.

Lahega Kemi AB runs one of the most modern factories in Europe with production and sales of chemico-technical products to customers within vehicle maintenance; passenger cars and trucks, for professional users and for consumers, to hygiene customers within the food industry and to state and municipal administration, and to the engineering industry. This makes Lahega Kemi AB the market leading enterprise in Sweden. During 2006, Lahega Kemi AB has also started to set up in business on the European market.

- Jeeves’ offer is very attractive for midsized companies that experience a strong growth rate and need an ERP system that can be adapted to the business progress. InfoCube has with Lahega Kemi initiated an important deal for Jeeves where we will be following the customer’s growth process, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves.

The order has been signed by the Jeeves Information System’s partner InfoCube.

- Lahega Kemi is a large assignment for InfoCube with installations and licenses spanning all over the group and this means that Jeeves will be an important driving force in Lahega Kemi’s growth, says Jonas Hammarberg, Marketing and Sales Director at InfoCube.

For more information, please contact:

metadata.dc:title: Year-end Report Jan–Dec 2009
metadata.dc:description: Sweden’s most popular ERP system grows
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
• Revenue totaled SEK 180.4million (158.3), up 13% (22)
  • Software revenues (licenses andmaintenance) rose 6% (11)
  • Operating profit was SEK 14.3 million (16.6), giving an operating margin of 8% (10)
  • Profit after tax totaled SEK 10.1 million (13.1), giving a profit margin of 6% (8)
  • Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 3.5 (4.6)
  • Cash flow was SEK 3.8 million (2.1), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 42.2 million (38.2)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 33% (32)
  • The Board of Directors proposes a dividend of 1.50 per share (1.50)

 

CEO’s comment on 2009 performance
Jeeves continues to grow. Sales increased 13% (22) in 2009, with sales to smaller companies
(20–200 employees) advancing the most. The rate of growth was affected by the scarcity of
major transactions in the market.

Under current market conditions, we are pleased with these results, which demonstrate Jeeves’
resilience and strength. Slower growth combined with the costs of the ongoing build-up of our
international sales channels have an impact on profitability.

In the Swedish market for ERP systems, Jeeves is consolidating its strong position. We are proud
to have been named “Sweden’s most popular ERP system,” announced in the Exido IT
Barometer in December 2009. Roughly 1,000 IT managers in Sweden participated in the survey.

The proportion of foreign transactions increased during the year, chiefly in Norway. However,
conditions are tough in several of our markets, and international growth has not met our
expectations. We foresee ongoing tentative demand for ERP systems, primarily from larger
companies (200–500 employees). Demand in this segment picks up late in the business cycle.

I have immense confidence in Jeeves. Together with our partners, we will continue to generate
new business. Our attractive and highly flexible offer provides customers with outstanding
benefits at a low cost of ownership and, combined with the investments we are making in
our sales channels, it puts us in an excellent position to gain market shares and to keep
growing profitably.


About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB develops Sweden's most popular ERP system*. The products, Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp, offer wide functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. Customers exceed 4.000 companies in more than 40 countries. Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. www.jeeves.se/en

* Exido IT-barometern 2009

 

Read the entire report.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Q1 Jan–Mar 2008
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves ERP grows internationally
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
January – March 2008

• Turnover amounted to SEK 34.3 million (31.4) and increased by 9% (8)
• Software revenues (license and maintenance) increased by 16% (5)
• The operating profit was SEK 4.8 million (4.5) and the operating margin was 14% (14)
• Net results after tax amounted to SEK 3.2 million (3.7) and the Net margin was 9% (12)
• Earnings per share after taxes was SEK 1.1 (1.2)
• The cash flow was SEK 10.7 million (5.4) and cash and current investments amounted to SEK 47.0 million (35.5)
• The debt-equity ratio was 37% (43)

CEO’s comments on the results

Jeeves results are developing according to plan. The first quarter shows a strong and stable profit. We are proud of having shown a positive result for each single quarter during six years.

I am very happy that Jeeves during the quarter have won three major international customers who will roll out Jeeves in several countries. Our international investments are carrying fruit and we look positive on our international development.

The market keeps being strong, despite a weakening in the world economics. We and our partners meet a continuously good demand for ERP-systems, both in Sweden and internationally.

The growth is 9% and we actively work with activities to increase growth even more. Jeeves are stating its position as a strong player in the entire SME-segment where our systems Jeeves and Garp are attracting larger and smaller companies. During the quarter the license sales to new customers within logistics and trade have been strong after a period dominated with new customers in manufacturing. The license sales to customer base have been limited which makes our expectations on customer base sales in the coming quarters to increase.

Considering the market situation and our strong offerings together with our growing network of partners I feel confident for the future development of Jeeves. 

 

Read the entire report

metadata.dc:title: AB Orwak chooses Jeeves ERP-system for the entire business
metadata.dc:description: AB Orwak, a leading machine manufacturer of compression solutions for waste, chooses the ERP-system Jeeves Universal for the entire Swedish operation with a total of 50 users. The new ERP-solution has been sold by InfoCube, who will be their partner in implementation and maintenance.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The flexibility and width of the ERP-system together with a stable, experienced partner made them choose Jeeves Universal and InfoCube.

- Jeeves Universal has a combination of flexibility and usability, as well as a wide spectra of functionality, that suits our type of company perfectly. At the same time, we feel very confident having InfoCube as our partner and we are certain that we will build a long term relationship with them, says Stefan Ek, CEO Orwak.

Overall InfoCube has experienced good sales of Jeeves Universal, especially to companies within the manufacturing industry.

- Lately, we have won several installations of Jeeves Universal within the industrial vertical discrete manufacturing. Primarily, it’s the flexibility and the possibility to tailor the ERP-system according to the customers’ particular needs that is attractive, says Anders Brunmarker, responsible seller at InfoCube.

metadata.dc:title: QlikView becomes standard in Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: The decision support tool QlikView is to become an integral part of the standard version of Jeeves' ERP system (version 3.0). This is the result of a partnership agreement between Jeeves and QlikTech, an internationally leading supplier of solutions for user-driven Business Intelligence, BI.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The built-in tool comprises around ten standard QlikView applications, including analysis views for order intake, stock trends and financial results. Jeeves will also develop apps based on QlikView.

QlikView is one of the most attractive tools for business analysis and visualization. Up until now it has mainly been used by larger companies, but this is starting to change.

“Jeeves is the only ERP system for the SME segment that offers QlikView as standard. Together with QlikTech, we are lowering the threshold and giving small and medium-sized enterprises access to the powerful BI tools as part of Jeeves,” says Magnus Sjökvist, product manager at Jeeves.

“We’re extremely satisfied with the partnership with Jeeves. The decision to adopt QlikView as a BI platform for Jeeves’ ERP system will give their customers and partners new opportunities to simplify the decision-making process for users at all levels,” says Mats Gullberg, who is responsible for QlikTech’s global OEM channel.   

The apps that Jeeves develops in addition to standard applications mean that users are given the potential to explore ERP data from various perspectives, such as finance, sales, distribution, production, purchasing or personnel – all at lightning speed. Users will be able to download the apps from Jeeves Apps Market, Jeeves’ market place for new ERP system applications existing alongside the standard system.

“Within Jeeves Apps Market, both Jeeves and our partners can continue to develop and market new commercial apps based on QlikView. This will provide a wealth of tools for Business Discovery apps for those organizations that use Jeeves’ ERP system,” says Sjökvist.

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Sjökvist, Product Manager, Jeeves
+46 (0)8 587 099 39
magnus.sjokvist@jeeves.se

Mats Gullberg, responsible for QlikTech’s global OEM channel
+46 (0)10 209 76 04
mats.gullberg@qlikview.com


About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Every day, Jeeves' ERP solutions; Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, are used by more than 4 600 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves' ERP systems are user friendly and easy to customize, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of business support. Jeeves' head office is located in Stockholm and is owned by the American investment company Battery Ventures. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en

metadata.dc:title: 20 new customers when Jeeves targets smaller growing companies
metadata.dc:description: The ERP-system Jeeves Selected, targeting smaller growth companies, was released in 2008 and has already gained 20 new customers. The key is a fully integrated ERP-system tailored to the smaller companies´ functionality demands and easily adapted to their growth.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Djurås Verkstad in Dalarna is one of the first companies to have installed Jeeves
Selected. Since the end of 2008 the new system is used throughout the entire
business. Maria Vestlund, CFO says:

- We outgrew our old system. We couldn’t improve our business further and we
lacked control over our flows since most of the work was done manually. Now
I have a complete support for the business and an overview of the company
from purchasing and inventory to sales and invoicing without an increase in
administration. This is important if we want to develop further.

Jeeves Selected is specially made to meet the competent business support demands
of smaller growing companies’ (5-25 users). Many companies in the target group
have access to a financial system, but lack support to efficiently plan and run their
operations. Jeeves Selected is an adapted version of the larger Jeeves Universal
and brings financials, operations and business planning together in one solution for
the smaller company. Since the system is built on the same platform as Jeeves
Universal, the companies can grow without having to worry about their ERP-solution.

- With Jeeves Selected we have succeeded in something that our competitors
have not – giving the smaller companies access to a fully integrated ERPsystem
that they can grow and develop with without having to change system
as the business gets more complex and the number of users grow. The
advantage of Jeeves is that we have a common platform for the small and the
big system. And above all, we and our partners have experience and
knowledge of the smaller companies’ needs, says Magnus Sjökvist, Product
Director Jeeves.

The Jeeves Selected investment is focused on trading and manufacturing
companies. During 2009 a solution for variant management for the clothing industry
will be launched.

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Sjökvist, Product Director - Jeeves Information Systems,
Phone: 08-587 099 00
e-mail: magnus.sjokvist@jeeves.se

Håkan Magnusson, Business Partner Sales Manager - Jeeves Selected,
