metadata.dc:title: Jeeves acquires company in Norway
metadata.dc:description: ERP system supplier Jeeves has signed a letter of intent on May 14 regarding the acquisition of all shares in the Norwegian company Logistikk-og-IT Partner A/S (LogIT Gruppen). The deal is an important step in Jeeves’ growth strategy and means that the company strengthens its position on the Norwegian market.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The Norwegian company LogIT Gruppen owns, develops and sells ERP systems with the emphasis on small and midsize companies on the Norwegian market. The company’s own ERP system Lösning1 has around 100 customers, mainly within the trade sector. A related consultancy is run alongside the ERP system. In 2007, LogIT Gruppen had a turnover of 30 MNOK and the number of employees was 20. The company has offices in Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim and Molde.

The Norwegian market for small and midsize companies is interesting. According to Proff/Norge, there are around 37.000 limited companies in the 10-999 employee segment, which is around 75% of the number of corresponding companies in Sweden, according to UC Sverige. The bottom part of the segment with 10-49 employees is even a bit larger than the Swedish market.

- Moving our position forward on the Norwegian market is an important step towards reaching our growth objectives, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves. The acquisition gives us a strong base for new sales, but we also have around 50 existing customers in Norway that we now have a better opportunity to develop together with our partners. For LogIT Gruppen, the acquisition means that they now better can meet the customer's requirements, among other things.

- We see great advantages with Jeeves as the owner. Together with Jeeves we get a better chance to further develop our business, short term as well as long term, says Tore Husby, CEO at LogIT Gruppen. To be able to offer our customers Jeeves' modern ERP systems that can easily be adopted to suit their specific needs are important factors in our decision. Jeeves’ flexibility and low cost of ownership will be attractive to our customers and the Norwegian market. The acquisition process, including due diligence, is expected to be completed at the end of May and the beginning of June. A performed acquisition is estimated to increase Jeeves’ annual turnover with around 35 MSEK and have a positive effect on earnings per share.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, tel: +46-8-587 099 00
E-mail: bengt.algevik@jeeves.se

Tore Husby, CEO LogIT Gruppen, tel +47-957-50-429
E-mail: tore.husby@logitgruppen.no

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Europe´s fastest growing supplier of ERP-systems*. The Jeeves Information Systems AB group of companies develops ERP systems for companies within the manufacturing, trade, maintenance and service sectors. Jeeves concentrates on product development, while sales are channeled through partners and resellers. In total Jeeves has around 70 partners globally. In Sweden partners are represented on 20 locations. The main products are Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, all in all installed at over 3 900 companies. The present operations started in 1992 and the company has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 1999.
www.jeeves.se

* According to Gartner, August 2006

Facts about LogIT Gruppen
LogIT Gruppen is a leading supplier of ERP solutions and system integration, mainly to trading companies and service companies, with around 200 customer installations. The ERP system Lösning1 has for almost 20 years been effectively supporting the customers’ businesses. LogIT Gruppen has offices in Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim and Molde with customers throughout entire Norway. Starting from our message - Your expectations, our responsibility –we wish to provide for deliveries with responsibility and quality that meets your expectations.
www.logitgruppen.no

metadata.dc:title: ITAB Shop Concept chooses Jeeves for international growth
metadata.dc:description: ITAB Shop Concept AB has chosen Jeeves Universal as ERP system for parts of its international operations. Together with the partner Omnilog, Jeeves has received an additional order of 300 users as ITAB Shop Concept consolidates the various ERP systems used in the group´s subsidiaries.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
- Our ERP system is a prioritized area for ITAB, says Samuel Wingren,
Business Controller at ITAB Shop Concept. Jeeves Universal is an important
tool for the management of our processes. For our continuous growth, a
common international system is required that increases the possibilities of cooperation
and efficiency within the group. It is also important to get a system
that supports changing local improvement projects and legal requirements at
subsidiaries in various countries.

ITAB sells, develops and manufactures shop fittings and equipment for food and nonfood
businesses in the Nordic and Baltic countries, Benelux, the United Kingdom,
Germany, Central Europe and Russia. The company has around 1600 employees in
15 countries.

Today, ITAB is already using Jeeves in large parts of its operations in Sweden and
abroad. The company has partially expanded by acquisitions. Jeeves Universal is
now being implemented in a number of subsidiaries that are switching to the common
system.

- I am pleased to see that ITAB chooses to grow with Jeeves, says Lars
Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves. Together with Omnilog, we are developing
a flexible solution for ITAB that makes it possible for them to control and
develop their processes efficiently. ITAB´s choice of Jeeves further
strengthens our position as an international ERP supplier.

metadata.dc:title: Norway’s Byggma Group chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: When building materials corporation Byggma Group needed a modern, industry-specific solution for several of their production and reseller firms, they chose Jeeves’ building materials solution. This will help make their operation more efficient and speed up the logistics flow from order to customer. Jeeves’ partner ITCompaniet arranged the transaction.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Byggma Group supplies building products to resellers and consumers in Norway, Sweden, Finland, England, France and Holland. The transaction encompasses five of Byggma Group’s Norwegian companies: Huntonit, Fibo-Trespo, Uldal Birkeland and Uldal Varhaug, with an option for all of the companies that make up Byggma Group.

“This is exactly what we want – the ERP system adapts to us, and not the other way around. Jeeves’ building materials solution enables us to accelerate lead times from order to delivery and create shared procedures that will make the entire group more efficient. Moreover we can develop the solution further if customers’ needs or our needs change,” said Byggma Group CIO Roy Kenneth Grundetjern.

“It’s important for a building materials chain to have comprehensive and robust price management and an efficient product flow, which are additional features of Jeeves’ building materials solution. ITCompaniet has solid expertise in Jeeves’ solution, and with their experience they will help ensure that Byggma Group gets the most out of a very good solution,” said Jeeves Universal’s Sales Director Johan Krantz.

The transaction comprises a Jeeves Universal group license covering accounting, logistics, decision support and mobile solutions for product, inventory and orders. Byggma Group ASA is one of the Nordic region’s leading suppliers of building materials with turnover of approximately 200 million Euro. The group employs about 800 people at its 10 companies, and its head office is located in Vennesla, Norway.

For more information, please contact:
Roy Kenneth Grundetjern, CIO, Byggma Group
+47 38 13 71 00
roy.kenneth.grundetjern@byggma.no

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Jan-Sep 2011
metadata.dc:description: Stable profitability
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
July - September

  • Net sales totaled SEK 42.1 million (39.8)
  • Software revenue (licenses and maintenance) amounted to SEK 33.5 million (32.1)
  • EBITDA was SEK 9.0 million (7.9) and EBITDA margin 21 percent (20)
  • Net earnings per share amounted to SEK 1.32 (0.92)
  • Cash flow from continuing operations was SEK -2.3 million (-0.3)


January - September

  • Net sales totaled SEK 135.5 million (130.1), and increased by 4 percent (0.1)
  • Software revenue (licenses and maintenance) amounted to SEK 108.7 million (104.0)
  • EBITDA was SEK 23.7 million (19.3), and EBITDA margin 17 percent (15)
  • Net earnings per share amounted to SEK 2.88 (1.86)
  • Cash flow from continuing operations was SEK 19.7 million (1.7)

 

CEO’s comment on performance

The recovery in the ERP system market we witnessed during the spring has continued during the third quarter, despite global financial concerns. Jeeves has experienced a stable inflow of customer inquiries. At the same time, we are seeing some customers either canceling or postponing their procurement processes for new ERP systems. This is mainly the case for the larger companies in the SME segment, while a number of deals have been reached with smaller clients.

Jeeves' growth amounts to 4 percent for the period. During the quarter, our new sales have been weaker than expected, while our maintenance income remains stable. We have continued to improve our margin, which is positive. EBITDA margin for the period has strengthened further, and now amounts to 17 percent. Our focus on increased cost control and more even capacity utilization for our consulting operation are the most important reasons for this.

On our international markets, we are pleased with the growing interest in our products among potential partners in the US. We have seen a healthy level of activity among our existing partners continuing during the third quarter. In Europe including Norway, sales have been weak with few new deals.

With its broad customer base and large proportion of maintenance agreements, Jeeves continues to demonstrate stability in uncertain times.

metadata.dc:title: Norrland manufacturers choose Jeeves' ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Duroc Rail, Duroc Special Steel and Denson Logistics needed ERP systems that could be adapted to their advanced production processes and easily accommodate growth. All opted for Jeeves Selected. Jeeves’ partner ITCompaniet arranged the transactions.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
"This is a breakthrough for Jeeves Selected in the Norrland region of Sweden. Manufacturers need ERP systems that can be adapted to their business, incorporate a high functionality level and easily accommodate growth. The production process must keep rolling smoothly, which places demands on the system in terms of enabling changes over time. Jeeves Selected meets this requirement, which makes it a safe choice," says Peter Cederlund, CEO of ITCompaniet.

All the transactions are bundled product offerings and comprise, for example, finance, logistics and production. The transactions comprise 22 users at Duroc Rail, 16 at Duroc Special Steel, and seven at Denson Logistics.

For more information, please contact:
Peter Cederlund, CEO, ITCompaniet

peter.cederlund@itcompaniet.se

The companies in brief
Duroc Rail provides maintenance of railway wheels to Swedish railroad operators. Examples of customers are SweMaint AB and Malmtrafik i Kiruna AB. Duroc Rail has 29 employees and a turnover of around SEK 70 million.

Duroc Special Steel manufactures and markets high carbon content steel and various special steels, including boron steel, surface-decarburized steel and black oxide steel. The company has 16 employees and a turnover of around SEK 20 million.

Denson Logistics operates in three areas: Third party logistics, packaging manufacturing and wood processing. Examples of customers are Volvo Trucks and IKEA. Denson Logistics has 18 employees and a turnover of around SEK 40 million.

metadata.dc:title: Published by JIS Netherlands: New ERP for Kender Thijssen enhances client repair and logistics services while reducing costs
metadata.dc:description: Kender Thijssen will implement an enhanced ERP system with software from JIS Netherland providing automation of the “Jeeves” ERP platform out of Sweden.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The company KT International Solutions from Veenendaal, Netherlands, providing repair depot, reverse logistics and life cycle management of computer and storage hardware, will implement an enhanced ERP system with software from JIS Netherland providing automation of the “Jeeves” ERP platform out of Sweden.

Allan da Graça, KT International Solutions CEO said: “Our adoption of a cost effective, flexible new ERP system enhances our ability to provide the customized reporting, labeling and repair practices that our clients demand, while keeping our pricing within their budgets.”

The new ERP system facilitates the needs of KTIS’ client and is provided by JIS Netherlands . This software provides automation of the Swedish Jeeves Universal ERP 2.0 platform. During the selection process, KT considered many possible solutions including SAP and others. However, in today’s business climate, staying within clients budgets and offering enhanced services at reduced cost is key to customer satisfaction and new business acquisition.

Live with logistics
The implementation is currently underway. The company is live with logistics, finance and vendor management, and hopes in the third quarter of 2011, the repair module to have running.

For more information
Edwin Bruinenberg, JIS Nederland B.V.,
+31 (0)74 2552580, www.jisnl.com

About KT International Solutions
KT International Solutions is a specialist in repair, reverse logistics and product life cycle management to multinational clients who use or manufacture computer, storage and communications hardware solutions. The company was founded in 1980 as a repair department of Thijssen Field Service, later Kender Thijssen. In 2009, the Kender Thijssen companies were acquired and subsequently separated to operate independently under Detron IT & Telecom Group.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves handles the details at Rudholm & Haak
metadata.dc:description: Every year Rudholm & Haak supplies thousands of buttons, zippers and labels to fashion brands around the world. When the time came to connect their order and product development systems, Rudholm & Haak chose to invest in Jeeves Design Management. The system will simplify the product developers’ work and cut lead times for ordering and delivery.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Rudholm & Haak is a market-leading supplier of accessories to the textile and design industry. Jeeves Design Management will form a shared platform for Rudholm & Haak’s purchasing and product companies in Asia and Europe.

“Jeeves Design Management is an important step in the evolution of our business, since we are simplifying our product developers’ work. The system gives them direct access to information about our products in all of our logistics centers in different countries, which will make us better and faster at creating and delivering the products that customers want,” said Jonas Haglund, Rudholm & Haak’s CFO.

Rudholm & Haak has been using Jeeves’ Garp ERP system for many years. Jeeves Design Management and Garp are integrated, simplifying implementation and operation. The implementation is commencing in February, and the system is expected to be up and running in April 2012.

Rudholm & Haak is a based in Borås, Sweden. It has been in the industry since the 1950s, and today it has around 15 production and trading companies in Asia and Europe. The company has SEK 270 million in sales and 120 employees.

For more information, please contact:
Jonas Haglund, CFO Rudholm & Haak, + 46 (0)33-180 11 52
Jonas.Haglund@rudholm-hk.se

Ingela Cronholm-Edgren, Sales Manager Jeeves Design Management
+46 33 444 129

Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Every day, Jeeves' ERP solutions; Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, are used by more than 4 000 companies in over 40 countries. The ERP systems are user friendly, easily customizable, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of
the business support. Jeeves' head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden and the company is listed on NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Jan–Sept 2010
metadata.dc:description: Steady quarter
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
• Revenue from continuing operations totaled SEK 130.1 million (130.0), up 0.1% (17)
  • Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) rose 7% (7)
  • Operating profit totaled SEK 8.7 million (10.4), the operating margin 7% (8)
  • Net profit totaled SEK 5.3 million (8.7), the profit margin 4% (7)
  • Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 1.9 (3.1)
  • Cash flow ended at SEK -13.8 million (-7.3), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments at SEK 27.5 million (31.0)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 37% (36)

 

CEO’s comment on performance
The third quarter was steady, with no major surprises. Software revenues as well as operating profit were higher in the third quarter compared with the same quarter last year. The market turnaround we saw in the first six months continued, and the SME segment continued to show lively interest in the procurement of ERP systems. New sales in Sweden were satisfactory, while sales elsewhere remained weak.

Software revenues showed a growth of 7% during the period. Services, however, were down 17% mainly due to the divestment of the operations in Jeeves’ Swedish subsidiary Reveny. Altogether this leads to a positive growth in the core business but no growth in total revenue. Jeeves’ Swedish operations posted healthy earnings thanks to positive organic growth during the period. In our international business operations, license sales did not meet expectations. Operating profit decreased, to SEK 8.7 million (10.4).

Our efforts to improve the capacity utilization of our consultants on our international projects and to adjust business operations have yielded results. In an analysis of our foreign operations, we found that the limited sales are offset somewhat by the significant role our foreign partners play in international business, by our customers gaining access to local partners who provide Jeeves know-how. I remain confident of the future, thanks to our improved list of prospects and the many international roll-outs of Jeeves ERP systems that our customers are planning in multiple countries. These factors, combined with our appealing market offering that is highly flexible and offers outstanding customer benefits at a low cost of ownership, bode well for the future.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves appoints Magnus Sjökvist new Product Director
metadata.dc:description: Magnus Sjökvist will take up his duties as Product Director at Jeeves on March 10. Sjökvist will be responsible for the further development of Jeeves for small and midsized companies that are looking for a flexible and upgradable ERP system with a low cost of ownership. Sjökvist will be part of the Jeeves management team.
metadata.dc:creator: admin
metadata.field:
- Magnus Sjökvist is a very important recruitment for Jeeves. He has a wide experience within the business and will be a key player when it comes to supporting our European expansion and taking Jeeves’ product development to the next level, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves.

Magnus Sjökvist has previously worked at Lawson where he had several leading positions during a total of 12 years. Sjökvist will replace Magnus Grönvik who will run his own consultancy business.

- Jeeves is a very exciting actor on the ERP system market, with an extremely attractive and unique product. Jeeves is a more market oriented company than the competitors. This combined with the product’s unique flexibility and upgradeability makes it possible to faster meet the customers’ ever changing demands, says Magnus Sjökvist.

- I am really looking forward to move the product development forward in order to make Jeeves even more attractive for small and midsized companies in Europe, says Magnus Sjökvist.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, tel: 08 587 099 00
Magnus Sjökvist, tel: 08 587 099 00

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Europe´s fastest growing supplier of ERP-systems (Gartner, August 2006). The Jeeves Information Systems AB group of companies develops ERP systems for companies within the manufacturing, trade, maintenance and service sectors. Jeeves concentrates on product development, while sales are channeled through partners and resellers. In total Jeeves has around 70 partners globally. In Sweden partners are represented on 20 locations. The main products are Jeeves Universal and Garp, all in all installed at over 3 900 companies. Present operations started in 1992 and the company has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 1999.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Q3 Jan-Sep 2009
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves invests forward
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
• Revenue totaled SEK 130.0 million (110.9), up 17% (17)
  • Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) rose 7% (11)
  • Operating profit was SEK 10.4 million (13.2), the operating margin 8% (12)
  • Profit after tax was SEK 8.7 million (10.9), the profit margin 7% (10)
  • Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 3.1 (3.9)
  • Cash flow was SEK -7.3 million (-1.7), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 31.0 million (34.7)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 36% (36)


CEO’s comment on performance during the period

Jeeves continues investing. During October new versions of our Jeeves Universal and Jeeves
Selected ERP systems have been delivered. The new products primarily enhance our offer for
the distribution and manufacturing industries. Activities to strengthen our sales channels in
Sweden and internationally also remain a top priority

Sales advanced 17% (17) for the quarter, and the operating margin was 8% (12). Under
prevailing market conditions, with many colleagues in our industry reporting falling
license revenue, such results are satisfactory and demonstrate Jeeves’ resilience and
strength.

New business is being done, but few major transactions are being concluded in this market.
This is true in Sweden as well as abroad. All the same, Jeeves’ maintenance income remains
stable. Slower growth in volumes combined with the costs of the ongoing build up of our
international sales channels have adversely affected the operating margin.

As we enter the fourth quarter, the list of prospects looks better than before in Sweden
and elsewhere. However, it is hard to predict when demand will have a tangible impact on
sales and earnings, because some customers continue to delay their investment decisions.
Investments made in products and sales channels strengthen Jeeves’ well positioned
offer, which is highly flexible and has a low cost of ownership, making it appealing to customers.

 
For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, phone: +46-8-587 099 00 or Anna Salomon.Sörensen, CFO Jeeves, phone: +46 8 587 099 45.


Read the entire report.

metadata.dc:title: Ventilationsutveckling AB is replacing everything with Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: Two become one. That’s the easiest way to describe Ventilationsutveckling AB’s replacement of its ERP system. Having previously used separate ERP and CRM systems, the company chose one new ERP system for its whole organization: Jeeves Universal. The aim is to boost efficiency in the company. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ partner SYSteam.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The transaction is a bundled product offering, comprising the project and services such as mobile solutions, barcode readers, and accounting. A total of 65 users are involved. Jeeves’ partner SYSteam Universal arranged the deal and is responsible for implementation, scheduled to be completed during spring 2011.

“As a contractor, we handle the entire chain, from factory to end customer. That makes tough demands on the user-friendliness and flexibility of our ERP system. Jeeves Universal helps us boost efficiency throughout the flow: from marketing, CRM, accounting, and project planning, to installation, service, and the aftermarket. This is a decision that will benefit the business operations for years to come,” says Jonas Hall, CEO at Ventilationsutveckling AB.

Ventilationsutveckling AB has been the general agent in Sweden for Toshiba air-conditioning and heat pumps since 1980. The company has its head office in Täby, just north of Stockholm, and regional offices in Uddevalla, Jönköping, Gothenburg, and Malmö. The company has a total of 65 employees and about 40 partners around Sweden.

The transaction was recognized in the accounts for the fourth quarter of 2010.

 

For more information, please contact:
Jonas Hall, CEO, Ventilationsutveckling AB
+46 (0)8 630 30 00
jonas.hall@ventilationsutveckling.se

Johan Krantz, Sales Director, Jeeves Universal
+46 (0)704 801 867
johan.krantz@jeeves.se

 

Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, or Garp. All products offer broad functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en

metadata.dc:title: Global growth companies are Sweden's future
metadata.dc:description: In three years, the number of Swedish companies setting up business abroad has increased by 13 percent, according to new statistics from Growth Analysis (Swedish Agency for Growth Policy Analysis). Because of this, demand for international ERP systems has risen sharply. "Our sales in this segment are sharply on the rise. The new statistics confirm the trend we have witnessed in the last few years," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Companies with 0-49 employees have shown the biggest increase. The amount of companies in this category with subsidiaries abroad increased by 44% during 2007-2009. The statistics from Growth Analysis also show that the trend of companies setting up business abroad continued to rise in 2009 by 2.5 percent, despite the prevailing financial crisis.

Since 2007, Jeeves' international sales have increased from a marginal level to accounting for around 40 percent of the company's turnover today. The biggest sales increase comes from small and midsized customers.

"Jeeves' strength is to offer customers an ERP system that can easily be rolled out in new subsidiaries in countries included in the organization following international expansion. The flexibility of the ERP system makes it easy to convey group-wide business concepts throughout the entire group, while adapting the system to local requirements in different countries. Since the recovery in 2009, we have seen a clear increase in demand among small and midsized European companies that operate on different geographical markets," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik.

An ERP system manages a company's logistics, production, accounting and more. When a company embarks onto new markets, the ERP system must deliver the same results as before, but has other requirements to meet, which include local demands.  Swedish wholesaler group Bufab uses Jeeves in 16 companies in 14 different countries.

"When a group embarks onto a new geographical market, the ERP system must follow from day one. The markets are most often very different from each other, which places demands on the ERP system's adaptability and short implementation time," says Joakim Karlsson, CFO of Bufab, which has been using Jeeves' ERP system since 1999.

The entire report is available on Growth Analysis' website (in Swedish only ): www.tillvaxtanalys.se

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO, Jeeves
+46 8 587 099 00
bengt-ake.aelgevik@jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves sells program rights to its HRM system
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems is proud to announce the sale of the program rights to its Human Resource Management (HRM) system to HRM Software AB for MSEK 6. The solution will be renamed HRM (instead of Jeeves HRM) once HRM Software AB takes over ownership.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
Jeeves HRM is a complete system for human resource management. Jeeves will continue to offer its customers a packaged version of HRM as part of its Jeeves Enterprise ERP system. HRM functionality will therefore continue to be available as an integrated module of Jeeves Enterprise under the name Jeeves HRM. Jeeves will also maintain its product expertise in the HRM field.

"Being able to offer an integrated HRM solution with Jeeves Enterprise is critical for Jeeves and is something that many ERP system customers are on the lookout for. This was what Jeeves wanted to achieve when we bought the HRM product 2 years ago. We will still deliver it, but at the same time let HRM Software take this modern HRM solution to a wider market than the one we work in with our other products. We do not consider ourselves the best long-term owner for this HRM system," says Nicolas Ehrling, CEO of Jeeves Information Systems.

"We will maintain a close cooperation with Jeeves with a packaged solution for the normal Jeeves customer. This is because both HRM Software and Jeeves see great potential for the HRM system integrated with an ERP system such as Jeeves Enterprise, which is designed for small and midsize companies," says Sven Ingemarsson, President and one of the founders of HRM Software AB.

"HRM is a complete and modern HRM solution that can be used by customers that are larger than the target group of our ERP system offering. For this reason, we are not the best owners from a strategic perspective. We are convinced that you must be able to focus on the solution's entire market and HRM as a science in order to give the product the best possible potential for growth. Jeeves Information Systems is not that owner," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

Globally, more than 3,000 companies in over 40 countries use ERP system solutions from Jeeves in their daily operations. Through this cooperation, Jeeves will continue to be able to offer a complete ERP system that includes HRM. The sales price was SEK 6 million. As part of the agreement, Jeeves will receive a royalty for certain HRM sales but will also reciprocally purchase licenses from HRM Software at a value of SEK 1.5 million via its partners and end customers. Prior to the sale, the HRM system's booked value was SEK 3.9 million. The sales price is paid cash.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves launches Apps Market – increasing customer benefit and reducing cost of ownership
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Apps Market will be launched in the fall, enabling customers to download ERP system apps directly. This will simplify access to solutions developed by Jeeves' partners and customers, which will make it possible for customers to add value to their ERP systems and reduce the cost of ownership even further.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeeves Apps Market is being launched by the ERP system developer Jeeves with the intention of making it even simpler for customers to upgrade, develop and maintain their systems. In addition to being able to download apps, customers will be able to develop apps to meet their own particular needs, together with Jeeves' partners, and then upload these to the Jeeves Apps Market for sale to other companies with the same system customization requirements.

"Our goal is always to make daily operations easier for our customers. The Jeeves Apps Market will make it simple for our customers to get hold of solutions that Jeeves partners have developed. CIOs will have more control over their operations and won’t be so dependent on consultants," says Magnus Sjökvist, Jeeves Product Manager.

"Jeeves’ unique architecture is the underlying technology for the ERP apps, differentiating these in many ways from cell phone apps. For example, Jeeves apps have the capability to interact with thousands of data tables. This is an advanced technology that we are now making available to our customers, and it will make development simpler and more efficient, as well as making it easier to maintain different customized solutions," says Sjökvist.

Jeeves Apps Market will make it simpler to:

  • upgrade and maintain ERP systems
  • continuously administrate customizations
  • test and install different customized solutions in different environments
  • acquire cost-efficient solutions
  • gain access to the experience of other customers and partners
  • distribute Jeeves add-on functionalities.

"The Jeeves Apps Market will also revolutionize the work of our partners. The apps will help them to meet the needs of customers more optimally and exactly. By focusing on selected industry verticals they can quickly develop customized ERP solutions that many more companies can benefit from," Sjökvist concludes.

There will be a preview of Jeeves Apps Market on May 13 at the international partner event Jeeves Live in Stockholm.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Q1 Jan-Mar 2009
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves’ steady growth continues
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
January - March 2009

  • Revenue reached SEK 45.7 million (34.3), up 33% (9)
  • Software revenues (license and maintenance) increased 9% (16)
  • Operating profit was SEK 4.2 million (4.8), giving an operating margin of 9% (14)
  • Profit after tax totaled SEK 4.0 million (3.2), giving a profit margin of 9% (9)
  • Earnings per share after tax were SEK 1.5 (1.1)
  • Cash flow was SEK 6.4 million (10.7), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 44.6 million (47.0)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 35% (37)
  • Thomas Wernhoff proposed as new Chairman of the Board

 

CEO’s comment on performance

I remain satisfied with Jeeves’ progress. Despite the recession, we are maintaining steady
profitability and sales growth. We are proud to have reported a profit for every single quarter for
the past seven years.

We are seeing somewhat slower growth in demand for ERP systems because of the state
of the economy. Yet underlying demand and the need for ERP systems remains healthy, and we
have a steady stream of new prospects.

During the quarter, Jeeves made fewer sales, but there were more major transactions than in
the preceding quarter. Several billion-dollar enterprises have chosen Jeeves’ ERP systems.
In addition to Swedish sales, several new orders were secured by a few international partners.

Activities to strengthen our position and our international sales channels remain a high
priority, because international expansion is essential if Jeeves is to continue growing in the
long run.

Jeeves’ financial strategy, to achieve healthy growth with balanced profit while maintaining a
strong balance sheet, is an advantage in these times. Seven years of profitability show the longterm
benefits of Jeeves’ business model, in which we and our partners together construct an
offer attractive to the market.


Facts about Jeeves
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems that provides companies with efficient solutions for developing and supporting their business processes through its products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, and Garp. Jeeves’ ERP systems offer broad functionality at a total cost of ownership that is the lowest in the market*. Customers are companies with 5 to 1,000 employees, spread among approximately 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries. Jeeves focuses on product development, while its partners and resellers handle sales. Operations began in 1992, and since 1999 Jeeves has been listed on the small companies list of NASDAQ OMX Nordic in Stockholm (Small Cap). For more information, see www.jeeves.se.

* Radar Group

 

Read the entire report

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves and IBM offer Jeeves Enterprise On Demand
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems and IBM launch Jeeves Enterprise On Demand – a service where the Jeeves Enterprise ERP system is run by IBM. Jeeves Information Systems and IBM will thereby be able to offer their common customers the opportunity to outsource handling and maintenance of their IT infrastructure to IBM.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The fact via our Jeeves Partners we, together with IBM, can offer Jeeves Enterprise On Demand will play a significant role for our future competitive ability. Many customers are looking over costs for operating their systems and servers while at the same time evaluating how to make maximum use of the ERP system. Jeeves Enterprise On Demand is just the cost-effective and flexible solution that customers are looking for," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales and Marketing Director of Jeeves Information Systems.

Jeeves Enterprise On Demand is a flexible operating service tailored to Jeeves Enterprise, where IBM handles operation and maintenance of the system's servers. The customer can obtain the exact capacity and functionality needed at the time at a fixed monthly cost per user. This enables the customer company to free up capital that is otherwise tied up when it chooses to handle this itself.

Jeeves Enterprise On Demand provides cost-effective and reliable operation adapted to the customer's current needs, while at the same time it can be adapted to meet the demands of tomorrow. If the customer needs to change the capacity in the server environment or the number of users or needs to change the functionality in Jeeves Enterprise, the operating service can be easily adapted.

In the cooperation between Jeeves Information Systems and IBM, great importance has been placed on making Jeeves Enterprise On Demand the market's most reliable solution. For this reason, the servers are located in doubled and secure computer halls, where hardware and software are continually upgraded. For the highest possible level of operating reliability, the IT infrastructure is monitored 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Jeeves Enterprise On Demand also includes customer service and support for database administration, operating statistics, documentation and security.

"The customers that entrust their system operation to us are offered the most modern IT infrastructure on the market," says Stanley Ekberg, Head of IBM Sales to small and midsize companies in Sweden. "With Jeeves Enterprise On Demand, our customers ensure the operation of their business-critical processes," he continues.

Jeeves Information Systems and IBM decided to launch Jeeves Enterprise On Demand because total solutions such as this are in demand at an ever-increasing level. Maintenance and operation of server environments are often costly for midsize companies - a cost that can now be reduced as you only have to pay for the capacity used.

Jeeves Enterprise On Demand is sold by Jeeves Information Systems business partners – none simply as Jeeves Partners. They handle installation, customizations and support for the Jeeves Enterprise ERP system while IBM is responsible for the servers and operating support.

metadata.dc:title: Bagheera chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: The Swedish sport brand Bagheera needed an ERP system to improve its processes and enable on-line sales. Their solution was the ERP system Jeeves Selected. Jeeves’ partner Infocube arranged the deal.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The deal consists of a bundled product offering that includes orders, inventory, accounting, and version management. The ERP system will also support order entry by salespeople in the field, an e-commerce solution for resellers, and the integration of the existing POS system at the flagship store in Avesta, Sweden. A total of 10 users will be affected.

“We were using an older system that took a lot of time and energy,” says Ola Karlsson, IT manager at Bagheera. “With Jeeves Selected, we’ll boost efficiency in the company and be able to integrate our resellers more flexibly through an e-commerce solution. This will be launched during the year and will improve their order entry as well as the information exchange that we have with them.”

Bagheera is a Swedish sport brand, founded in Avesta in 1981, that focuses on functional clothing and shoes. The Bagheera group also includes CÉBÉ Scandinavia, which sells helmets and ski goggles. The Group had about SEK 80 million in sales in 2010 and 23 employees. Bagheera products are sold in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Denmark.

 

For more information, please contact:
Ola Karlsson, IT manager, Bagheera
+46-73-942-6211
ola.karlsson@bagheera.se

Håkan Magnusson, Sales Manager, Jeeves Selected

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Jan-Mar 2010
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves senses recovery in sluggish market
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
• Income from operating activities totaled SEK 42.6 million (45.7), down 7% (33)
  • Software revenue (licenses and maintenance) declined 2% (9)
  • Operating profit was SEK 2.6 million (4.2), the operating margin 6% (9)
  • Net profit totaled SEK 1.7 million (4.2), the profit margin 4% (9)
  • Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 0.6 (1.5)
  • Cash flow was SEK -3.3 million (6.3), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments were SEK 38.7 million (44.6)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 36% (35)

 

CEO’s comment on performance
Demand for ERP systems rallies late in the cycle, so the market remained sluggish through the beginning of the quarter. Towards the end of the quarter, however, the activity has increased, especially among the larger companies in the SME segment (5-1000 employees) and the prospect situation has improved significantly going into the second quarter.

Jeeves’ sales for the first quarter have not met our expectations. Sales fell 7% (33%) with the disposal of all business activities in Jeeves’ Swedish subsidiary Reveny at the end of 2009. Sales of comparable units remained with the first quarter of 2009. Jeeves’ Swedish business operations show better results and positive organic growth. Our international business operations however, have had a weak quarter with few license sales and low capacity utilization for the consultants that support international roll-outs. Operating profit fell to 2.6 (4.2).

Given market conditions, Jeeves achieved satisfactory results. We have ridden out the recession with positive results every quarter. We closed sales in a large number of tenders in which we entered bids. I am optimistic about our future progress. Our improved list of prospects, combined with our appealing market offering with high customer value, high flexibility and low cost of ownership, bodes well for the future. 

Read the entire report (pdf).

metadata.dc:title: For a clearer view of its business, KlarSynt chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: KlarSynt, Sweden’s largest alliance of privately owned optical shops, is changing to Jeeves Universal in all companies in the group. The transaction covers about 10 user licenses, and Jeeves’ partner Ninetech is responsible for implementation.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
With 140 member shops around Sweden, KlarSynt is the country’s largest alliance of privately owned optical shops. Now they are replacing their old accounting system with a Jeeves ERP system.

“Our old system was hard to integrate with other systems. We couldn’t create automatic routines, either,” says Inger Tallén, CEO of KlarSynt. “Jeeves gives us a flexible solution to our problems, and we’ll still be able to grow our operations with the system as support.” Jeeves’ partner Ninetech will implement the system during spring 2011.

metadata.dc:title: Refinement of Jeeves' American operations
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves refines its American operations and introduces the same partnership-based organization as in other markets. Jeeves' current USA manager, Roger Jönsson, has quit the Group and instead establishing Jeeves' first partner in USA.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
Roger Jönsson, who is responsible for Jeeves North America, will leave his position as North America Manager and instead start Jeeves' partner operation in USA under the name Jeeves Business Solutions LLC ("JBS"). JBS will initially offer consulting services for Jeeves and Qlikview as well as project management, implementation and support. JBS will handle existing and future American customers. The goal of JBS is to over time take on a full-scale partner role and then sell and deliver Jeeves ERP systems to new customers in USA.

"Jeeves' move to partner-based sales in USA is part of the refinement of our international strategy. We thank Roger Jönsson for his extremely valuable input. At the same time, we look forward to a long cooperation with him in his new role as Jeeves partner and consider him a vital force in driving Jeeves' success in USA," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Manager at Jeeves.

"After several years at Jeeves, this feels like a natural step. I look forward to continue working with Jeeves while on a personal level the partner model gives me even greater commitment to Jeeves," says Roger Jönsson.

 

 

View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Enterprise expanded with two new, attractive applications
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves together with its collaborative partner SYSteam is proud to announce the launch of two completely new applications to the Jeeves Enterprise ERP system. The applications, called "Shopfloor" and "Attendance", are two powerful reporting tools that together give the user complete control of the production process.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
The modules have an 8-year history as freestanding modules and were initially developed by Jeeves Information Systems collaborative partner, SYSteam. While a project was underway, the modules were developed in the Jeeves Enterprise development environment. The modules currently have 200 customers. On June 30, 2006, Jeeves Information System took over the role as product owner for the existing customers. Development of the modules in Jeeves Enterprise will strengthen the products through measures such as use of Jeeves Enterprise's flexible user interface.

"Shopfloor" is an application that provides continual information on the status of the production process - how much as been produced, order status, run plan, material supply, who is operator and so on. The module can also quickly generate compiled reports on produced units - for both entire production chains and for individual units. "Shopfloor" helps you create a total picture of the entire production flow.

"Attendance" is an application for time reporting and is fully integrated with "Shopfloor". This ties run plans and produced units to the operators, which facilitates factors such as quality work. "Attendance" is flexible. Presence can be activated via a number of different tools, such as timecard, bar codes or manually directly in the application.

"These two modules will be strong, competitive elements of our global expansion. Few, if any, ERP systems for midsize companies have functionality as in-depth as our 'Shopfloor' and 'Attendance'", says Magnus Grönvik, Product Director of Jeeves Information Systems.

"Shopfloor" replaces current similar functionality in Jeeves Enterprise. During the development of "Shopfloor" and "Attendance", focus was not only on creating a high degree of functionality. An important part of development work was also the creation of a clear and user-friendly interface.

"We want the applications to be simple and intuitive to work with. This way, we reduce the risk of mistakes and instead an important tool for daily work," says Magnus Grönvik.

Both applications will be fully integrated in Jeeves Enterprise 10 and will be sold through the Jeeves global partner network.

metadata.dc:title: Söderbergföretagen generates synergies with Jeeves ERP system
metadata.dc:description: The Söderbergföretagen industrial group will generate synergies in their business operations by deploying the Jeeves Universal ERP system in three of the group’s five subsidiaries. The transaction comprises 130 user licenses, and Jeeves partner Infocube is responsible for promotion and deployment.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeeves Universal will be deployed in three subsidiaries: Andrén & Söner, Elisolation, and STI Industriplast. These will receive a bundled product offering including production, sales, CRM, purchasing, and inventory as well as Jeeves Workflow for automating processes and Jeeves BI/Qlikview for more efficient analysis, feedback, and control.

- Until now, we have had several different ERP systems in our companies. But with extremely similar business operations, we see an opportunity to boost the efficiency in our processes and gain valuable synergies by using a common system. One of the subsidiaries has used Jeeves Universal for 10 years, and after a thorough selection process, we have now decided to deploy the system in two more subsidiaries,” says Tommy Hansson, responsible for ERP systems procurement at Söderbergföretagen.

Jeeves partner Infocube has enjoyed healthy sales in the logistics and production sectors.

- The key factors for success in this transaction and in this business sector are Jeeves Universal’s flexibility, transparency, and broad functionality, combined with a reliable partner who has ample expertise in systems, business operations, and project methodology,” says Jonas Hammarberg, Vice President of Infocube.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves makes further gains in Norway with major order
metadata.dc:description: Motek, one of Norway’s biggest distributors of tools and services for the construction industry, is introducing Jeeves’ ERP system throughout its business operations. The deal, comprising 250 users, resulted from collaboration between Jeeves in Norway and the Swedish consultants Infocube.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Motek is replacing its entire legacy ERP solution with Jeeves, to achieve a modern and fully integrated system. Jeeves will enable efficiency gains in every activity, from logistics and customer relations management, to accounting and finance.

“Jeeves proved to be the best ERP system – in competition with several other qualified systems – for our distribution and sales processes,” Henrik Bryn, CEO of Motek AS, says. “The system’s powerful distribution functionality, as well as the flexibility Jeeves’ technology offers, were the main criteria for us.”

“Motek is a significant transaction for Jeeves and important for our continued growth in the Norwegian market,” says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves. “We are a reliable and innovative supplier of ERP systems, and our solid position in Sweden played a crucial role when Motek was deciding to base its future business development on Jeeves’ ERP system.”

Work implementing Jeeves for Motek has already begun, and the system is expected to be fully operational at the start of 2011.

metadata.dc:title: Fagerhult chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Fagerhult, the foremost lighting group in the Nordic region, has chosen Jeeves’ ERP system to strengthen its logistics processes. Flexibility and cost-efficiency were decisive in Fagerhult’s selection of the new ERP system. Solid trust in Jeeves’ partner Infocube, which sold and will introduce the system into Fagerhult’s operations, was also important in the choice of the solution.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Short lead times and delivery precision are key success factors for the lighting group Fagerhult, which supplies lighting for public environments and retail primarily in Europe. So now the group is implementing Jeeves’ ERP system in its two production units in Sweden.

“We strive to continuously enhance competitiveness in our supply chain, all the way from our suppliers to customers. Jeeves offers a robust solution that will help us do that, and we’ll gain new possibilities for planning and improving our entire logistics process. We are also thinking long-term as we invest in this new ERP system, because Jeeves is easy to upgrade and has a low cost of ownership. That means we can always keep up with advances and modify our operations when the needs of our customers change,” says Anders Fransson, Supply Chain Director at Fagerhult.

The transaction covers 115 users and applications for production, purchasing, inventory, and accounting.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves receives SEK 1 million from Vinnova
metadata.dc:description: Sweden's Innovation Agency Vinnova has decided to give Jeeves SEK 1 million in the framework of its Research & Grow project. The money will be used to develop Jeeves Apps Market. In collaboration with the University of Gothenburg School of Business, Economics and Law, Jeeves will also further develop the apps business model.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeeves Apps Market is a marketplace and platform that enables Jeeves' customers and partners to disseminate solutions transparently. Jeeves' ERP system is fundamentally a holistic system. Customers today seek cutting edge functionality to strengthen their competitive edge, and by installing apps for various functions, customers get an effective ERP system.

"Using Jeeves Apps market, we want to build a new ecosystem for ERP systems because we believe the market needs to change and offer more value to customers faster. Vinnova's investment of money in the development of Jeeves Apps Market is proof that we are on the right track," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

Most ERP systems are becoming bigger and more complex, and their administration and management is getting more difficult. The effect of this is that both purchasing and maintenance are more expensive, and at the same time customers get locked in, making it difficult to change suppliers.

Jeeves has instead opted to go against the flow and offer a standardized platform. In order to obtain specific functions and solutions, the companies install apps. The apps, which are developed by Jeeves or its partners and customers, can then be offered to others through Jeeves Apps Market. This means that customers can reduce their development costs and, in certain cases, even earn money on their ERP system when they sell their apps to other Jeeves customers, or to Jeeves which incorporates the solution into the platform as a function.

"Good general ideas or apps developed by our customers or partners can well become a standard in our platform. For customers, Jeeves offers a highly attractive opportunity to obtain a fantastic ERP system at a lower cost," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik.

Besides the continuing work with Jeeves Apps Market, the money will be used for a joint project with the University of Gothenburg School of Business, Economics and Law. In the framework of this project, new business models will be looked at in which Jeeves Apps Market is a part.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik
+46 8 587 099 65
bengt-ake.aelgevik@jeeves.se

Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal or Garp. All products offer broad functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, go to www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves receives order from Constructor Scandinavia
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems (“Jeeves”) has through its partner InfoCube obtained a major order from the Norwegian Constructor group for implementation of Jeeves Universal in their Scandinavian operations.
metadata.dc:creator: admin
metadata.field:
- After a procurement process of 16 months, we have chosen to replace our current ERP system IBS/ASW with Jeeves Universal. This decision was mainly based upon Jeeves´ Inter Company Transaction (ICT) functionality and its opportunity to increase the efficiency of internal transactions within the corporation. Jeeves´ flexibility and upgrading possibilities has also been important aspects in our decision, says Are Stein Lien, Chief Executive at Constructor Scandinavian Region.

Constructor is market-leading on stock and archiving inventory within the Nordic countries. During 2007 Constructor had a turnover of 800 million SEK and approximately 250 employees. Since October 2007 Constructor is owned by ALTOR, a private equity company.

The fact that Constructor chose Jeeves as their ERP system is yet another proof of Jeeves´ capabilities compared to many other large ERP vendors. This confirms that Jeeves is very attractive for companies looking for an ERP system that is flexible and has the capability to run in multiple countries, as well as the potential for cost-effective growth, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves.

The order has been signed through InfoCube, a partner of Jeeves Information Systems.

–Constructor’s decision to choose us as their solution provider is very gratifying and a natural consequence of our great focus to be a leading provider of ERP systems in the Nordic countries, with offers to midsized companies. It is also an acknowledgement to our concentrated efforts of our industry solution Flowpack, says Ove Prissberg, Chief Executive at InfoCube.

For more information, please contact:

Europe´s fastest growing supplier of ERP-systems (Gartner, August 2006). The Jeeves Information Systems AB group of companies develops ERP systems for companies within the manufacturing, trade, maintenance and service sectors. Jeeves concentrates on product development, while sales are channeled through partners and resellers. In total Jeeves has around 70 partners globally. In Sweden partners are represented on 20 locations. The main products are Jeeves Universal and Garp, all in all installed at over 3 900 companies. Present operations started in 1992 and the company has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 1999.

metadata.dc:title: Aidarex Pharmaceuticals Takes Business to the Next Level with Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: CHICAGO – California-based pharmaceutical services company, Aidarex Pharmaceuticals, has chosen Jeeves Universal as its strategic business platform.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Aidarex Pharmaceuticals, a California-based pharmaceutical services company, has chosen Jeeves Universal as its strategic business platform to integrate all aspects of its business into a single seamless platform for all of its business units. Aidarex Pharmaceuticals is a premier supplier of high-quality pharmaceuticals and efficient, profitable health care delivery programs to health care providers.

The Jeeves solution was sold and will be implemented by Octave Solutions, a premier Jeeves partner located in Orange County, California.

“Since its inception, Aidarex Pharmaceuticals has provided the utmost in care for our customers, including dispensing physicians, hospitals, employer health programs, and the Department of Defense.  As the Company has grown, we have worked to keep our systems ahead of our growth.  Jeeves enables our future growth and we look forward to leveraging its capabilities,” said Dale Garlow, COO of Aidarex Pharmaceuticals. “Our team evaluated several systems. We did our due diligence and spoke with existing Jeeves customers. It became clear, very quickly, that for flexibility, ease of use, total cost of ownership and business growth – Jeeves was the superior enterprise resource planning tool for our needs.”

Aidarex Pharmaceuticals will implement Jeeves Universal system for CRM, workflow, document management, intercompany transactions, manufacturing and business intelligence.  Jeeves Universal will fully integrate with the physician ordering and notification system known as MD Scripts.

“In today´s competitive market, I am very pleased that Jeeves, together with our partner Octave Solutions, welcomes Aidarex Pharmaceuticals as our customer. Aidarex's industry leadership anchors our growth in the U.S. market,” said Bernt Olausson, President, Jeeves Information Systems Inc.

“We are very pleased that Aidarex has selected Jeeves and the team at Octave Solutions to take its business to the next level and provide a long-term solution to the growth needs of Aidarex Pharmaceuticals” said Jim Ethell, Managing Partner of Octave Solutions.

About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies.  Every day, Jeeves' ERP solutions are used by more than 4,600 companies in over 40 countries.  Jeeves' ERP systems are user-friendly and easy to customize, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of business support.  Jeeves' head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and is owned by the American investment company Battery Ventures.

Jeeves Information Systems Inc, a wholly owned subsidiary of Jeeves Information Systems AB, is responsible for the distribution and the community buildup in North America. With our growing nationwide network of dedicated Reseller Partners – Jeeves is as local as your company needs and as international as your growth requires.  For more information, please visit www.jeeveserp.com.

About Aidarex Pharmaceuticals llc.
Leveraging over 23 years experience, Aidarex provides custom packaged, ready to dispense pharmaceuticals, reliable service, and medical programs to dispensing physicians, hospitals, employer health clinics, and the DOD.  Aidarex programs provide simple staff interface, increased patient safety, accountability, reliability and trust. Customer Service and IT support are critical components of our success.  For more information, please visit www.aidarex.com

About Octave Solutions LLC
Octave Solutions is a leading reseller and implementation partner for Jeeves Universal based in Orange County, California.  A belief that effective teamwork can produce incredible results provides our customers with comfort in our desire to properly communicate and provide responsible leadership in the deployment of their critical business solutions.   For more information, please visit www.octavesolutions.com.

metadata.dc:title: CompuTec Selects Jeeves as Strategic Partner
metadata.dc:description: CHICAGO – Enterprise resource planning (ERP) solutions provider CompuTec Integrated Solutions Inc. has chosen Jeeves Information Systems, a leading developer of ERP solutions for small and medium-sized businesses, as its strategic partner in its continuing drive to provide a differentiated long-term value-add ERP solution to its strong and growing customer base.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Based out of Hartland, Wisconsin, CompuTec is a software, technology and professional services provider with a strong and dedicated industry experience, backed by a team of highly experienced consultants.

Many companies are technologically constrained by operating outdated computer software that runs their business. Staying current with the latest software releases has traditionally been both time-consuming and expensive. Companies are looking to streamline costs and operate with fewer complexities with their computer systems. 

Jeeves Universal, a fully integrated solution that offers businesses the advantage of a flexible system on standardized software packages for manufacturing, wholesale and trade, can be upgraded quickly and easily. This provides customers with access to new functionalities and an always-current ERP system. 

“In today’s global economy, companies need to be current and at the leading edge with their technology before they are passed by. The future is NOW with Jeeves Universal,” said Mick Kapetanovic, President of CompuTec Integrated Solutions. “We are excited to be part of the rapidly growing Jeeves Circle of Friends.”

“Jeeves is pleased that CompuTec has chosen Jeeves Universal as their premier ERP solution in their go-to market strategy,” said Allan Lessing, Vice President – Sales/Channel Management, Jeeves Information Systems Inc. “We see Jeeves Universal as being the true intelligent choice for manufacturing and distribution companies that understand the value of the ‘new thinking’ that Jeeves provides to its clients seeking a flexible business enabler of continuous improvements for their business operations. Jeeves delivers a very agile ERP philosophy of highly flexible, adaptable Jeeves solutions that deliver an extremely attractive cost of ownership for its clients. Clients are looking for solutions that allow them to maximize competitive advantage through Continuous Improvement and we are pleased that CompuTec saw this in making their decision.”

About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies.  Every day, Jeeves' ERP solutions -- Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp -- are used by more than 4,600 companies in over 40 countries.  Jeeves' ERP systems are user-friendly and easy to customize, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of business support.  Jeeves' head office is located in Stockholm and is owned by the American investment company Battery Ventures. For more information, please visit www.jeeveserp.com.

About CompuTec Integrated Solutions Inc.
CompuTec Integrated Solutions Inc., an established ERP solutions provider based out of Hartland, Wisconsin, has chosen Jeeves as its strategic partner in its continuing drive to provide a differentiated long term value add ERP solution to its strong and growing customer base. For more information, please visit www.computec-solutions.com.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Information Systems Opens U.S. Headquarters
metadata.dc:description: CHICAGO – August 14, 2012 – Jeeves Information Systems, a leading developer of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solutions for small and medium-sized businesses, announced today that the company has established a new headquarters for North American operations, in Chicago.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Led by Bernt Olausson, President of Jeeves Information Systems Inc., the U.S. office will serve the Jeeves community in North America with a dedicated executive and product team, to meet the unique needs of the market and provide exceptional service.

The company’s flagship product, Jeeves Universal, is a fully integrated solution that offers medium-sized businesses the advantage of a flexible system on standardized software, for a customized solution that meets the specific needs of each customer. Jeeves Universal delivers ease of use and allows for simplified upgrades, allowing Jeeves to adapt to business changes quickly.

Jeeves Universal offers an exceptionally low cost of ownership, and has been adopted worldwide in 40+ countries. Jeeves’ ERP solutions are used by more than 4,600 companies in the manufacturing, process, distribution and services sectors. 

“The complexity of business today, with requirements of fast and continuous process adaptation even on a global scale, demands a proven ERP solution that can improve business processes and productivity to a low cost over time. Jeeves Universal fits the bill, with a cost-efficient, agile solution,” said Olausson. “Together with our reseller partners we are proud to bring Jeeves Universal to the North American market, supported by a team of professionals to help customers get up and running quickly.”  

Jeeves currently has offices in France, Germany, the UK and Norway, with corporate headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.

The company is planning a Partner Welcome Event in Chicago in the beginning of October, 2012.  For more information about Jeeves Universal and reseller partnerships please contact allan.lessing@jeeveserp.com.

About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies.  Every day, Jeeves' ERP solutions; Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, are used by more than 4,600 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves' ERP systems are user friendly and easy to customize, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of business support.   Jeeves' head office is located in Stockholm and is owned by the American investment company Battery Ventures.  For more information, please visit www.jeeveserp.com.

metadata.dc:title: Students build ERP system app for Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Five students at Stockholm University are to spend four weeks building an ERP system app that will be launched on Jeeves Apps Market. The students have no previous experience of Jeeves. The aim of the project is to show how simple it is to build an app in Jeeves.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The students are on their third year of the bachelor’s program “ERP systems and service design” and have recently had a three-day introductory course in how Jeeves ERP systems’ technical architecture is structured and how it works. Andreas Nilsson is one of the initiators of the project and is a doctoral student at the Department of Computer and Systems Science at Stockholm University.

“The idea arose when we were discussing developments in the ERP systems industry, where Jeeves is on the cutting edge with its Apps Market,” says Nilsson. “Through the project, the students gain direct contact with the business community and the opportunity to see how it feels to produce a technical solution under real circumstances. They are naturally extremely keen to do a good job and get their teeth into Jeeves.”

Jeeves Apps Market was launched in spring 2011 and offers ERP apps developed by Jeeves’ partners and customers. The aim of the marketplace is to make it even simpler for customers to develop and maintain their ERP systems while the ability to upgrade is not affected.

“One of several advantages of Jeeves is that, as a customer, you can do a great deal yourself. The apps are an excellent example of Jeeves flexibility and how it is easy to share ERP solutions with others. During the course of the project, the students will be supervised by us at Jeeves, and the aim is for the app to be put up for sale on Jeeves Apps Market in the fall,” says Erik Mårtensson, International Sales Manager, Jeeves.

The results will be presented to Jeeves on Friday 12 October.

For more information, please contact:
Andreas Nilsson, doctoral student at the Department of Computer and Systems Science, Stockholm University.
+46 (0)8 16 13 45
an@dsv.su.se

Erik Mårtensson, International Sales Manager, Jeeves

metadata.dc:title: Reynolds Cycling Takes Business to Victory with Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: CHICAGO – August 14, 2012 – Reynolds Cycling, a manufacturer and distributor of high performance bicycle wheels, has chosen Jeeves Universal as their strategic business platform to integrate all aspects of their business into a single seamless platform for all of their business units. The announcement was made today by Jeeves Information Systems, a leading developer of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solutions for small and medium-sized businesses.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The solution was sold by Technology Partners and will be implemented by Jeeves Platinum Partner, Infocube.

Based in Utah, Reynolds Cycling is well known across North America and around the world as the premier supplier of the highest quality carbon fiber bicycle wheels. 

“Our business continues to become more global with respect to both the customer base as well as the footprint of our locations. The addition of a service center in Germany last year and the recent addition of Sales and Procurement offices in Taiwan increase our reach and our complexity significantly. For this reason we have taken a strategic decision that in order to grow more efficiently we had to move our business systems onto a single integrated platform with the functionality and flexibility needed to accommodate our complex business and growth expectations. Jeeves was our logical choice,” said Mike Dufner, CFO of Reynolds Cycling. “Our team evaluated many systems. We did our due diligence and spoke with existing Jeeves customers. It became very clear, very quickly that for flexibility, ease of use, total cost of ownership and to support our growth strategies – Jeeves was the superior solution for our needs.”

Reynolds Cycling will be implementing Jeeves with a complete functionality footprint of the core Jeeves Universal system including such features as CRM, intercompany transactions, SCM/logistics, production, service management, finance and business intelligence. 

“In today’s competitive market, I am very pleased that Jeeves, together with our partners Technology Partners and Infocube, has earned such an important industry leader as Reynolds Cycling as our customer. It is important for our continuous growth in the U.S. market,” said Bernt Olausson, President, Jeeves Information Systems Inc.

About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Every day, Jeeves' ERP solutions; Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, are used by more than 4,600 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves' ERP systems are user friendly and easy to customize, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of business support. Jeeves' head office is located in Stockholm and is owned by the American investment company Battery Ventures. For more information, please visit www.jeeveserp.com.

About Reynolds Cycling llc.
For over a century, the name Reynolds has stood for quality, design and performance in bicycle components, because we’re renowned for creating products that deliver a cycling experience unlike any other. The margin of victory has never been more acute—in competitive cycling or in business. Therefore, our passion for leadership drives us to continuously improve performance—in our products, our processes, and our customers. Whether you ride to live, or live to ride, you’ll experience a whole new level of performance and enjoyment on Reynolds wheels. For more information, please visit www.reynoldscycling.com.
