metadata.dc:title: Chinese car importers choose Garp
metadata.dc:description: Europe's fastest-growing ERP system supplier - Jeeves Information Systems - has via its subsidiary Microcraft sold the Garp ERP system to Cheman Auto. Cheman Auto is a Swedish importer of Chinese cars.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"We intend to go from zero to SEK 500 million in five years and need an ERP system that can grow at the same pace," says Anders Olevik, President of Cheman Auto.

Microcraft, with the ERP system Garp, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Jeeves Information Systems. With Garp, Jeeves covers the market for ERP systems with 5-30 users.

"With Garp, we can offer a competitive solution for growth companies. The customer starts with Garp. When the business expands, the customer can easily upgrade to Jeeves Enterprise," says Camilla Parneving, Marketing Director of Jeeves.

Cheman Auto is the first company in Scandinavia to import cars manufactured in China. The forecast is a turnover of approximately SEK 500 million within five years through activities such as the import of cars from Zhejiang Gonow Auto.

The sale was conducted together with GC Solutions. GC Solutions' so-called Growth Concept was a factor in CHEMAN AUTO AB's choice of Garp.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Q2 Jan-Jun 2007
metadata.dc:description: Turnover and earnings underwent positive development during the first six months. The second quarter, however, was somewhat poorer than expected. Market demand remains good. Prospects for autumn look promising.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
Stable development for Jeeves

January - June 2007

• Revenue totalled MSEK 63.5 (56.8) and increased by 12% (30)
• Program revenue (licensing and maintenance) increased by 10% (35)
• Net operating income was MSEK 5.6 (5.6) and the operating margin totalled 9% (10)
• Earnings after tax amounted to MSEK 5.2 (4.4) and the income margin was 8% (8)
• Per-share earnings after tax were SEK 1.7 (1.5)
• Cash flow was MSEK 6.1 (4.0) and liquid assets and short-term investments totalled MSEK 36.1 (32.2)
• A decision reached by the annual general meeting regarding an employee convertible program will be implemented
• 85% of the subsidiary in Germany was sold. The income from this will be reported during the next quarter

CEO comments on the results
During the first six months, turnover and earnings underwent stable development. The second quarter, however, was somewhat poorer than expected. Market demand remains good. Prospects for autumn look promising.

Our international efforts continue to bear fruit. The quarter had a number of highlights, such as the signing of two big contracts in France. Together with IBM, we entered into a large agreement with a French road-sign manufacturer. We entered into an agreement with ID Systems, which is a leading application supplier to the French wine industry and has approximately 450 customers. The company will develop it's next generation solution based on Jeeves.

Our efforts for the future focus on larger and larger customers, larger partners and partners in several countries. We are on our way from being a leading Swedish supplier to becoming a leading European player in our segment.


 

View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Selected brings Viking Beds of Sweden to the cutting edge
metadata.dc:description: Bed manufacturer Viking Beds of Sweden needed a modern ERP system with flexible variation management that allowed for continued international growth and could help ensure better coordination between the company’s production units. The company therefore opted for the Jeeves Selected ERP system. Jeeves’ partner EVRY One arranged the deal.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
“For us, being on the cutting edge of new technology and modern design goes without saying. Variation management is especially important, since it keeps track of everything from bed width to fabrics and legs. Jeeves Selected provides us with flexible variation management and ensures better coordination between our production units, making production more efficient. This is particular important in our case, since the manufacturing process begins straight after the customer has ordered a bed,” says Magnus Söderberg, President of Viking Beds of Sweden.

The bed manufacturer, based in Småland County, has two production units—one in Landsbro and one in Berga, and they have previously used two different ERP systems. By switching to Jeeves Selected, both production units will use the same business system, which is expected to ensure greater efficiency and coordination in production work.

Jeeves Selected is aimed at smaller companies whose ambition it is to grow and develop their business.

“Jeeves Selected suits us perfectly, since we need a flexible, user-friendly ERP system that allows for continued growth,” says Söderberg.

The deal consists of a group license for Jeeves Selected and covers aspects such as orders, production, purchasing, variation management, accounting and CRM (Customer Relationship Management). A total of 17 users will have access to the system, and implementation will begin during fall.

Viking Beds of Sweden has sales of just over SEK 70 million and employs 36 people. Its headquarters are in Landsbro, Småland County. Furniture company association Svenska möbelhandlare nominated Viking Beds of Sweden as the best brand of bed on the market, three years in a row. Viking Beds of Sweden was founded in 2002.

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Söderberg, President and Partner, Viking Beds of Sweden
+46 (0)705-43 34 29
magnus.soderberg@vikingbeds.se

Håkan Magnusson, Sales Manager, Jeeves Selected
+46 (0)704 80 18 61
hakan.magnusson@jeeves.se

About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Every day, more than 4,600 companies in over 40 countries use one of Jeeves' three ERP solutions: Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected or Garp. Our ERP systems are user friendly, easily customizable, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of business support. Jeeves’ headquarters is in Stockholm and the company is owned by American investment company Battery Ventures. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/us.

metadata.dc:title: Success for Jeeves 2.0 – 100 upgrades since March
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves’ new versions of its Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected ERP systems are off to a successful start. Since the upgrades were launched in mid-March, almost 100 customers have chosen to upgrade to Jeeves 2.0, and more than 40 are already fully commissioned.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected 2.0 became available to customers in mid-March. One of the almost 100 companies that have already upgraded is T-Emballage, a packaging and building supplies company. IT is high on the company’s agenda, and today 25%–30% of its IT budget is dedicated to maintenance, with the remainder for development. At most companies, the reverse is true.

“Jeeves is a company that truly delivers on its promises, especially when it comes to flexibility, adaptability and smooth upgrades. Since we purchased Jeeves in 1999, we have upgraded four times, and every time it has gone smoothly and satisfied vital needs at a reasonable price. The most recent time, this past March, was exceptional. We left the office on Friday and when we came back on Monday the upgrade had been implemented and we were able to use the system as usual,” says Hans Juhlin, responsible for ERP systems at T-Emballage. “Naturally, we have a little work to do in-house before we can make full use of all the new functionality. For example, we’re going to review our processes and use Jeeves’ functions for process support so we can use our ERP solution even better.”

Jeeves 2.0 contains an array of improvements and new functions, including a new built-in process-modeling tool for describing business processes and expanding the options for adapting menus and functionality to each user’s role in the company. In addition, the upgrade comes with the market’s most sophisticated variant management function, for handling sizes, colors, qualities and the like, such as for companies in the apparel industry.


For more information:
Magnus Sjökvist, Product Director, Jeeves Information Systems
+46-8-5870-9939, magnus.sjokvist@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Jeeves Information Systems AB develops Sweden’s most popular ERP system*. The products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, and Garp offer broad functionality at a cost of ownership among the lowest in the market. Customers currently include more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries. Since 1999, Jeeves has been listed on the small companies list of NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap). www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Bathroom equipment companies Aspen, INR and Sanka choose Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Swedish firms Aspen and INR and the Finnish firm Sanka have chosen to implement Jeeves Universal in their operations. The companies, which are members of the same corporation, intend to have a shared ERP system and pursue a process of continual transformation using this system. Jeeves’ partner Infocube arranged the transaction.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The transaction is a bundled product offering comprising everything from accounting, orders and production to inventory and sales. A total of 70 users are involved. The corporation, which also includes two sales companies located in Denmark and Norway, is owned by private equity firm CapMan.

”Jeeves Universal can easily be customized to our current business. Since we’ve been growing rapidly for a couple of years, we’re continually working to improve our organization and processes. Jeeves is an agile ERP system that supports our continuous transformation process over the long term, which is critical for us,” said Aspen IT and business developer Johannes Hermansson.

The implementation will begin this fall and will be completed around the end of the year. 

Aspen, INR and Sanka are part of a corporation that focuses on the design and production of bathroom furniture and shower solutions. Its primary market is the Nordic countries. The corporation was founded in 2010 and has approximately SEK 350 million in sales and 100 employees.

metadata.dc:title: Published by Jeeves North America: QBC systems joins Jeeves partner community
metadata.dc:description: QBC Systems, Inc., a well established business solutions consulting company headquartered in Amherst, New York, has chosen Jeeves as its strategic solutions partner. In May 2010 QBC and Jeeves North America finalized their agreement making QBC a Resale Partner for their Jeeves Universal ERP product.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
QBC Systems, Inc. – Experience proves that world-class software, services and support is critical to successful implementation and maximizing productivity.  That’s why QBC customers have the best of both worlds: products and services from the people who continuously support and enhance the software they are using.

Reliable systems and processes, a strong supporting infrastructure, and competitive programs and service offerings are essential to providing effective service.  But what really sets QBC Systems apart is the quality of the people QBC hires, trains, and deploys to deliver services to their customers. Their personnel truly become part of their customer’s workforce, motivated to provide what’s best for the customer. 

WHY WE CHOSE JEEVES

“Over the past several years, there has been a lot of consolidation in the software industry.  Many of the larger software providers are trying to consolidate their product lines and force their customers into a software package they want them to use, not necessarily the best product for them,” says Patrick J. McGovern, Jr., VP of QBC Systems.  “We needed a strong ERP software solution focused on manufacturing that would provide our customers an intimate business-to-business relationship, along with a company that would work closely with us and our customers, and we found these characteristics in Jeeves.”


 “With QBC joining the Jeeves “Circle of Friends” partner community, Jeeves North America adds another strong component to our North American strategy.” says Allan Lessing. “QBC has a built a highly respected ERP solutions practice in the upstate New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio area and to have them switching over to Jeeves as their ERP solution of choice is extremely exciting for us. QBC saw our strong value proposition and to have them take that message with their expertise forward into their market can only mean good things.”

metadata.dc:title: Hestra replaces Movex with Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Yet another Movex customer - Hestra Inredningar AB - chooses to replace its existing ERP system with Jeeves Enterprise. The deal, closed together with SYSteam Datakonsult, has a total order value of SEK 3.6 million.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The deal confirms that Jeeves Enterprise is Sweden's best ERP system for midsize companies," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales and Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

Hestra Inredningar, which has been in operation since 1900, is one of Sweden's oldest suppliers of shopfittings. For a long time, they entrusted management of their business-critical processes to the Movex ERP system (Intentia/Lawson), but now choose to replace this with Jeeves Enterprise. During the procurement process, the choice was between upgrading the existing ERP system or to choose something new from one of the large Swedish suppliers.

"We chose Jeeves Enterprise when our consolidated cost calculations showed that we would gain in functionality while reducing price per performance compared to an upgrade. Jeeves Enterprise also lowers our operating cost compared to our previous system," says Svante Leissner, CFO at Hestra.

Together with SYSteam, which is Jeeves Information Systems' biggest collaborative partner, Hestra evaluated which type of system support best suited their operations. Jeeves Enterprise was determined to be the best tool on the market. The project, which totals SEK 3.6 million, includes implementation of the Jeeves Enterprise ERP system, a new technical platform and training the employees in use of the system.

"Jeeves Enterprise is an extremely flexible standard system that makes it possible for us consultants to make adaptations based on the customers' unique needs. In Hestra Inredningar's case, the benefits of flexibility, cost effectiveness and adaptation to new business needs tipped the scales in favor of Jeeves. I am certain that we chose the right system support for both now and the future," says Daniel Aronsson, President of SYSteam in Anderstorp and Värnamo.

Jeeves Information Systems has made no secret of the fact that they are out after the customers of the three Is (Intentia, IFS and IBS). An our efforts have paid off. Customer after customer is choosing to replace their existing ERP system with Jeeves Enterprise. One of the foremost reasons that these customers switch is the lower operating costs of the ERP system. But, that's not all.

"We invested a lot of energy in the development of Jeeves Enterprise so that its functionality would meet the needs of midsize companies. Today, we have not only caught up with most ERP systems, we have surpassed them. In a time when many suppliers are reducing the number of offices and consultants in the vicinity of the customers, we do the opposite – we and our partners are growing in number and are getting closer and closer to our customers' operations. Customers like Hestra see this and at the same time become one of our strongest competitive advantages," says Lars Dahlberg.

The deal was taken up into the accounts by Jeeves Information Systems in 2006.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves board recommends distribution
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field: The board of Jeeves Information Systems recommends a standard dividend for 2006. In accordance with Jeeves' dividend policy, the board recommends a standard dividend of SEK 1 per share, corresponding to SEK 2,987,864.

metadata.dc:title: Published by Jeeves North America: New Partner Signing
metadata.dc:description: Infocube is a large European consulting and professional services firm. With their ‘Power your Passion’ philosophy, Infocube has been highly successful in their innovative and dynamic approach in providing high value solutions to their many customers. Based in Gothenburg and offices in other major Swedish centers Infocube has been achieving excellence with Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected since 1999. Infocube USA has established their US base in Chicago Illinois. In May 2011 Infocube and Jeeves finalized their agreement making Infocube the first transatlantic international Partner in the Jeeves Circle of Friends.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Infocube is more than a business consultant specializing in individual business system concepts. They have combined outstanding product with a unique mix of skills that guarantee the most flexible route to profitable business for their clients.

“Infocube is eagerly looking forward to contributing to the Jeeves Universal growing success story in North America - both in assisting existing and coming Partners as well as developing our own accounts in North America. In Europe our clients have invested in improving the corporate business processes together with us during the past years of tough economic times. The result is outstanding – our clients are in general today more efficient and profitable and well prepared for the future. We see continuous improvements being one core driver for success, and the companies that runs Jeeves do have a platform built for this. With this focus and with the Jeeves ERP we truly create business value over time” says Henrik Engberg, CEO of Infocube.

“Jeeves North America is excited to have Infocube join our North American partner community. Infocube has a deep and rich set of skills and will significantly raise the potential of an already impressive resource base in North America. Infocube will initially join our Circle of Friends as a services and mentoring partner adding a new dynamic to our aggressive North American expansion.” enthused Allan Lessing. “Jeeves Universal is increasingly different than other market offerings by being a highly flexible, adaptable, easy to use ERP solution that delivers an extremely attractive cost of ownership for its clients. With the agility of Jeeves and the extreme competence of Infocube we are looking forward to taking our North American achievements to the next level.”

Europe´s fastest growing supplier of ERP-systems*, Jeeves Information Systems AB develops ERP systems for companies within the manufacturing, trade, maintenance and service sectors. metadata.dc:title: Technology Partners Corp. has chosen Jeeves as its strategic Go-Forward partner
metadata.dc:description: Technology Partners Corp., an established consulting company in Atlanta, Georgia, has chosen Jeeves as its strategic Go-Forward partner in delivering high value-add enterprise solutions to its customers. In January 2011 Technology Partners and Jeeves finalized their agreement making Technology Partners a Reseller Partner of the Jeeves Universal ERP product.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Technology Partners, a software and services provider in Atlanta, Georgia and around the US, has significant industry experience and is backed by a team of highly experienced consulting professionals with large numbers of successful ERP implementations under their belts.  The Technology Partners organization is eagerly looking forward to being part of the Jeeves Universal growing success story in North America. 

Tough economic times necessitates a new way of thinking and a complete revamp of its strategic business tools if companies hope to seize increased market share.  4,250 companies in 41 countries around the globe have recognized Jeeves ERP as their strategic business enabler and most cost effective choice in making their business smarter. “We are passionate about helping our clients deliver the ROI on their projects.   Widespread change is driving a need for simpler applications that can be implemented quickly and stay up-to-date with easy upgrades all without costing an arm and a leg in this economy.  Jeeves Universal can do this and it makes a smart investment look even smarter when Universal is up and delivering results.” Says David Warford, President of Technology Partners.

“Jeeves North America is excited to have Technology Partners choosing Jeeves Universal as their sole ERP solution to represent.” says Allan Lessing. “Jeeves Universal has significant advantages over other market offerings - flexible, adaptable, expandability, a particularly easy to use ERP solution that delivers an extremely attractive cost of ownership for its clients. Companies are looking for solutions that quickly allow them to maximize competitive advantage and we are pleased that Technology Partners recognized these key differentiators in making their decision.”

metadata.dc:title: The ERPPRO Group LLC has chosen Jeeves as strategic partner
metadata.dc:description: The ERPPRO Group LLC, a Fort Myers (Florida) based IT consulting firm, has chosen Jeeves as strategic partner in order to supply its customers with high value-add ERP solutions. In October 2011 The ERPPRO Group and Jeeves finalized their agreement making The ERPPRO Group a Reseller Partner of the Jeeves Universal ERP product.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Already the fastest growing ERP software in Europe, the Jeeves platform brings a new combination of up-to-date technology with established full-featured offerings and serves a wide range of businesses, from manufacturers to service industries. 

With Jeeves being easier to install, maintain and work with, businesses can see immediate return on the IT investment – and with today’s economy, companies no longer have millions of dollars to spend on projects that may take years to complete. Best of all, Jeeves offers a scale-able platform that can take a business from a very small initial startup to literally hundreds of users without prohibitive upgrade expenses.

“At The ERPPRO Group, we have significant industry experience and have been involved in many successful ERP implementations over the last 15+ years. We are eagerly looking forward to being part of the Jeeves Universal growing phenomena.” says Roger Jonsson, President & Sales for The ERPPRO Group.

“Jeeves North America is excited that The ERPPRO Group has chosen Jeeves Universal as their sole ERP solution to sell and to support.” says Allan Lessing. “We see Jeeves Universal as being a highly flexible ERP solution that delivers an extremely attractive cost of ownership for its clients. metadata.dc:title: Life science company LinkMed chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Life science company LinkMed has chosen Jeeves Universal as its new ERP system for its own business operations and for its subsidiaries Olerup SSP AB and AbSorber AB. The deal was arranged by Jeeves’ partner Omnilog.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The deal consists of a bundled product offering that includes inventory, purchasing, production, orders, invoicing, accounting, and project management.

“At the same time as we changed our focus, we decided to review our ERP systems. Using a single ERP system for the entire organization has many advantages. Jeeves Universal supports our global organization, is flexible, and boosts our efficiency,” says Yvonne Axelsson, CFO, LinkMed.

Consultants from Jeeves’ partner Omnilog will implement the solution, which is expected to be ready in spring 2011.

“Omnilog has really succeeded in demonstrating the synergies LinkMed will gain by using one ERP system throughout its organization. We are proud to have LinkMed as our new customer,” says Johan Krantz, Sales Director, Jeeves Universal.

LinkMed has 10 portfolio companies in pharmaceuticals research, biotechnology, diagnostics, and medical technology. The subsidiaries Olerup SSP and AbSorber conduct research, development, and production in the field of transplantation. LinkMed is listed on the small companies list of NASDAQ OMX Stockholm (Small Cap).

metadata.dc:title: Dutch fashion firm L.ten Cate chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: L.ten Cate designs and sells swimwear and lingerie under brands such as WOW, Ten Cate and Tweka. The fashion firm has chosen the industry solution Jeeves For Fashion to optimize their design process and improve their work processes. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ Dutch partner JIS Nederland.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
L.Ten Cate has been a major force in the Dutch fashion industry for decades.

“It’s important for us to be able to manage many different details, colors, sizes and fabrics smoothly and efficiently. Our old Movex ERP system was becoming outdated, and so we needed a new and up-to-date ERP system solution that would organize everything and keep up with our needs as we grow. Jeeves For Fashion was developed for the fashion industry and it’s perfect for us since the solution is flexible, user-friendly and meets all of our needs,” said Renze de Graaf, ICT Manager at L.Ten Cate.

Jeeves For Fashion comprises licenses for the Jeeves ERP Fashion ERP system and the Jeeves Design Management PDM system. This industry-specific solution provides L.Ten Cate with total support for its entire organization, encompassing production, logistics, accounting and sales.

Jeeves Design Management is a PDM (Product Data Management) system that supports the entire design process, from sketching to sample collection and sales. The system is linked with the ERP system Jeeves ERP, as well as with external software programs such as Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator and various CAD programs.

For more information, please contact:
Ingela Cronholm-Edgren, Sales Manager Jeeves Design Management
+44 (0)33- 444 129
Ingela.C-Edgren@jeeves.se

 

About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Every day, Jeeves' ERP solutions; Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, are used by more than 4 600 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves' ERP systems are user friendly and easy to customize, and at the same time optimal for continuous improvement of business support. Jeeves' head office is located in Stockholm and is owned by the American investment company Battery Ventures. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en

metadata.dc:title: Norwegian Hytorc Norge AS opts for Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Hytorc is a distributor and manufacturer of hydraulic torque and tension tools. Its customer base covers the oil, petrochemical, wind power and heavy industries. Hytorc chose Jeeves’ ERP system solution with the aim of gaining an overview of its operations. Jeeves’ partner Merit Consulting is behind the deal.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The deal consists of a group license for Jeeves Universal and includes purchasing, logistics, stock, sales and accounting, along with product management, service, leasing and support for training activities. Industry-specific functionality in terms of service and leasing has been developed specially for the offshore industry by Merit Consulting via Jeeves Apps Teknologi.

“As Hytorc not only distributes and manufactures tools but also offers product development, service, leasing and staff training, we needed an ERP system that could provide an overarching solution. Merit’s industry-specific solution meets our needs and can also be developed further as Hytorc changes and grows,” says Christer Djuve, Vice President of Hytorc.

Previously, Hytorc worked with several systems and manual routines, which is why a great deal of time is expected to be saved when the ERP system solution is implemented in November 2012. The new solution also allows for better control of work processes for calibration and equipment leasing.

“Merit Consulting has extensive experience of working with companies in the offshore business, so they’ve been able to put together an industry-specific solution that meets all of Hytorc’s needs. With Jeeves as their ERP system, Hytorc can be safe in the knowledge that they have a user-friendly, modern and flexible solution that will streamline the business,” says Johan Krantz, sales director for Jeeves Universal.

Hytorc has annual sales of NOK 130 million and 37 employees in Norway, Sweden and Denmark.


For more information, please contact:
Christer Djuve, Vice President, Hytorc Norge AS
+47 (0)97 00 81 44
christer@hytorc.no

Johan Krantz, Sales Director, Jeeves Universal
+46 (0)704 801 867
johan.krantz@jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves completes acquisition in Norway
metadata.dc:description: ERP system supplier Jeeves completes the acquisition of all shares in the Norwegian Logistikk-og-IT Partner A/S (LogIT Gruppen).
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
After conducting due-diligence, Jeeves takes over all shares in the Norwegian LogIT Gruppen. The purchase price has been specified to a cash payment equivalent of 6,2 MNOK. In addition, there is a payment linked to established income objectives during 2008-2010. If these are met, a payment of another 8 MNOK will take place. The acquisition is self-financed.

The acquisition agreement is a result of the letter of intent that was signed on May 14, 2008. (Please refer to previous press release dated May 14, 2008). The take-over will be effective as of June 2, 2008.

Norska LogIT Gruppen owns, develops and sells ERP systems with the emphasis on the small and midsize companies on the Norwegian market. The deal is an important step in Jeeves’ growth strategy and signifies a strengthening of its position on the Norwegian market.

In 2007, the LogIT Gruppen had a turnover of 30 MNOK and the number of employees was 20. The company has offices in Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim and Molde. The acquisition is estimated to increase Jeeves’ annual turnover with around 35 MSEK and to have a positive effect on earnings per share.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, tel: +46-8-587 099 00
E-mail: bengt.algevik@jeeves.se

Tore Husby, CEO LogIT Gruppen, tel +47-957-50-429
E-mail: tore.husby@logitgruppen.no

metadata.dc:title: OneMed expands with Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information System (“Jeeves”) has through its partner SYSteam received an order for implementation of Jeeves Universal for 250 users from the Finish OneMed Group, a leading distributor of medical products in Northern Europe.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
– With our extensive expansion and high ambition to serve customers even better, we have high expectations on our ERP system. We realized that Jeeves Universal fulfils our requirements. At the same time, SYSteam has shown great understanding of our business. Their experience of other logistics companies has been a determining factor in our decision making process, says Tapio Teppo, Head of ERP Development at the OneMed Group.

The OneMed Group markets, sells and imports a range of basic and specialist medical products within medical and health care, as well as laboratory and diagnostics products and equipment within biotechnical care. The OneMed Group has its own sales companies in the Nordic countries, the Baltic States and Poland. OneMed has around 700 employees and its pro forma net sales for financial year 2007 were approximately EUR 320 million.

 – With great competition from other important players, we have received yet another strategically important customer in need of a powerful ERP system for international logistics. OneMed has the potential to become one of Jeeves’ largest  installations. This proves our competitiveness even within advanced logistics, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves.

The order was signed through Jeeves´ partner SYSteam. The system used at OneMed will be based on the latest version of Jeeves Universal for logistics and ICT for internal transactions between companies within the OneMed Group. 

– OneMed´s decision to choose Jeeves shows that our extensive business experience and understanding of complex logistics installations in combination with the best tool on the market turns Jeeves Universal into a very competitive alternative, says Bo Oskarsson, Marketing Director at SYSteam.

For more information, please contact: 

Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves, tel: +46 (0)8 587 099 00

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves users are doing it everywhere
metadata.dc:description: In taxis, elevators, and hallways. Soon Jeeves users can work wherever and whenever they like. Today Jeeves is launching its new “Jeeves Insight” client at the Jeeves World customer event. Customers have given their input during the development process, bringing usability to a whole new level.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
”In a new approach to development, we’ve involved end users throughout the entire development process. The result is a new graphical user interface – Jeeves Insight. Now customers can work wherever and whenever they like, from several different platforms, doing their jobs just as well on the patio at home as at the office,” said Jeeves product manager Magnus Sjökvist.

As more and more of a company’s employees use the ERP system, usability has become increasingly important.

“It’s extremely important for ERP systems to be easy to use and quickly adaptable to the customer’s business. Jeeves has had one of the most flexible user interfaces on the market for a long time. Jeeves Insight increases accessibility, and we’ve taken a big step forward in user friendliness.”

During the development process end users were able to continually test both the client’s user experience and user friendliness, and to suggest improvements. The results include clear navigation and a clean design.

“Our goal was to create a client that further improves users’ efficiency based on their own wishes. We at Jeeves, our partners and our users feel we’ve succeeded,” said Sjökvist.

Jeeves Insight does not require installation or downloads – all you need is an Internet connection.

Jeeves is launching its Jeeves Insight product on September 13-14 at the Jeeves World customer event.

For more information, please contact:
Magnus Sjökvist, Jeeves Product Manager
+46 8 587 099 39
magnus.sjokvist@jeeves.se

Jeeves in brief
Jeeves Information Systems AB (Jeeves) develops ERP systems for small and midsized companies. Each day, more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries use one of Jeeves’ ERP systems: Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, or Garp. All products offer broad functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. The head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and Jeeves’ shares have been listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se/en.

metadata.dc:title: Norwegian Merit and Swedish Jeeves will grow together
metadata.dc:description: Merit Universal AB, a company within the Norwegian Merit Group, today signs partnership agreement with Jeeves Information Systems. The collaboration will entail sales and implementation of the Jeeves´ ERP solution in the Nordic market.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Merit has, with some 150 business and application consultants, so far focused on
ERP-system Movex/M3. The consultants are based in Norway, Sweden, Denmark,
Finland and the UK. Merit has extensive experience of business development for
companies within the manufacturing and distribution industry. The aim of the
partnership is to broaden activities toward new customer groups.

- With the market´s most successful product concepts, we see great
opportunities for continued growth. One of the greatest challenges facing our
customers today is the high rate of change worldwide alongside with being
restricted by their systems. We offer customers efficient possibilities for
operational change with the combination of Jeeves´ flexible ERP solution and
Merit´s business expertise, "says Mikael Brodin, president Merit Universal.

of global ERP solutions, will become an important sales channel for
Jeeves in the upper SME segment in the Nordic market, says Bengt-Åke
Älgevik, CEO at Jeeves Information Systems.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves appoints new CEO of Norwegian subsidiary
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves has appointed Torulf Nilsson as CEO of its Norwegian subsidiary LogIT Gruppen, effective as of February 1, 2009. Torulf Nilsson most recently held a position at Lawson, where he was a member of the Norwegian management team.

base, says Jan Torulf Nilsson.

metadata.dc:title: The Fresh Company started up business parallel to the implementation of Jeeves Enterprise
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems is proud to announce that SYSteam got Jeeves Enterprise up and running at The Fresh Company parallel to the start-up phase of the company itself.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The implementation is a dress rehearsal for JIA and is unique for Jeeves Enterprise," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales & Marketing Director at Jeeves Information Systems.

 The Fresh Company is a newly started company. Operations were started in the late spring of 2006. The business concept is to offer Swedish consumers Sweden's only fresh juice, that is to say juice from oranges, blood oranges, clementines, grapefruit, lemons, limes and carrots that is not heat treated or preserved. Because the life of the products is based on the press time and the sell-by date, the ERP system with its warehouse and distribution functionality plays a decisive role.

"We needed to get a fully functional ERP system up in running while at the same time starting up our business. SYSteam's selling points for Jeeves Enterprise as the best-suited ERP system based on the tight project time combined with our demands for an advanced distribution solution proved to be in harmony. The project flowed perfectly and we now have the exact support in the ERP system that our business requires," says Peter Josefsson, President of The Fresh Company.

SYSteam is one of Jeeves Information Systems' biggest collaborative partners. They have developed a quick and slimmed implementation environment and methodology for Jeeves Enterprise that they call QS3. QS3 comprises standardized and preconfigured components and tools that speed up the implementation process. Based on The Fresh Company's conditions, needs and expectations, they chose to conduct the project using QS3.

"The entire project took less than three months. We had to work from the ground up while the business was being started at the same time. Then add the fact that we also created an extremely advanced distribution solution for The Fresh Company and there is nothing more to say other than that the total solution is a success," says Ulf Ström, Project Manager at SYSteam.

Earlier in autumn, Jeeves Information Systems launched its new implementation package Jeeves Implementation Accelorator (JIA), which is designed to streamline implementation. JIA is a further refinement of SYSteam's QS3 and was developed by Jeeves Information System in cooperation with SYSteam and ISE Konsult.

"You could say that The Fresh Company project was in many respects a dress rehearsal for JIA. With The Fresh Company, SYSteam showed that a standardized implementation methodology is extremely profitable for both the customer and our collaborative partners. Not only does it make projects go faster, but it also increases the quality of projects. JIA is the melody of the future and a winner for all involved," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales and Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

metadata.dc:title: Nordomatic chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems is proud to announce that Nordomatic has chosen Jeeves Enterprise for its business-critical processes. The deal, closed by SYSteam, has a total order value of SEK 2.7 million.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
Nordomatic is an engineering and contracting firm in the property automation sector. Since its start in 1967, Stockholm-based Nordomatic has developed and installed control and regulation equipment and property automation systems for the Swedish property market.

Nordomatic operations are in an extremely expansive phase, which requires changes such as replacement of the existing ERP system with Jeeves Enterprise.

"We have reached a point in our operations where a modern and flexible ERP system is a requirement for us to be able to continue developing. We chose Jeeves Enterprise because its functionality makes it possible for us to integrate all of our processes - from design to service and aftermarket," says Robert Rennel, President of Nordomatic. "We chose SYSteam as supplier because of their great commitment and deep company knowledge."

The total order value amounts to SEK 2.7 million. The deal was closed by SYSteam, Jeeves Information Systems' biggest partner. Nordomatic will implement Jeeves Enterprise for functions such as Accounting, Production, Order/Invoicing, Inventory, MPS and CRM. The modules will be integrated with Nordomatic's self-developed configurator. The solution will be supplemented by over 30 users having access to Jeeves Enterprise via PDAs.

"The solution being implemented at Nordomatic is exciting. We are integrating all business processes in the three subsidiaries to a single unit. This gives Nordomatic a clear and distinct total picture of its operations. Their employees also get a completely new mobile platform for their work tasks through Jeeves Enterprise via PDAs. A more modern IT solution for a forward-thinking service company just cannot be found on the market," says Mikael Brodin, Unit Manager for Jeeves Enterprise at SYSteam Datakonsult Stockholm AB.

The deal with Nordomatic is a breakthrough for Jeeves Information Systems in the service sector with SYSteam as its partner. Nordomatic's business concept is based developing and maintaining customer-specific solutions, which places great demands on the flexibility of the IT support system. The deal with Nordomatic shows that Jeeves Enterprise is well developed for service-intense industries.

"Jeeves Enterprise is better than most ERP systems when it comes to integration. This combined with Jeeves Enterprise's inherent flexibility enables us to create solutions that are effective and profitable for the customers. We are pleased that Nordomatic discovered our advantages and that yet another Swedish midsize company has chosen Jeeves Enterprise to continue it business development," says Lars Dahlberg Sales & Marketing Director for Jeeves Information Systems.

The deal was taken up into the accounts by Jeeves Information Systems in fiscal year 2006.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves takes over the channel development in Germany
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves has terminated its co-operation with the German Master Partner and has chosen to take over the operations themselves until further notice. The development of the German partner network continues.
metadata.dc:creator: admin
metadata.field:
Jeeves started the Master Partner operations in Germany last year and has reached the conclusion that it is in the best interest for both parties to terminate the co-operation. Jeeves’ assessment right now is that the partner network will develop faster under it´s own auspices by taking over the relevant German staff.

Jeeves’ sales and implementation outside Sweden is run by a global partner network that today includes around 70 partners worldwide. Jeeves has had representation in Germany since 1998 and a co-operation agreement was signed with the current partner during 2005.

- Our assessment is that the settlement will not affect us financially during the next six months, neither regarding income nor revenues. We have a considerable experience of partner co-operation and the liquidation of the German co-operation has been handled well, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO at Jeeves.


For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, tel: 08 587 099 00

In Sweden partners are represented on 20 locations.

metadata.dc:title: SCAN COIN chooses Jeeves for increased productivity
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves' partner InfoCube has entered into an agreement with an international big player. Jeeves receives order for group licensing from SCAN COIN. SCAN COIN is a world leader in the cash processing industry. The company is currently in an expansion phase, which sets high requirements for an ERP system with great flexibility, upgradeability and scalability.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"With Jeeves, we anticipate significant opportunities for improved productivity. In this expansion phase that SCAN COIN is in, we need an ERP system that is both flexible and upgradable," says Kjell Andersson, President of SCAN COIN Industries AB.

SCAN COIN was founded in 1966 and is now a leading supplier of cash processing equipment, system solutions and services. The company is currently represented in over 100 countries via own market companies or distributors.

Jeeves will be primarily implemented in SCAN COIN's Swedish operations.

"It will be exciting to follow SCAN COIN out into the world. The ERP system is the heart of the customers' business. Continual development of the business requires an ERP system that is flexible, easy to upgrade and cost effective," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Manager at Jeeves.

The deal was struck by Jeeves' partner InfoCube.

"SCAN COIN needs a flexible ERP system like Jeeves for its continued expansion - a system that can be continually upgraded to generate administrative efficiency and a competitive edge. This is Jeeves' strength over its competitors," " says Jonas Hammarberg, Marketing and Sales Director at InfoCube.

Many companies fail to upgrade their ERP systems, which leads to lost productivity and reduced profits. This conclusion was reached in a study conducted by Radar Group International during February and March of 2007 via in-depth interviews at 253 Swedish companies and organizations who have had their ERP systems since the start of the new millennium.

The study, which compares the ERP systems IBS ASW, IFS, Jeeves, Movex (Lawson, formerly Intentia) and SAP, shows that upgrade cost is usually up to EUR 5,000 per workplace. This is the primary reason that companies fail to upgrade their ERP system. The exception is Jeeves, where the equivalent costs is about EUR 200. According to the study, because of this Jeeves' customers update their ERP systems more often than the customers of other suppliers.

"InfoCube has solid experience in implementing Jeeves nationally and internationally at the customers and stands for quality and longevity," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Manager at Jeeves.


 

View as PDF

metadata.dc:title: CareTech chooses Jeeves for international expansion
metadata.dc:description: Powerful logistics functionality and the possibility of an international roll-out made the difference when the Swedish company CareTech, market leader in alarm and safety products, chose the Jeeves Universal ERP system.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
CareTech, currently in a vigorous expansionary phase, operates in 15 countries and has its head office in Kalix, Sweden. CareTech is the global leader in digital “care alarms.” The analogue telecom networks around Europe are being replaced by digital communication and IP telephony. Replacing the analogue equipment is estimated to generate business worth hundreds of millions of euro.

- “We were looking for an ERP system that could support the company’s growth and sales processes in those countries where we do business. A professional communication platform that places the customer in the center is the key to success. In combination with a powerful e-commerce solution, this was a major factor when we unanimously chose Jeeves Universal,” says CareTech CEO Arto Brushane and CFO Kerstin Lundqvist.

- “Now we’ll have the functionality and support that we need for logistics, traceability, and e-commerce that are utterly critical for us. In addition, we’re getting a system that can handle our international markets. The implementation of Jeeves will influence how we structure our organization, and I can already see that we will become much more efficient in our tasks,” Kerstin Lundqvist says.

Jeeves Universal will initially be implemented at CareTech’s units in Sweden and Germany, after which it will eventually be used in the business operations in other countries.

- “We are proud of the trust CareTech has placed in us and look forward to an exciting implementation project and a long-lasting relationship,” says Thomas Lundberg of SYSteam, from Skellefteå, Sweden, which sold and will introduce the system into CareTech’s operations.

For more information:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director, Jeeves Information Systems
+46-8-5870-9968, lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Thomas Lundberg, SYSteam Skellefteå
+46-910-717-600, thomas.lundberg@systeam.se, www.systeam.se

The products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, and Garp offer broad functionality at a cost of ownership among the lowest in the market. Customers currently include more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries. Since 1999, Jeeves has been listed on the small companies list of NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap). www.jeeves.se

We have invested well in our products and our organization. Our position has become stronger along with our opportunity to grow with improved profitability.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Q2 Jan-Jun 2009
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves stands strong
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
January–June 2009

• Revenue totaled SEK 90.8 million (73.3), up 24% (16)

• Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) rose 9% (11)

• Operating profit was SEK 8.1 million (8.6), the operating margin 9% (12)

• Profit after tax was SEK 7.4 million (6.0), the profit margin 8% (8)

• Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 2.6 (2.1)

• Cash flow was SEK 2.7 million (4.7), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 41.0 million (41.0)

• The equity/assets ratio was 33% (30)


CEO’s comment on performance during the period
 
Jeeves is showing its strengths and managing well, despite a weak market with fewer transactions and harsh competition. Sales grew 24% (16), and the operating margin of 9% (12) was in line with our target. Software revenues (maintenance and licenses) advanced 9% (11). Consultancy’s share of revenues expanded, resulting in a slightly lower operating margin.

The influx of new customers is steady, and I am pleased to report that many of the new transactions we expected to secure this quarter were achieved. It is also pleasing that our foreign partners contributed half of all new customers during the quarter.

Looking to the third quarter, I anticipate some customers will delay their decisions to invest. Jeeves is well positioned, though, with an offer that is highly flexible and has a low cost of ownership that appeals to customers. We have a promising list of prospects.
